comments.comment: Most cars in the right lane are heading back into the city. If you're trying to leave the city better to be on the other side of the road - it's possible because there is an entrance to a car parking there.

Not really good to be on the left lane, the entrance is narrow and cars are reluctant to drive into the parking. Like this you'll only have a chance when the cars stop on the red light.

Maybe it works better to stand before the bus stop, many cars are still changing lanes and if they see you early they can still stop at the bus stop.

Anyway, we (2 ppl) tried many things here waiting for two hours without success in rush hour.
Direction Villefranche/Dijon/Paris: I waited 10 meters bevor the bus stop with a sign saying 'Villefranche'. I got picked up after 30 minutes.

I tried on the left line to go south during wednesday morning. The spot is not very good since cars can't really stop except for the red light, however after around 15 minutes a car stopped anyway and took us to the next petrol station from where it was very easy to find a ride further south.

en_UK.description: South: bus stop makes a good spot for cars to pull over. Being very animated seems to speed up wait times.

comments.comment: As correctly mentioned, to go South you should first go North to the A49 and then through Valence.  This is a difficult spot because there are cars coming from and going to all directions at the intersection, and there is no place to pull over on the ramp to the highway.  So take a pick on which traffic light to stand by and good luck!

en_UK.description:
From here, easy to get to the Peage, and then either go to Lyon or Valence. 
Going to Valence is good if you want to go south.
(2006)

comments.comment:
Bad place to go on the A7. We arrive there at 7am. Ask everyone. A lot of people go on the A47. We found a guy and after 15m and be quite pushy he accept.
At least, there is a tree at the exit of the station to hide from the sun.

en_UK.description: Good Gas Station, but not easy to get there from center with city transportation. More info on hitchwiki.org

fr_FR.description:
Dernière station essence avant la séparation de Givors A47/A7. 
Beaucoup de voiture pour St Étienne.

en_UK.description: Strangely, amways got stuck here, trying to get something direction Paris. Other directions seemed better.

fr_FR.description: Plutôt sympa pour la direction de Paris ou de Lyon.

comments.comment: a bus can leave you just up on the parking
this is not the right place, it's just 100 meters to the north at the roundabout

en_UK.description:
perfect place.
direction: La Rochelle, Bordeaux.

it was funny to hitchhike on an island. it worked.
direction: out (: .

This spot can be very good to get a ride of a truck-driver. I just tried it once but after 5mins. a french boarder-guard came to chat with me about the topic of hitchhiking and he showed much solidarity, no hassle whatsoever with him. Only a view minutes later, a truck-driver pulled over and took me with him. Best spot is near the payment-machines, there's a pedestrian-crossing and truck-drivers will frequent this spot with and without their vehicle. - joschobart, 07-12-12.
No possibilities for car to stop, too dense truck traffic
Only one part of the traffic so it is slow, but hitching the entrance of the highway of the roundabout was impossible. It worked and I did my way out of Lausanne

comments.comment: Easy to find lifts East or West...

en_UK.description: Best point to reach if you can't make it direct out of Switzerland into France, Just need to ask the trucks or foreign cars

comments.comment:
Need a sign to go to Lyon, cause most of the people are heading to Geneva.

A lot are just going to Saint Julien. Go with them and stop at the "rond point" at the exit of the highway, then go to the entrance. All the people at this point might go quite far ;)
A lot are just going to Saint Julien.

en_UK.description: To Lyon, Not the best spot of the area for sure, but I stood on top of the little hill with a sign and pointed out that there is place (which the driver can't see beforehand) for a car to pull over to pick you up, at the entrance of the highway by the roundabout and got a ride direct

comments.comment: Senseles and dangerous spot  while there is a great spot closer to the cardo  tram spot already put on the map

en_UK.description: Good spot to go to Rennes !
Only one way for cars to get off the island! Great spot, both ourselves and another guy got a lift in under 15 minutes!
gas station here.
i waited about 2,5 hours at this peage station in order to get in direction east...most drivers heading to lyon or paris...also there is not much traffic
To Hitchhike from les herbiers to cholet, nantes, angers, it's the best spot i know. i've never waited more than 10 min (with a sign)
Excellent spot from cholet to nantes or rennes.

I waited fairly long and finally got a ride to the next peage on the A42. But there I waited an hour or so. Only local cars. So I tramped back to town and took the A6.

One should definetely take the A6 when heading north.

comments.comment: Huge gas-station/rest area with loads of cars. Cars from Germany/Holland/Belgium to be found here. Don't get lost on this one :)
Stopped twice here going north, always found a ride easily.

en_UK.description: Service station on German side.You can get lifts up north to Karlsruhe or further. Much trucks from South stop here to sleep overnight to go further north.
An average place to hitchhike in direction of Geneva. There is a bus stop before the on ramp (Bourdonette, also a metro stop!) and in the morning it is quite easy to get picked up.

comments.comment: Also usable when going to Bern
I have been living in Lausanne and this is definitely the best place to hitchhike around. Depend on your direction use a sign with Geneva, Yverdon, Montreux or Bern.

en_UK.description: A decent place to hitchhike when going to Geneva or France. Bus stop Boudonnette, also metro.
Good for going to Bern/German-speaking Switzerland or Yverdon/Neuchatel. Crosswalk makes traffic slow down and plenty of space to slow down. Bus stop Blecherette.

comments.comment: Station maudite. Be carefull.

en_UK.description: Birectionnal Services, good place to reach North of Clermont and South of Vichy.

Even if hitching work in direction North, it takes way too long with only short ride, and the Highway access in Gien isn't the best place to catch a ride further North. It's better to try reaching the highway from Bourges through another road.
To Bourges, from the motorway. Note that a driver can regain the motorway before the toll making it more easy for them to drop you off at the Bourges Exit

comments.comment: At 5PM, lots of people leaves their workplace to come back to France. Very good place.

Not sure if I was here or at the French/Swiss Border Control but cars going to France have to slow down at these booths and there is a tiny parking just afterwards - great spot. Many people go to Mulhouse etc.

en_UK.description: To Mullhouse, to Kolmar, to Strasbourg.  There is a parking lot imedeatly after a boarder - some cars stop there. Boarderguards are not very openminded - they say thats it is forbiden to hhike on the highway (even if it is a begining), but you can do it on a parking place..:) So write down on a big hhiker's plate your Destination goal and    wait on a parking slot, people will notice that you are hhiker and will stop after a while.:) Be polite with boarderguards!:)

comments.comment: A very good spot for Lyon
super spot
excellent spot for lyon or valence. Just after the tramway line, there is a lot of space for the people to stop.

Very nice place to get a ride to Valence (SOuth) or Lyon-Paris (North). As mentioned by Yasintoda, broad a sign right after the tramway line. 
Get out the tramway E after crossing the river or ask people Porte de France

en_UK.description: Here many cars get into the highway to Lyon-Paris. There is enough space for them to park with safety. Somebody may took you to the petrol station just before the peage, and once you are there, you will travel fast.

fr_FR.description: Se rendre à la Porte de France (Esplanade). Se placer au niveau du feu, juste avant l'entrée de l'autoroute. De là, la bonne solution est d'avoir un panneau "Péage", pour ensuite faire du stop au péage de Voreppe, c'est très efficace.

comments.comment: The place is not bad, of course better than "Weil am Rhein". So if you want to go in northern direction (Germany) better choose this place. We waited about half an hour, then we got a lift to Karlsruhe.

en_UK.description:
Gas station Pratteln

Excellent place, a lot of cars towards germany and france. Possibility to cross the street to opposite direction.

comments.comment: Waited more than 2 hours to get a lift towards Basel.
It's better to Bern

en_UK.description:
Gas station Gunzgen

Most cars towards Bern, some towards Basel. Würenlos might be the better choice towards Basel, but anyways, it's well possible here to get a ride

comments.comment: wated more then 4 hours, to find a ride to sankt gallen directon germany, but we where 2 people and over lunch time a lot of people just go there to eat  between 11-3
hardly any traffic going south

en_UK.description:
Gas station Würelos

Dir: Zürich

We found a ride to the city pretty fast here.

Possibility to cross the street to opposite direction.

Gas station Würelos

I guess a great place towards Basel, if you're hitching with someone who is heading towards Bern it is propably better to get of here than in Gunzgen

Possibility to cross the street to opposite direction.

Gas station Deitingen

Great towards Zürich/Basel, opposite direction propably as well.

comments.comment: closed as of may 2013 - northbound only
Still construction works as of October 2013: only one side is open, BUT traffic in both ways, works just fine!
I got a car straight to Zürich after about 30min asking around (not at the gas station, but at the picknick area).

Got a car for two direction Zurich after only 10 min of asking in front of the new shop.
Both directions have now reopended by the way

en_UK.description:
Gas station Grauholz

Perfect hitchhiking place with possibility for cars to turn around.

Dir.: South

Enough space for cars to stop and official road to Fribourg, but most people actually take the shortcut wich leaves some hundred meters earlier

comments.comment: I think not a little room for cars... especially, if you move a bit below, there the lane getting wider.

en_UK.description:
Dir.: North

Little room for cars to stop, not too much traffic, but propably best place in Fribourg anyways

comments.comment: I stood there for approx. 40 min and got a ride (female).
There is no very big traffic on a gas station, but you can easily find a car going south (dir. Montreux). I think the spot is good.

en_UK.description: Not much traffic at this gas station, and people go anywhere but your direction

comments.comment: It's quite difficult to find a car. I waited for 25 min and after someone took me to Saintes.
Few cars on this motorway. Petrol stations are very quiet. I was hitching to Nantes, most cars going to La Rochelle. Finally i got a direct car, but i waited 45mn.

en_UK.description: It seems a really good spot because it is a big station, but when we arrived there nobody stopped us
In this point you can find someone for taking you to Nantes
Interesting point for leaving Nantes and going to Paris
Good for going to Angers, Le Mans or Paris... if someone can carry you until there

comments.comment:
I intended to go to Le Mans, and I was stuck there for almost 3 hours ! It was a saturday of August, so summer holydays, and few cars stopped there -mostly people going to Angers's center or doing some shopping around there- because it's a little oil service station and there is no place to stop to eat. I finally got a lift to the western side of Angers, near the petrol station.
I think (though I did not experience yet) that it's a better deal when, coming from Nantes, to jop out at the precedent oil station. 
Otherwise, you can take a lift to Angers' center and then try to reach the western oil station by bus.

en_UK.description: Good for going to Paris

comments.comment: I got there at 3:30pm and got a ride just after 4pm. I reckon this spot works.
Ich kam um 15:30 an, fuhr um 16:00 ab. Diese Lage geht.

en_UK.description:
Great place for direction Solothurn, Basel, Zurich.
Take bus no. 11 to the last station. You can use a short distance ticket for 2,- CHF.

comments.comment: I waited an hour and a half here before rain clouds rolled in and I headed for the train to Basel.  I'm not sure why my luck was so bad here because virtually all the freeway from Zurich to Basel is getting on the freeway here. Good luck but be prepared to wait. Maybe its just because hitching out of cities can be a challenge.
Got the tram (4 to sportweg); got out and crossed the railways, put out our   Basel sign, and exactly 60 seconds after Osman took us with him. Good spot as far as we saw! (2, one female, one male)
Got the tram and got down on tram 4 (Sportweg). Walked to the traffic light and exactly 15 seconds after I pulled out the 'Bern' sign a guy with a Van stopped and took me with him!

Got the tram (4 to Sportweg); crossed the tram tracks and walked back about 30m in the direction the tram came to the lay-by. I was 10 seconds into writing my sign for Bern when Max stopped for me. Great place!
Great spot! Plenty of cars passing by, drivers have enough time to notice you and there's enough space for them to stop. I got a lift to Bern in 10 minutes, which is amazing for Switzerland.

Waited for an 1hr30 to get a lift to Bern. It's a good spot, guess some people are just luckier than others! Also think it's better to stay by the layby rather than in it, to make it more accesible for drivers.

I also think this is a pretty good spot. The three of us hitchhiked here with a sign that said "A1", autobahn logo before it, and "Solothurn" (our destination) underneath it.

We waited for 35 minutes until a van pulled over and picked us up. He could only take two of us because he didn't have more space, but I am sure our friend will catch a ride in no time.

en_UK.description: Great for direction Basel, Bern. Take a bus to Sportweg or a tram to Hardturm.

comments.comment: New looking traffic bollards make this place not so good anymore

en_UK.description: take bus #20 to Wyler. Walk 200m, then cross the big crossroads. There is a bus stop with enough space.

comments.comment:
waited 10 minutes to go to Bern
5m after gas station is good
spot is in 10min by walking from the train station

en_UK.description: From outside the trainstation, walk right, at the roundabout right to the underpass, then keep straight on until you reach the main road "Bernstrasse". Turn left. On the right side you see a gas station, right before the highway to Bern begins.

Cross the town center walking towards the Jura (mountain-chain). There you find a main road with a lot of traffic. Turn right and follow this street, you can already try to stop cars here. There are bus stops (#1, #2) where cars have space to stop. After about 2km the highway A5 going to Zürich and Basel starts.

Easy to get there from the south/east of Biel. Just follow the main road "Brüggstrasse/Portstrasse). The spot is a roundabout, cars see you from far away and can stop there. A lot of local traffic, not too many cars.. But still quite good to go to Bern or at least to the service station "Grauholz" shortly before Bern.

comments.comment:
there is an entrance from a parking lot to the big street going to the freeway. Cars can stop there without hindering the traffic too much.
I was lucky and got picked up with some other guy within 15 minutes
No space for drivers to stop anymore without hindering the traffic

en_UK.description: Direction Paris/Dijon. Walk from Perrache Station to Pont Kitchener. Traffic stops shortly at the traffic lights. Make eye contact with drivers. Finding a ride can take a while but is worth waiting for. Show sign "Limonest" which is only 5 km outside Lyon. Ask driver to put you off at the gas station near Parc Dardilly, which is a real good spot for finding a further ride.
gas station

comments.comment: Better not to stuck in this city. We got out of there by train...O_o  Our driver folowed further and he suggested to pick us out there... You should be ready to spend one night somewhere (hotels are expensive). Good luck!

en_UK.description: No cars want to stop in this damned city.. And only people on motorbikes respond to hitchhikers, and when they do they crash into cars.  Or, it happened once to us.

comments.comment: easy to find lifts towards basel, much harder for lifts anywhere else in switzerland.

en_UK.description:
This is the first gas station after the Gotthard tunnel.
Everbody here does great distances (Basel for example) and many people rest here.

comments.comment: I got a ride in 10 min to Tours using a sign. A lot of space for cars to stop on the pavement about 100 m after the traffic lights.

Walked here from Vernaison as described in the wiki for Lyon. Takes a bit more than 30 minutes. You can walk along the motorway hidden from the cars by trees along a fence whose side is cleared from bushes, but the terrain is strongly sloping down sideways so it's still not a very pleasant walk. 
There was little traffic here a late May workday early afternoon, but we (2 ppl) got a ride south to Valence quickly.
Going to this place from the spot of "La mulatière" (south exit of Lyon) by hitchhiking, found a man to Sète directly by asking in the gas station.
was here for a short time, had a hitch to auxerre directly, on my way to paris
First driver we asked on a wednesday morning took us to a service station before Orange. Hitchhiking to this station from Lyon worked well, no need to take a train (maybe expect by night)

en_UK.description: average in direction angers/le mans/tours. enough space for the cars to stop, not much traffic. if you just go to angers i would suggest to take the national road next to the spot.
. hithhiking spot in direction nantes. enough space, but not much traffic in direction nantes because part of the highway is for free so drivers will take the highway-entrance in tours
good spot, but if you want to take the highway to angers/nantes, i would suggest to take another spot

comments.comment:
this place is great !
:)
Great spot. Wiat 10mins. One hitcher hops out. I take his place!
good one for sure !
very good one!

Good place! Arriving when there already was one guy going to Rennes who gets picked up once I finish writing my sign. Two others coming who are heading to  Angers and are also leaving before me. Another 20min and I'm gone as well. Fair enough!
Good place to go to Rennes; to go to St Nazaire and Vannes it's not as ideal but it works.
At 11pm we got a ride to Treffieux (for the Multison) and at 2am we got a ride once to Rennes and once to Vannes !
I met an other guy on the spot, we waited 20 mn and were both taken by the same car. Great to Rennes.

en_UK.description:
to go to rennes
with a sign, perfect spot. You can reach it wirth the tram line 2, stop at the "le cardo" station !

fr_FR.description: Pour aller à Rennes, pas besoin de panneau. Prendre le tram 2, arrêt 'le Cardo" et se placer au rond-point direction le périph. Vous ne serez probablement pas tout seul

en_UK.description: there is a small gas-station and a bus-stop, so you can either ask people or hold out your thumb...try to get to the next bigger gasstation on the way to Geneve and there shouldn't be anymore difficulties
Take tram 5 to Ostring. Car's can't see you from far away, but there's enough place to stop. The bridge protects you from rain.

comments.comment: Relatively good spot, as you are protected from the weather and there´s enough space to stop. Although drivers won´t see you from far away, there are traffic lights right before the spot. You will need a sign.
Actually new it will be Tram 7 from the trainstation (approx 10 Minutes)
Great spot. To Zurich less 30 min. The Bridge protect you and there are plenty of space to stop the car.
HH in this spot yesterday, 40min, with a sign. The cars are slow because of the traffic lights. The police pass twice and just smiled to us. :)

en_UK.description: Direction Zürich, Basel, Biel. Take tram 5 to Ostring. There's enough space for cars to stop, but they can't see you from far away. The bridge protects you from rain.

comments.comment: Does "asking here" refer to traffic lights or the parking place right next to here?

en_UK.description: Next to a big parking place. You can ask the people for taking you to the peage/gas station just like 5 - 10 km farther the A48, better than waiting with a sign.

comments.comment: Traffic lights periods are very short...
I usually put a sign "Péage" to join the next toll which is about 15km further and it works really well! From there it is really easy to join the North

en_UK.description: That's another good spot for asking people at traffic light while waiting for green and gettin on highway A41. Even good possibilities for pulling over and getting in, if you're alone directly while waiting ;-) Just like 15 meters farther north another traffic light with the people coming from Carrefour!!! Next ags station is about a 10 km.

spent 3 hours trying to hitch thru tunnel to france, with no luck. give up and spend 7euro on the bus, much better luck on otherside. (did see petrol station under construction on autostrade, maybee in future this may help)
locals advised we would have hard time hitching from this town, but after 1/2 hour we got lift to much better place about 20kms up road, en route to Lyon.

Direction : ORLEANS - PARIS by NATIONNAL
There is a little street who go down near from the bridge, it's strange but she work very well when you are in the middle of the street

Good place but if you are an English speaker, you will have some difficulties about are they proceed on highway? or will they take the national road? at least try to learn these sentences in Spanish and French. Paris sign doesn't work you need to ask, otherwise you will wait a lot.

en_UK.description:
This is the best spot to Paris!

fr_FR.description: Première station service de l'autoroute en direction de paris!

en_UK.description:
For hitching EASTBOUND (St. GALLEN, AUSTRIA) I hitched on sunday noon, lots of traffic still though. result will most likely be better on other days and hours
cars who connect to the highway come out of the tunnel and use the next tunnel right away. stand almost on the street with a BIG sign. How to get there: Tram or bus to BUCHEGGPLATZ and walk 2 mins, across the road and to the left. just follow the sings for the cars. the street name is Bucheggstrasse, stand at height of crossing with Guggachstrasse 
I got a lift after about 30 mins, considering the time and day it was not too bad.

comments.comment: That's a not bad spot to catch a ride under one condition - don't stand there with a sign, but rather go and talk to the people stopping on the traffic lights, and ask for a ride to  gas station outside Zurich.

en_UK.description: For hitching EASTBOUND (Winterthur, St. Gallen/Austria) I have never tried myself yet, but will do so soon. I know you can sort of walk onto the lead of the highway but theres no space for the cars to stop. all traffic that comes from the east, needs to get through town, following E41. But they usually use the tunnel. So maybe you only try this point in case the other one at Bucheggstrasse does not work. Catch a tram to Milchbuck (7, 9, 10, 14) and then follow the road to "oerlikon", you will see the signs for the cars pointing out Highway and Wintertur/St.gallen

Direction CHUR, SARGANS according to a friend, but i have never tried it myself and cannot tell you the exact point where to stand. You should ride there before and check, But this street leads to the highway (via Manessestrasse)

DIRECTION ORLEANS - FOLOW THE LOIRE RIVER
see some beutifuls landscapes of this place called "val des châteaux", your just at the door of the "Sologne", a very interesting place 
Waiting : 30sec / 10 min

under the bridge i got a ride to lausanne direction in half an hour.good luck¦
gj.smyrna

comments.comment: Good spot, we found a ride to Paris in half an hour

Easy to go to Paris/North. You can cross the sides. If you come from the south and want to go to southern Germany, you have to bite the apple and try to go to direcion Besancon/Mulhouse. Should work within an hour.
Even at midnight you can get a ride, somehow useless to ask for truck drivers, refusing almost everytime for insurance reason (normal...)
Very bad spot to go to Paris, especially during holidays or week-ends returns. Had to wait for hours despite the heavy traffic of cars going to Paris. They were mostly fulls of stuffs, children etc.
can take time to find a ride in direccion Mulhouse/Germany. There is a gas station between Bole and Besancon, so you can take rides from people going to Besacon.
Was not too easy to get a ride direction Mulhouse but mainly because of end of vacations (full cars). Finally got a ride directly to colmar.

Good Gasstation going north via Nancy/Metz (in the Daytime). The station suff kicked us out in the night :( But in the morning we catched a ride to Wiesbaden ... Quite impossible hitchhiking in the night here.
Monday morning, 2 people going to Paris. Got a ride within 10 minutes directly to Paris. Strategy: Asking at the parking spaces. If going to Paris, look out for number plates ending with 75.
Got a ride to Dole Met 3 other hitchhikers (1+2), all of them going to Paris. (June 2014)
Good spot for Paris, best strategy is to ask parked drivers. Very busy with hitchers in summer it seems. A few British cars heading for Calais too.

en_UK.description:
for going north (nancy) or direction paris it might be allright, but never try to get to straßbourg. we waited more than one hour before we decided to try it via metz (which was the better choice).
For going to southern Germany, try getting a ride at least to Besancon or better Belfort and get dropped at a service station at the A36.

there is nospace for cars to stop!
gj.smyrna

got a ride to vevey&montreux.zebra slows down traffic&a huge parkin lot across the street.good luck!
gj.smyrna

DIRECTION BOURGES ORLEANS OR TOULOUSE BY A20
This is the entrance of the A20 there isn't national roads to go to the north easily, so this is a goof one.
Traffic : Low, 1 car every 2 minutes
Speed : low, 30km'h
Waiting : the first car...a lucky day :)

comments.comment: I was always lucky on this bridge
Pointless trying there, there is no where to stop, it's designed like this, you need to go further south in Lyon, near Oullin, or after where the 2 rivers meet!

en_UK.description: No place to stop, If you find a brave/crazy driver it can work, but I advise rather the petrol stations. Direct verbal contact works the best!

comments.comment: yes did it works direction paris dijon etc
We were in two guys but we didn't waited more than 30 minutes, I would say it's a good place.
We were 2 guys in direction of Troyes, and waited for 2h but finally found a direct car. Most of the traffic is going out at the next exit.

en_UK.description: V. good spot. How to get? Bus nr 21 stop on "rue des vergers" or bus nr 89 stop "les aulnes". 21 nd 89 go from "gare de Vaise" metro D.
Good for going north on the motorway.
Loads of cars in Pontalier-direction at 5 pm. In the morning presumable in the other direction.

Direction Grenoble ou Italie, demandez aux gens de vous amener au moins au "péage des Marches", et de là Grenoble (Panneau conseillé)

To Grenoble or Italie. If the car doesn't go in Grenoble or Italie, ask the driver to let you in "péages des Marches" few kilometers ago.

Péage

Pay station

Meilleur départ vers Annecy ou Lyon. Mettez-vous sur le terre-plein central au niveau du feu (ils tournent à gauche après le carrefour), remontez la file de voiture au feu rouge. Si il fait beau (fenêtres ouvertes), n'hésitez pas à demander directement au gens. Demander au moins le péage, entre 10 min et 1h d'attente.

Best start to Lyon or Annecy. Ask to the people in the left. Ask for the pay station.

comments.comment:
If you want to go to Italy put "St Jean de Maurienne" on your sign, can otherwise be difficult (I waited for like 2 1/2 hours)
Good place for Grenoble though + friendly staff
had to wait less than 30min to lyon. very good spot just waited on the left side before the toll booth
to lyon or annecy, works always well.

en_UK.description: Péage
Péage de Crolle
Péage de St Quentin Fallavier

comments.comment:
A lot of cars, especially in the afternoon, early evening, but not a lot of place to stop
Should be perfect to go to Grenoble but only got a ride to the next shopping centre, so bit more out of town

i waited a bit longer because i was actually hitching towards germany, meaning Nancy Metz Luxemburg, or Strasburg, and it seems to be the lesser travelled road... but it's fun to see new hitchers show up every 5 minutes...

Parfait pour Dijon aussi, moins de 10 min d'attente à 3 (en 2 voitures)
Pour s'y rendre depuis Lyon, prendre le bus 161 ou 164 à la Gare de Vaise, ensuite il y a une dizaine de minutes de marche depuis la gare de Villefranche.
I regularly use this spot to go to Paris, never had to wait for long! It's a great spot in my opinion. To get there from Lyon, I usually hitch-hike first in Perrache (pont Kitchener-Marchand).
Used it to get to Montpellier, waited AFTER the peage direction M'pellier, got a Marseille going truck that left me before Orange. Good enough
2 min to go to perrache in Lyon.

i thought it would be a nice spot to wait for a direct ride to grenoble (i didn't want to go into lyon) and we waited like 4 hours before we decided to get to valence and then to grenoble from there. lots of people stopped and were going to lyon, or further south (even to spain).

I waited a bit because I was trying to get to Bordeaux while already having gone North from Lyon.  I asked for Clermont-Ferrand and was lucky enough to find a great ride there (through Dignon and beautiful rural roads.)
got a ride direct to paris in 10 minutes. i usually sit on the platform in between the roads with a sign, it's perfect when it does not rain.

en_UK.description:
Péage de Villefranche.
Direct pour Paris (10 min d'attente, une demi-heure en période de vacances). Il est déconseiller de monter dans une voiture qui n'y va pas directement : perdre 5 min ici vaut mieux que perdre une heure dans le désert séparant Lyon et Paris.
Direction Lyon, on attend pas plus de 2 min avec un beau panneau et un beau sourire.

Ask direct for Paris (about 10 min waiting if you smile and move), don't stop before if you don't want to wait a long time in the French desert. For Lyon, you will wait 2 min.

comments.comment: Really good place for going south
Senseless place for going North!waited more than hour had to go to Gerzon

en_UK.description: Really hard to go north, not much place to stop. :( Easiest is to get to the péage of Gerzat.

comments.comment: L'endroit serait praticable mais personne ne s'arrête, ou seulement pour embarquer une prostituée. Le trafic est dense mais certainement inadapté aux directions Marseille ou Saint-Etienne.
Really doesn't make much difference where you stand. For all the places around here - people don't stop easily.

en_UK.description: Stood there right before the entrance to the A7; took me 5 minutes to get a lift to a service station

I love this spot. Excellent for both directions, easy to get a lift to Geneva if going north and to Torino or Milan if going south.
Cars are passing REALLY slow, and all the traffic is coming through this tunnel.

comments.comment: Leave from a city is everytime difficult. Accept the first driver who can bring you to any gazstation. I wait 20 minutes. Courage !

en_UK.description: An on-ramp, uphill, cars go slowly and see you from a distance. Some place for them to stop but it's illegal to stand there. Direction Lyon, through highway.

comments.comment: I preferred to wait just before the border, by the speed bump, as cars are forced to REALLY slow down there, an dthere is room for them to stop.

en_UK.description: Not too much space, but just after customs, so speed is very low. Easy to at least get to the Mt. Blanc tunnel - Walterheck

comments.comment: Descendu ici pour continuer vers Limoges mais peu de trafic, mieux vaut descendre au péage juste avant l'échangeur, un peu plus loin. On s'en sort en abordant les conducteurs.

en_UK.description:
Direction : Clermont-Ferrand
No so much people stop at this gas station... Try to reach at least the next toll (péage).

fr_FR.description: Station service. Pour changer de direction en venant de l'est, mais mieux vaut descendre au péage juste avant l'échangeur, un peu plus loin.

comments.comment: At 12am, like 20 cars before to have one lift to the perfect place i wanted! (Saint Jean d'Aulps closed to Morzine)

en_UK.description:
To go to Morzine, Abondance, Chatel ...

On google, Satellite and Map view show differents road. That's because the photo view is too old
Direction chambery, national road.
Direction chambery, lyon, grenoble ; Highway.
Direction geneva, national road.

comments.comment: we waited for hours till we took the train...

en_UK.description: Direction geneva, highway.
Direction albertville, ou le bord du lac (lakeside road).

If you can get a lift to here, it's a good point to leave Grenoble towards Valence or Lyon (or as a last stop before getting into Grenoble). It's a toll, just position yourself next to the barriers with a big sign - make sure it's ok with the inspectors.

fr_FR.description: Le péage de Voreppe est le meilleur endroit où se rendre pour quitter Grenoble, très peu d'attente. Préférez un panneau avec votre ville de destination. Pour faire du stop de Grenoble au péage de Voreppe, rendez vous à la porte de France (esplanade).

en_UK.description: At his suggestion, my previous driver dropped me off here.  My destination was Lyon, but I had to signs:  Lyon and Geneva.  Got a ride in about 10 minutes - the wait was probably longer than it should have been, but the drivers had seen me digging in the dumpster for chocolate!  They threw away 60 or 70 euros worth of amazing food in the dumpster, so I would suggest geting some 'expired' chocolate to give your driver... just wash the outside wrapper :)

comments.comment: the best spot I know for Saint Etienne
L'endroit serait praticable mais personne ne s'arrête, ou seulement pour embarquer une prostituée. Le trafic est dense mais certainement inadapté aux directions Marseille ou Saint-Etienne.

The spot looks good with lots of traffic, just after a junction so not too fast, good visibility, and enough time and space for drivers to really consider you before stopping. 

However no one will stop! We (2 ppl) had a sign asking to go only to the next service station down the A7, and we waited for 5 hours without any success. Maybe it's because this is a spot for prostitutes... There was also another hitchhiker up at the gas station who waited for looong.
Took me around one hour to get a ride to the next petrol station on A7. Most of the people are here already on the highway. Try to hike before or after.

en_UK.description: Whoever added the "good" spot here must have been lucky or is completely out of his/her mind!  This place was the worst I've ever seen! To begin, it's in a smelly polluted part of the city ... and there are tons of hookers, dirty truck drivers, and used condoms everywhere.  The drivers taking this on-ramp are mostly locals.  I think it's better to head south to the service station via bus if you're taking the A7!

We were lucky to catch car there. 

Traffic: 5 cars / min
Speed : 50 km/h
Waiting : 30mins

comments.comment: a lot of cars, any direction you need! i got a streight drive to lyon!
got a ride to clermont in 10 minutes, the guy was going to lyon.
Petrol station in both directions so easy to get a ride either to Bordeaux or Lyon, however VERY difficult to find someone catching the A20 to Paris

en_UK.description: Good place, a lot of cars, but far from perigueux

little place to stop in roundabout
not many cars ...
to go to Grenoble/Genève
good place to go in direction of Grenoble

not many cars stop here to go to Geneve. 
the Annecy toll is better.

comments.comment: In the 30' i've waited there, 4 cars stopped direction Geneve, and 1 dirrection Annecy (my direction).
I had to go in direction of Auxerre. It is a good place because you can either go to lyon (Isle d'Abeau area) and change car or go through Geneva.

en_UK.description: in direction of Lyon or Geneve

in direction of Lyon or Bourg En Bresse.
many cars

comments.comment:
It's a peage (toll). Very good towards the north but don't let people drop you before Montlucon. You'll get stuck there with people only going back to the South or truckers going North-East.

I had to get back to the peage before going further. (Got the same driver twice in-a-row though; one of the hitchhiker's goals)

en_UK.description: take the bus 20 to come here. the best spot to go in direction to the north.
to go to Vercors (Villars de Lans).
Right outside the Cop shop! Direction: Luzern. With a sign, this is a great place to stand and has a nice bay for cars to pull into.

comments.comment: Waited for 3 hours and no one picked me up. But I think it was foolish of me to hold a sign saying "Suisse3 when there is no straight road going to Switzerland!

en_UK.description: Not very good. Few people, mostly locals, little space to stop.

fr_FR.description: Pas terrible, peu de monde et surtout des locaux, et peu de place pour se garer.

en_UK.description: Not too bad for going north.

fr_FR.description: Pas trop mal pour partir vers le nord.

comments.comment: the driver said that it was not a great place to stay as cars are not allowed to stop, but as the description says, if a driver wants to stop, there's enough place to do so, didn't wait more than 15 minutes (to Lausanne)

There are 2 gas stations, and lots of cars passing to the nearby highway. Despite of that, I didn't get any car to Lausanne, only to Martigny, which took me 75 minutes. Still, there are tankstations/ lots of cars, so I vote average.
Don´t hitch-hike on roundabout but on Rue Traversiere near gas stations. Good spot to Lausanne, stood here for 15 minutes with a sign and got straight ride, many cars.

en_UK.description:
Vers Martigny/Lausanne. Suffisamment de place pour s'arrêter.
Towards martigny/Lausanne. Enough place for cars to stop.

Sur le parking, demandez à aller vers Lausanne, Genève ou Berne (utilisez les plaques d'immatriculation). Vous éviterez ainsi l'agglomération de Lausanne si vous allez plus loin.
In the parking area, ask to get to Lausanne, Geneva or Bern (use the cars' licence plates), so you can avoid Lausanne's center if you're going further.

Meilleur endroit pour quitter Montreux. Possibilité de prendre un train ou un bus pour atteindre ce point. Avec un panneau (Martigny, Sion...), facile de décoller en direction du Valais.
Best spot to leave Montreux. Possibly take a bus a train to get there. With a sign, pretty easy to get to Valais/Wallis.

comments.comment: Got a ride to Lausanne within 2 minutes, at night! Just stand by the pedestrian crossing where the pavement ends and hard shoulder begins.

en_UK.description:
meilleur endroit pour quitter Montreux. Possibilité de prendre un train ou un bus pour atteindre ce point.
Avec un panneau "Lausanne", très facile de décoller d'ici.
Best spot to leave Montreux. Possibly take a bus or train to get there.
With a sign "Lausanne", very easy to take off.

comments.comment: Good spot to go on the A10 (direction north or south). The cars can stop easily and without danger. I didn't have a sign but cars quickly stopped.

en_UK.description: To get on the A10. You need a sign.

Easy to access by metro M2 (Fourmi)
Directions Bern, Fribourg, Vevey, Montreux...
No place to stop easily, but people who are nice will find a way to pick you up without danger. Make sure you are waiting at the place where the 2 lanes become 3 lanes, and not directly at the motorway entrance.

Direction North or South
This is the way to Bulle. On the Roundabout, you can stand without danger, people would stop. But the one who took me made me a sign to go at the gas station because he didn't want to stop on the roundabout. Any case good place to hh to Lausanne or Bern

comments.comment: since this is the highway, it's not legal to hitch here and the border staff will kick you out.

If you are hitchhiking towards France the border security will be unpleasant towards you, so I hitchhiked from the parking lot hoping people in the cars would see me, it took around 10-20min to get a ride to Lyon. On the way to Switzerland it's fine to hitchhike anywhere, and a lot of cars stop to offer you a ride.

It seems like the only legal and quiet stop to hitch there is the "CHANGE" inlet between both borders. Sadly, not many people actually stop, because it means pulling over on the left side (to a safe parking lot). When I finally got a ride, it was a direct one to Zurich though. Saw another hitcher headed to France there.

If done correctly it can be a great place: Towards France cross the border on foot around a forest near the fence (not on the road) and wait at the end of the border on the French side. Towards Switzerland I got a ride from a "neutral zone" in 2 minutes - traffic was very slow so you can speak to the drivers. Summer afternoon.
I hitched at the entrance of the truck parking area. Nobody kicked me out. Got a ride to Annecy easily.
Almost no place where cars can stop safely. Only possibillity is the small parking area at the change office. But more than 90% of the cars just pass...

en_UK.description:
If your driver don't go in the direction you want in France, you can wait between french and swiss border. For France, there are 3 directions from there : Lyon, Annecy, Chamonix
So make the good choice, and stand with a sign.
Pay attention to stay in a saf place, where cars can stop without danger (it is still highway even if drivers go slow)

Vers Sion et le Vaud.
Les gens vont vite, mais ont de la place pour s'arrêter.
Towards Sion and Vaud. Cars go fast but can stop easily.
Absolutely to avoid! No place for cars to stop, drive very fast... try to make it beyond Brig!
In winter, when the pass is closed, ask the people waiting for the train with their car! Tey will take you to the other side, direction Uri/Luzern or Graubünden!
In winter, direction Realp and Furkapass, better is to stop in Hospental or to walk from Andermatt to this city until you find a good spot.
In winter, ask the drivers waiting to take the train with the car on it, tey will take you with!
Try to get there if you go to Sierre.

Excellent! Mieux que le téléphérique pour redescendre sur Chalais. 
Temps d'attente moyen: 4 minutes.
Bien pour aller vers Sierre. Temps d'attente assez court.
Bon endroit pour monter à Crans-Montana. Temps d'attente moyen: 8 minutes.

Both Directions Bordeaux or Clermont-Ferrand/Lyon

This is a big toll station (Péage). All the cars going from/to Bordeaux/Clermont pass through here.

Waiting time : 15min to 45 min

All directions : Limoges, Bordeaux, Brive, Toulouse, Clermont-Ferrand

You can hitch in this petrol station called "Aire de la Corèze", it is a popular place to stop and rest for the drivers.

Directions : Lyon/St-Etienne, Moulins, Paris

Take Tram A and stop at "Les Pistes", walk 5 minutes on "Boulevard Edgar Quinet", following "A71" signs. Hitch just after the big roundabout.

If you go to Mâcon or Clermont-Ferrand, from Moulin, this a a good hitching place, just after the roundabout.

Trucks and people from the north leave the N7 to change on the N79 just at this roundabout.

Directions : Chamonix, Geneva/Annecy

Good place if you go to Italy through the Mont-Blanc Tunnel in Chamonix

comments.comment: Actually it's not such a good spot. Most cars head left towards the centre, as nearly every car coming from further away is already on La Route Blanche and into an underpass, skipping the roundabout.

en_UK.description:
Direction : Italy

It is the easiest point to go to Italy : All the cars passing by here go through the Mont-Blanc Tunnel

Wait just after the roundabout (not further, it may be dangerous).

comments.comment: I am trying to hitch from Les Gets outside Cluses to Grenoble, I will keep you updated

en_UK.description:
Direction : only Annecy/Grenoble, Geneva, Lyon

DO NOT hitch here if you go to Chamonix! You have to go to the next Highway exit at the east of the city...

comments.comment: I have found a ride in direction of Strasbourg but most cars seams to go in direction of Geneva
Perfect usual gas station. Australian guy went to Geneva -> 5 Minutes. I found a direct drive to Germany within 30 Minutes. Bus 171 has kind of strange depaturetimes but just wait for it..
A Japanese girl going to Geneva - didn't find a car going to Geneva directly but found one going to the direction (who dropped me off at another gas station) in less than 10 mins.

Perfect place, all the cars go out from one place.
I had to wait less than 10 minutes. (No french speaker)
Maybe I got lucky, but on a Saturday afternoon I got a ride to Lausanne in 5 minutes.
you also can get there by local train, going to montluel, it's 3,80 if you not older than 25yrs old, otherwise 5€, but bus seems to be cheaper
Very good spot for heading east. Take your time to get a far-reaching trip because there are enough people stopping.
Thank you for this great description. Found it easily. Got a ride very quickly to Switzerland

en_UK.description:
Lyon to Geneva:
How to get to the gas station onto the highway. 

Take bus 171 from "Hotel de ville" next to river in Lyon (dep at hours 03/33, weekend only 33). Bus takes about 45 mins and costs 2 euros one way. nice journey btw. Along the way lots of big supermarkets in case you need food. Leave the bus at Montluel train station which is the second last. You will see the train station when you pass, so dont panic. Trains are faster and have to be taken from the main station in Lyon. 
Get off and turn right, cross under the railway tracks. Then you will enter the industrial area in Montluel. i got lost there but try to find Rue des Chartinières to cross the motorway. You will have to turn left earlier to get to Rue Chartinières. Once you have crossed the bridge turn left and follow the road close to the highway. There is a small space to enter the gas stations, only for pedestrians, behind the little house at the end of the parking lot. 

I hitched on a saturday  morning. traffic is ok but people go all directions in france from there. You just need to be patient and also accept to get to the next gas station (Ceignes). that one is much bigger and offers more options

From Lyon to Geneva. Gas Station Valleiry: Last spot to get dropped off before the huge intersections (Annemasse, Chambery/Milan) if your driver does not go to Geneva. I cought the wrong day but think it should be ok to find a lift from there. try the earlier gas station if possible. 

Avoid week-ends because everybody is going to the french alps only which you dont want to! 

However: 
This spot might be really good for going south.

Not sure if you can get there by foot, you must find out, if yes, theres the possibility to catch the train to St-Julien and from there cross Geneva by public transport.

From Lausanne to Bern/Fribourg. Trolleybus to Chalet A Gobet. Or even get off earlier than there. National 1 to Bern. Lots of space for cars to stop, but they go fast. Better if you walk back. But as this is a national road only, its easily accessible. Since public transport form Lausannto to the countrysite are poor, many hitchhikers and many cars will stop.

I wouldnt say its a great spot as i waited about an hour there once to get to Zurich. Especially now with the bad roadworks. Sign is absolutely necessary. But the good thing is that there is  much space for cars to stop, cars go slowly too and can see you well. Bus 11 to the Park & Ride.

comments.comment: closed as of may 2013 - northbound only
Still construction works as of October 2013: only one side is open, BUT traffic in both ways, works just fine!
I got a car straight to Zürich after about 30min asking around (not at the gas station, but at the picknick area) - Sept. 2013.

!!! pay attention, right now there's some construction work. all cars have to cross the bridge and get to fuel/food over there, so it's quite difficult righjt now, but shut be good, when they're finished...
From Bern: Take the S8 to Zollikhofen, then follow the Länggasse. Turn left before the motorway.

en_UK.description:
This is a big gas station called "Grauholz" with lots of traffic and people. You can cross the hitchway there. Possible to get there by S-Bahn and walk too. 

TO Zurich/Basel: 
very good and enough traffic. Easy

comments.comment: not a nice place to hitchhike, but you will find something. a lot of local trafic, a HUGE parking place, place to eat, gasstation. becouse all the food places are on this side of the road most people stopping here are still going north in stead of south. after 1,5 hour i finally found a ride. and it did take me all the way to the end of the A1 to a metro station in lausanne.

There are loads of people going to the surroundings or just to Bern which makes it a little bit difficult, but in fact there are so many people that you just HAVE TO find sme going to e.g. Zürich or Winterthur. Especially because there are some trucks. As I arrived at the evening I met three further groups of hitchhikers and they were all staying not too long. Very motivating experience!
Most of the people just go to Bern, but it's possible to get to Lausanne/Geneve

The local traffic is a bit annoying, but at least there are a lot of people passing by. Better look for foreign drivers especially french if going to the direction of Lac Léman. The construction is mainly finished

en_UK.description:
TO Fribourg/Lausanne: 
difficult to hitch. Most cars go to Bern only in that direction or Murten. Be patient and keep asking. Some go only to Flamatt/Düdingen just before Fribourg. You should still accept as from there you will easily get a lift further westbound. If you find somebody to Fribourg or even further from here, you are really lucky! I hitched here many times and it has always been difficult to cross the city. 

There is a possibility to get to this gas station by food ant S-Bahn.

comments.comment: There is a bus stop good to hitch-hiking direction Fribourg, I got a ride in 20 minutes to Bulle, where was nice small road from city with many car going to Lausanne.

en_UK.description:
TO BERN/ZURICH
better not get dropped off before Bern if you are going westards. Its quite hard and i waited long. first i waited in the roundabout but nobody stopped. Then i put myself onto the national road and finally got a lift by somebody coming from south. 

TO FRIBOURG
should be easier. stand next to the national road, if it doesent work, closer to Bern more northwards

TO Bern

Best spot as all streets leading to the highway come together there. Take a tram to Escher Wyss Platz (4 or 13) then change to bus 54 to Duttweilerbrücke or Sportweg. This bus does not ride very often so you could walk. 

You can stand at the bus stop, no problem enough space, and good visibility. 2 lanes! 

UPDATE: 2010 heavy roadworks going on there. Stick closer to the city, its better altough you will get fewer traffic but once the roadworks start there is no place to stand along the street.

TO CHUR
could also work. try it out. tram/ train to Brunau

IMPORTANT TO KNOW
Now the E41 is a city bypass so there will be sicnificantly less traffic going south. You might want to advance further (maybe Kilchberg)

ANY DIRECTION

New gas station. I got lifts within some minutes there. YOu will get somebody to Clermont for sure or Bordeaux. There is little traffic on the A89 generally, so be wise in choosing the lifts.

comments.comment: Followed this, worked perfectly. Got a first ride to Thiers, and eventually to Avignon.

en_UK.description:
TO LYON

Tram A to "Les Pistes" then continue in the direction out of town, turn right at the big crossing and follow the signs for the Motorway. A71. Stand near the roundabout. Not much space but a car can pull out. I got a lift quickly there to St. Etienne
Enough space for cars to stop. Lots of traffic to Besancon

comments.comment: We were really lucky, we just come there and a kind man offered himself to take us to montpellier. He told us that there are often hitch-hikers waiting and that's not hard to get a ride.
it took me 3.30 hours to get a ride from there. every 5 minutes a bus stops exactly in front of the hitching place and blocks your sight. anyway, most cars there turn left direction paris.

This spot look worse than the ones down the road (south), less traffic, space, etc... but maybe it's better since you can talk to people directly at the gas station. As of May 2013 there was some construction going on, obstructing a bit, and not many people using this gas station.
Just ask the peolple at the gas station. Didn't take us 5 min to get a ride to the next gasstation direction south. . :)

en_UK.description:
First: this area is much better now than it used to be. The city is "cleaning this area" and making it a residencial area.

From this gaz station it is quite easy to get a ride with people going on the highway to the south. BUT most people then go to St Etienne, which is not the direction of Marseille. No problem, ask them to drop you at the first gaz station you will find on the highway.

comments.comment: You can hitchhike to there from Vienne by the N7, or walk but it's a bit far (7km). Then it took us 3 min to get a ride towards south. The guy was going to Salon de Provence.
Peu de voitures venant du sud en direction de Saint-Étienne / Clermont-Ferrand.

en_UK.description:
Big toll station to go north, south, or west (takes more time waiting).

No to far from Vienne or the Rhone Valley. You can get a ride to get there (look at the map).

fr_FR.description: Grande barrière de péage où les voitures vont surtout vers le nord ou le sud. Si on vient du sud et qu'on bifurque à l'ouest (vers Clermont) on risque d'attendre un peu.

comments.comment: Very good place to be! The car have to stop to the peage, so they have time and place to take you. The car have the choice to go in direction of paris or Mulhouse. I went to Mulhouse, but a lot of drivers show me that they were going to Paris. I think it's the only place to be to leave Besancon via speedways

I've hitchhiked twice there and the first cars stopped each time. Once to the North, once to the south... Perfect place for me ! The cars can stop easily and there are also toilets in case you need it !
No problemo at all. After standing there for only about 5 minutes with a simple sign, a car stopped. Easy to reach by bus. Fantastic.

I used this spot many times and it's preaty good. Take the bus 34 direction Valentin, stop at "échangeur valentin" then go to the direction of the Mc Donald (you see it) using the pietonal tunnel and you will see the peage. If you don't like the peages you can write "Baume-les-dames", then for sure you will go in less than 5 minutes, and stop in the motorway station of Marchaux, 10km. it's a big station with a pietonal bridge so you can go in the two directions, here the peoples makes longer distances than the peage.

en_UK.description: maybe the only possible spot to get out of town. we waited long to get to the west, not many cars. maybe good to get to the east.

PEOPLE:
1 Male

DIRECTION:
to Bern

SIGN:
Bern

DATE:
12 OCT '09

Time:
About 9h

WEATHER:
Clouds/Sun, Cool

DETAILS:
I didn't research Zurich before hitching on a whim, so I ust chose a spot on the Autobahn I thought would have plenty of space for cars to stop.  In reality, the cars are going much to fast to hitch on the autobahn this close to a city.  The police eventually picked me up and drove me to the next Ausgang (exit).

PEOPLE:
1 Male

DIRECTION:
to Bern

SIGN:
Bern

DATE:
12 OCT '09

WEATHER:
Cloudy, cool. Starting to rain.

DETAILS:
Police dropped me here -- I should have asked them to drop me at the petrol stop a few km behind because this took too long to land a ride.  That's what I get for not researching before I hitch!  The spot was fine, but it's mostly local traffic going to and from work.   it took me about 3 hours to land a ride, taking me to Lausanne.

PEOPLE:
1 Male, 1 Female

DIRECTION:
to Munich

SIGN:
Zurich

DATE:
14 MAR 2010

TIME:
About 11h

WEATHER:
Sunny, cool.

DETAILS:
As suggested by a local driver, this is one of the entrances to the autobahn heading all directions from south Lausanne.  Though many of the Sunday drivers were families, it only took about 30 minutes to get a lift.  Playing harmonica helps too :)

comments.comment: direction Lausanne: although there are not many good places to stop cars and not a lot of traffic, we had many cars stopping by even if they were going just for a few kilometers
The most beautiful hitching spot I've been in. Lots of space, good traffic.

en_UK.description:
Aire servant aux deux directions de l'autoroute, donc attention!
area serves to both directions, so be careful!

comments.comment: This one is great for going to Lausanne/Genève, not so good, for direction Bern. Waited 45 mins to get a car to Bern

en_UK.description:
Bonne aire d'autoroute, pour quitter le Valais ou y entrer.
Good service area to enter or to leave Valais.

comments.comment: not lot of cars, but a good percentage of rcars would give you a ride, a bit far from downtown though
Little cars plus not legal / dangerous and obstructing for cars to stop here or closer at or in the roundabout.

en_UK.description: took the bus to Vernaison and hitched directly on the autoroute, heading south to Avignon...   Cars are going too fast here.  Police got me in 15 minutes and took me to the next Piage.

direction: BERn
time: 2010.04.08
numbers in pary: 1

it seems that this is a gas station, but it's extremely small, and not much cars stop here.
(r)

direction: BERn
time: 2010.04.08
numbers in pary: 1

it seems that this is a gas station, but it's extremely small, and not much cars stop here. I asked around 10 people, and nobody went to bern, not even the smae direction.

comments.comment: I tried to get to Lausanne - Geneva - France from here, but waited over an hour, until I finally found a ride. You will need a sign. But don´t be too worried about the police station, as long as you don´t stand directly on the road (= endanger yourself), they won´t bother you.
I tried to get to Geneva but gave up after an hour as I saw no cars with a Geneva registration. Instead I hopped on the train to Gurbru and used the rest station on the motorway (which was shit)

en_UK.description:
time: 2010.04.10
direction: Genf
numbers in party: 1
i saw with my own eyes that there is a police station here. I think it's not a good idea to start to hichike all around.

cars don't stop

we wait 45 min at 10pm

comments.comment: Woked better holding a sign with Mondane, a truck stoped after 5 mins

en_UK.description:
Péage des marches
De plus en plus de gens ne s'arrêtent même plus grâce aux abonnements, prenez une grosse pancarte; direction: Grenoble/ Italie

Gas station Bois Claret. Not so many people here, most of them are going to Grenoble. Ask for the gas station "Voreppe" if you want to go to Lyon (North: Paris etc.) or Valence (South: Marseille etc.).

Gas and service station "Voreppe" (from Grenoble only) 
A lot of people here, driving to Lyon (North) or Valence (South), just before the Motorway Separation. A perfect place!

comments.comment: It's a very good place to reach and the A7 and the A49. Many cars, a lot stop, because it's a little town.

en_UK.description: Just after the roundabout, you can easily ask here for Saint Donat. In the other sense, ask for Romans or Tain to reach the A7.

fr_FR.description:
Juste après le rond point au centre de Chanos Curson (direction Saint Donat), petite place pour tendre le pouce ou les voitures vont doucement et ont la place de s\'arréter. Pour aller à Romans (A49 Grenoble...) ou Saint Donat.
Pour rejoindre l\'A7, demander Tain l\'hermitage : péage.

en_UK.description: There is a big truck stop, with petrol staion and restaurant. You'll find a bunch of truck drivers going both ways (Chambery or Torino)
On the national road, after the traffic circle there is a good visibility and way enougth place for the cars to stop and it's very easy to get a lift

comments.comment: prefer the red light in front of pont de l'université. (reds light are synchronised)
Le trafic est dense mais en pleine ville, donc sûrement inadapté. De plus les conducteurs-trices ont peu de place pour se garer et peu de temps pour se décider.
the place up the road before university bridge is much better as you get more local cars here (making a turn just when light turns red)

en_UK.description: Apparently the last red light before the highway. If you're going to St Etienne, hitch on the left lane, you've got the place to do so.

comments.comment: Not far from the train station Chateaucreux / pas loin de la gare Chateaucreux

en_UK.description:
This is the spot to go to Givors/Lyon and to the South (A7).
There is way enough place on the side of the road for the cars to stop.

comments.comment: waited for maybe two hours and not a single person stopped. not a very good spot, imo

en_UK.description: From Italy this is the last petrol station before the split Chambery/Grenoble. It seems that more people are going to Chambery but you'll get a lift for both direction

comments.comment:
10 minutes from train station, car come slowly and have enought place on th bike way to stop.
Tryed to take a lift to biel with a papper around 12 o clock, there were no much car...
I waited for one and half an hour without any luck ! car flow was good but there is no parking place ( Just biking lane ) so big cars can never stop ! I would prefer Murtenstrasse to Zurich More !

en_UK.description: Street leading unto highway A1. Many cars,  a bike lane to stop. Only 5-10min walk from trainstation!

comments.comment: In May 2013 Insa and Jan tried to hitch from here towards Lyon. After an hour with no one even remotely stopping, we gave up.

en_UK.description: construction works until Oct'12. In June '10 the bus stop was moved here. It's ok, but not that good anymore.
Take Bus 2 to Renferstrasse. Walk straight for 2 minutes. Stand just by the ramp onto the highway. I never waited more than 15min and hitchhiked there many times.

comments.comment:
thank you very much for the idea to swim in the river there! if i did not see that before i went hitchhiking i wouldn't have mentioned it i think!

it is a very small gas station, and just before a split toward biel. but i found a ride to the next gas station just before Bern

Okay spot, but it's more difficult to catch a ride going to Biel or further down that direction because most people go south towards Bern. You have free public toilets and a restaurant for those with a deeper pocket then mine.

en_UK.description: Gas station Deitingen. Great towards Bern, works also towards Biel. Perfect for a swim in summer! Right behind the gas station.

comments.comment: the gas station is not a real gas station...after 30 minutes of waiting i walked for appx 20-30 minutes along rua de lausanne to a big gas station and found a ride immediately after 5 minutes of talking to people.
This place seems good, but it took ages for anyone to stop at least.
Good place, waited about 15 minutes to get ride to Lausanne.

en_UK.description: Towards Lausanne - We barely waited 15-20 minutes before finding a ride. Stop light and radar make cars slow! Lots of room to pull over :)

good spot to go to the ski resorts of the ARAVIS or to the villages of the north shore of the lake like veyrier ;menthon talloires
good luck

comments.comment:
Im here on Sunday 30 November from 11 am to 2 pm nobody stop!
Truck is not operating on Sunday, and less car going to this place
I tried hitchhiking here but had no luck. It takes a long time for people to come back to their cars from the Burger King so from my experience the gas stop looks like a better option.

en_UK.description: a BURGER KING restaurant as well as an older ARAL petrol station make it easy to 'autostop' from here north on the german A5 (direction karlsruhe as well as frankfurt and hannover/hamburg). you reach this raststaette (called 'weil am rhein') where plenty of drivers pass through easy and within 30 minutes from the center of basel. take the 'DB regional express' (one stop)from 'badischer bahnhof' (kleinbasel). walk over the tracks, there is a large road bridge, follow the road and the signs to the 'burger king' restaurant. while the trainride takes only two minutes, walking takes you more than a half. the place is very safe + easy to find.
Good for Grenoble.  Waited here for about 20-30 min at a bus stop.  Not too many cars, but they seem willing to help if they are going that way.

comments.comment:
This place is very nice, Free Wi-fi even outside
Grenoble - Lyon very fast ...
got a lift in 1 minute to Gap

en_UK.description: Peage barrier direction Lyon / Valence. The location is 500 mtrs north of the dot.

fr_FR.description: Le péage de Voreppe est le meilleur endroit où se rendre pour quitter Grenoble, très peu d'attente. Préférez un panneau avec votre ville de destination. Pour faire du stop de Grenoble au péage de Voreppe, rendez vous à la porte de France (esplanade).

comments.comment: My experience is better, but i was a few meters behind, on a not legal place (the police consider it's on the highway). There's a nice place to stop for the drivers (only for peoples who want to go in the direction of Lyon)

en_UK.description:
Direction Lyon or St-Etienne/Clermont

Try not to be there, as there is no place for cars to stop, but if you have to, then it can be a good spot. I had a ride to Clermont, was it luck?

Direction Lyon

Excellent place. Hitch from Macon to the south (Zone Industrielle). This is the Péage of the autoroute A6

Really good place direction North (Paris/Dijon) or south (Lyon).

I was drop there so I don't know how to go from Chalon

Direction Chalon Sur Saone

Not really good place as there is so little traffic. However, I was waiting there a tuesday at 1pm (it is really countryside)

By chance, the 6th car in one hour were dutch who took me to Chalon
Doable spot for hitching towards Lausanne and Geneva. Harder if you want to hit Vevey.

comments.comment: I was at this spot but didn´t bother as I saw nowhere for vehicles to stop. There is a tiny little curve in the road that could serve as a lay-by just before the junction but it´s hard for the cars to see and a lot of them are driving very fast...
the curve pikeypunk mentions used to do allright... now after roadworks hitchhikers are left with a beautiful perfect shoulder to pull into. still technically speaking illegal!
As Zenit said the shoulder is perfect for cars to stop and the place is good in general to hitchhike toward Zurich. I waited for 45 min. before getting a ride. A sign is a must

en_UK.description: Great spot for hitching towards Zurich and St. Gallen. Probably harder towards Lausanne. Sign absolutely necessary!

Bad junction for a ride to Lyon. No obvious place to stand, so we stood on the on-ramp. We got a ride after 1 hour, but we were lucky.
http://hitchwiki.org/en/Chambery

Not much place to stand, and fairly quiet, but you'll get a ride in the direction of Beaufort.
http://hitchwiki.org/en/Albertville

Cars already moving way too fast here!
http://hitchwiki.org/en/Geneva

comments.comment: Wanted to go in Lausanne, the side space is not so well, but safe (Kind of step if cars want to stop...)
Maybe not the best spot if you're headed to Bern. Got dropped off here in the evening on a Saturday. Waited 40 mins with a sign till it got too dark and gave up. The rain probably didn't help.

Got dropped here and wanted another lift to Bulle on a sunday morning, 2 cars stoped but didn't have enough space for the 2 of us, until the 3rd took us. Working was going on on the side so there was plenty of space to stop

en_UK.description:
Good for a ride to Geneva.
http://hitchwiki.org/en/Vevey

comments.comment: If you decide to take this spot and you don't find a ride in a reasonable amount of time take the D bus from the bus station all the way to the station called Perly. From there you can try hitchhiking to get to the enterance of the highway on your journey towards Lyon or Grenoble.

en_UK.description:
There is a bus stop here, on a busy on-ramp going south. But it's too public... I was clean and presentable, but no-one seemed to want to be seen to be stopping for me.
http://hitchwiki.org/en/Geneva

I was going east to Vevey, and got dropped off at the nearby motorway junction. No chance of going by hitchhike to Vevey from here, so instead I asked for (and got after 2 minutes) a quick ride from here to Lausanne centre.
http://hitchwiki.org/en/Lausanne

comments.comment: This gas station is very small and there's is not so much traffic going through so it's best if you ask people directly rather then use a sign or thumb at the exit.

en_UK.description:
If going south, past Zürich and out the other side, be careful - this is the last petrol station on this motorway before Zürich! It is very difficult to get a ride further south, and Zürich itself can be difficult to hitch from. I got a ride towards Bern after 1 hour.
http://hitchwiki.org/en/Winterthur

comments.comment: Amazing spot to hitch south from.  My friend and I were trying to get to Italy and we were lucky enough to find someone going to Milano (which I do NOT recommend hitching through).  Getting a ride so far south was good but our trip went south (figuratively) in Milano.

Excellent spot, I get rides very fast, everytime I stop here. North and south both work in no time. Even in the dead of the night it's possible to get away from here (although you need more patience then)
I stood there for almost 2 hours while trying to find someone for Geneva. A lot of people went in other directions (Zürich or Italy). However, I found someone who took me all the way.
On a Saturday 11:00am we (1girl, 1boy) were hitchhiking to Luzern, we had to wait for 1 hour.

while i just had a lunchbreak outside in the sun people allready offered me rides, unfortunately they all went towards zurich and luzern. took me half an hour to find a ride towards bern (they could just take me to the next gas station becouse they went to biel)
first car we asked!
Amazing spot! It took me no more then half hour to get a ride and it was even 5pm.  I got a ride right to Paris!

It looks like a great spot, but going towards Lausanne, we (2 people, male/female) waited here for 2 hours from 10am to 12pm. Everybody was going towards Zurich (they said) or did not want to take us.

en_UK.description: take suburban train S1 (indicating 'rheinfelden', 'laufenburg' or 'frick') or S23 (indicating 'olten') from basel main train station to the stop 'PRATTELN', walk 10 minutes to  "autobahn raststaette pratteln" which forms a bridge over the swiss national highway 2/3. an excellent place to reach eastward cities such as zurich or bern, on the westward side germany (freiburg, frankfurt) as well as france. there are plenty-plenty of cars passing by 24 hours a day, there is an AUTOGRILL restaurant as well as shops inside the bridge over the highway.
Not a bad place to go to south. Walk a little after the trainstation and you can go to the highway easily.
The best place in Vienne to go to Lyon.
The best place in Vienne to hitch-hiking, a lot of people are driving to Valence. The most of them can bring you on the Nationale 7 and the Highway entrance.

comments.comment: this is absolutely the worst spot in the world if you want to get on the highway in the diretion of clermont-ferrand. you should try to get to saint-etienne and continue from there. around this place, the cheapest hotel costs 46 euro and i was unable to find any other site to spend the night (which you will have to do if you stay in this place).

en_UK.description: A lot of people who drive to roanne from St Etienne let you here. The highway entrance is far. It's difficult to come back on the highway. I hate this place.
It's good place because you can choose road 6 or 19. You should have sign.
Direction to Andermatt. Many cars are full.

comments.comment: Very bad to go to Italy. In fact we changed our route and got to St. Gallen and the to Italy
If going to Germany, better start by writing St.Gallen. Then you will end up in the right direction towards Germany.

en_UK.description:
Perfect for going to Germany. Going south should also work because it's one Rest Stop for both directions!

Take S-Bahn S7 to Kemptthal (~25mins from main station) and walk another 3mins up the road.
Where the road forks, go right.
300m further a small road leads uphill just to the gas station.

Once there, ask the people if they can take you! Like that you have the best chances and don't have to mess with a sign!

a possible place to reach BASEL, BIEL/BIENNE or ZUERICH. the traffic comming from the center of solothurn is slow and drivers have to stop at a traffic light. there is no pedestrian way but enough (safe) space to walk over the on- and off-ramp to this spot. i was never hitchhiking from there but believe it must be a safe & quick place to catch a ride. it should not take you longer than 7 to 10 minutes walking from the old town to reach this spot.

a very good place to travel to SOLOTHURN and maybe even further to BASEL or ZUERICH. you can easily reach this spot with bus number 2 (get off at 'renferstrasse' or the ROLEX-works). there is a COOP-supermarket nearby too (walking distance: 5 minutes). it took me 15 minutes to get a ride to soluthurn (while the driver was continuing to 'zug' and could have taken me there as well).

comments.comment: i got a ride to lyon in 30 minutes.

stood here several hours on the northside first direction Lyon or Bordeaux 
then Paris 
but no luck
 a couple Polish girls stood here also a couple of hours to Orange a French-Argentin mixed couple stood here several hours to Dyon this was a nice couple than diceded to returned to home crossed via the service road and servicebridge and got a ride to Germany instantly with German family with caravan all the way to Baden-Baden

this seems to be a good spot direction Paris ((?))

en_UK.description:
Direction : Dijon or Paris or Lyon

Here is the last station (called "Dole-Lavangeot") before the junction into the 3 directions. So if your driver don't go the right way for you, just take care that he stops you here.

Direction Besançon, Mulhouse, Basel, Germany (Freiburg)

Good place at this Péage, if someone can get you there at least. If the driver don't go through the Péage onto the highway, you can access the Péage by a short walk on a path situated on the south side. Then there is a fence, but it is jumpable near the Péage as some people already got here this way

Direction Lausanne, Yverdon

At this roundabout, there is a lot of place for the cars to stop.

Direction Lausanne or Geneva

There's IKEA here, so you might find easily someone for the rest of the way to Lausanne or Geneva, if your driver stops you here.

For going North, this services is excellent.
I got a lift to Paris before I'd even got to where I was going to start using my sign. 
I was asked if I was hitch hiking, and then offered a lift all the way to Paris.
Top Spot

the on-ramp ('fribourg nord') on the swiss national highway number 12. you can reach the capital BERN from here. there is plenty of cars passing by at this place - although i would not consider this spot beeing safe, you have to stand in the middle of the road - there is no hard shoulder (or other place) for cars to stop safely. on 'route de mourat' there is a  COOP supermarket nearby (5 minutes).

a roundabout in 'saint-blaise-lac' (near neuchâtel) from where you can reach bern as well as biel (bienne). there is a lot of traffic heading eastward towards the on-ramp of autobahn number 5 as well as the regional highway (la 'route de soleure' in the direction of biel/bienne). cars go slow but there is no safe place for them to stop. build a cardboard sign indicating your final destination. to reach this place exit the s-bahn 5 (bern-neuchâtel) at the station 'st.- blaise-lac' and walk three minutes. there is also a nearby shopping center, the 'MARIN-centre' as well as a MANOR department store (5-7 minutes walking on 'avenue des pâquiers').

a roundabout in neuchâtel- serrières, i have not hitchhiked from here but it should easiely be possible to reach 'les chaux-de-fonds' (on national highway number 20) from here. cars go slow (although there is no real spot for them to stop, except the nearby busstop), there is a lot of traffic, you should build a cardboard sign anyway.

comments.comment: Spot to Sion, you must ask cars stopping here. Pretty hard to get here by feet from Montreux, but it´s a nice view on the way here :)

en_UK.description: People do stop here because of the magnificent view. Probably only good in nice weather.
Somebody left us out there - horrible place! Gas station is abandoned, the few cars that still use this old redundant autoroute are mainly driven by locals.
good place to get out of Martigny. We wanted to go to Sion and the moment we got our sign out, someone stopped.
Best place to get to the barrier, La Grande Dixence. 15min and we got a tourist who also took us back down again.
I hitchhiked this way to get over the Saint Bernard to Italy. It was quite hard and it gets quite cold on top at night. Most of people are locals and Italians who doesn't want to stop.
Direction to Martigny. It's possible cross the border on foot, but not to much cars...
Good spot direction to Zurich. Enough cars and cars goes slowly.

comments.comment: trying to get to austria, with a sign, saying bregenz A at the end of the parking lot. worked really well even though it was friday around noon.
Tried asking people a lot. It didnt work for 2 hours. Then used a sign at the entrance to the high way. Got a lift within 10 minutes.

en_UK.description: A big petrol station. You should stand here with sign. Easy to catch car to Germany. Waiting just 15 min.
Direction to Winterthur. A little cars goes there.
pour atteindre directement le peage (dir lyon/annecy) il est possible de passer par la piste cyclable "l'avenue verte" et il y a un trou dans le grillage au niveau du peage

Waited for 3 hours in total (2 seperate hitches). TONS of space to pull over (autogrill plus big unused bus stop), but after a few insults shouted at me and 120 minutes waiting, I got a lift to Novi Ligure. Traffic here goes 2 ways, not a good spot but seemingly the only one in Alessandria.

Good place for going south.
Take bus no B12 in direction 'Chicago' to get here.

comments.comment: good spot but be ready i will have to climb up a lot  from train station ^)

en_UK.description: CORRRECTION to my previous post: the suburban train  stop from which you can reach this place easiest is called 'bossière/lutry', the suburban trains that take you there are number '2' and '4' (NOT number '21' which is not stopping there).
