comments.comment: It was after the roundabout to reach Lausanne, someone stopped to let me in Montreux. The cars arrive with some speed, but usually with the flow and because there were some roadworks, they came more slowly. Enough space, especially a bus stop 150 meters after the roundabout... But to get to Lausanne, BETTER to use the motorway A9, there must be another spot

en_UK.description: the villeneuve MC DONALDS restaurant: i have not hitchhiked from here but believe it can be a good relais on the way from (and to) the 'mont blanc' meaning martigny/aigle on autoroute (A 9/E62) and the cities of lausanne and geneve (via A9 and later A1) or fribourg/bern (via A9 and later A12). there is a commercial zone ("riviera") with a huge COOP supermarket as well nearby.

comments.comment:
At first I was shocked with this spot: ok, the traffic IS busy and the red light is long (40 sec) but there is no room for the cars to pull over. You will find yourself standing on a narrow sidewalk. There is some room if the driver wants to ride into the gate of this WTO you can see on the map but it's not a standard open parking or so.
However, suprisingly, we got a ride towards Lausanne in 10 minutes! So green is still a good colour to mark this place.
To Lausanne. Never waited more than 5 min.

en_UK.description: a good place to reach lausanne, montreux and other cities on the lake's eastern 'riviera' coast. a traffic light with long red phases slows traffic down here. there are plenty-plenty of cars driving in the direction of the autoroute (highway, autobahn) A1/E62. on my personal rating from 1 to 10 (1 = poor, 10 = superb) i want to give this spot a "6 to 7", safe for drivers to stop, close to the inner city, many cars driving by.

comments.comment: Update:The train to take from Gare du Lausanne is S2, not S21. This is a good spot when you're travelling westbound but trickier when as for me travelling eastbound. Still a good spot but further from the Bossieres train stop than you'd like if you carry much luggage. I hitchhiked to the gas station which also worked.

en_UK.description: the SHELL & AUTOGRILL petrolstation on A9/E62 close to lausanne, a very good place to reach either fribourg/bern/basel or zurich (via A12/E27) or montreux, martigny and the mont blanc (via the A9 autoroute). you can reach this relais from the main train station of lausanne in 15 minutes: take the suburban train (S21) to "bossieres" (three stops), walk up the roads to the autoroute, climb over the fence and, there you are. there is, as mentioned, a small shop inside the petrolstation and an AUTOGRILL self service restaurant. from the terrace of the selfservice (when the view is clear) you can see the ice and snow capped top of 'mont blanc' mountain. on my personal rating (1 = poor, 10 = superb) i will give this spot a "9 to 10", it only takes minutes to find a car taking you somewhere, the station is very clean and safe, there is plenty-plenty of traffic, the view is spectacular. a foot bridge links the (southern eastbound) station with the (northern westbound) station where cars are heading in the geneva direction.
Waited in this position for many hours with no success, further south there are more places to autostop.
a place with beautiful view. back to motorway A2, going either southwards or westwards. a restaurant nearby and drivers at the terrace may notice.
traffic to east mainly passed here. the road is kerbed and drivers need more effort to pull out.

Péage (paying toll) in the way of Tours, Bordeaux, Nantes

It's too wide, and to difficult to stop. Plenty of trucks that are hiding you from other cars.

I waited 1 hour

Around 60 cars per minute

I waited 3 hours for get a ride till Poities (direction Paris).
It's a nice place, with a long stopping part and with lots of cars but nobody stopped.

About 15 cars per minute.

En direction de Nantes.

Très peu de trafic, mais de la place pour s'arrêter. J'ai attendu une demi heure, mais certainement eu de la chance (à peine 10 ou 11 voitures)

comments.comment: Found a car to Le Mans in 5 minutes or something

en_UK.description:
Péage. Le directeur n'est pas très tolérant, mais le parking est très près, et il n'y a que quelques files de voitures. direction Le Mans : 5 minutes d'attentes.

Toll : The Carpark is near the toll, then people can easy see you and stop.
Station d'essence, peuplée, très bien pour aller loin. J'ai trouvé jusqu'après Lyon en direction de Marseille/St Étienne.

comments.comment: On a Saturday 5:00pm we (1girl, 1boy) were hitchhiking to Zurich, we had to wait for 1 hour. I think this is quite good for switzerland.
Stand in front of the bus stop (not further!) and people can drive in - worked pretty good on a late September morning (at 09:00am I got a lift towards Zürich and beyond).

en_UK.description: Perfect stop for heading North! Make sure you stand BEFORE the bus stop so people can actually drive in. Use a sign!

comments.comment: Does swiss people know hitchhiking ? We waited three houres before coming back to St louis (France), where we waited only 2 minuts to leave !
hitchhiking is not a Service where you have to demand People to take you with them

en_UK.description: Swiss people seem to have a problem with people that try to hitchhike...very problematic. We waited 5 hours...
there at the tollgate you can catch all traffic westwards. need go through a maize field and climb over a rail fence.

comments.comment: L'endroit serait praticable mais personne ne s'arrête, ou seulement pour embarquer une prostituée. Le trafic est dense mais certainement inadapté aux directions Marseille ou Saint-Etienne.

en_UK.description: Stand under the tree with a sign and you will catch a car to the south very fast. There are some bushes, so stand nearly on the street to be visible for the cars coming from the junction.

comments.comment: We catched a ride to Orange at this Gasstation..after sleeping at this station for the night

en_UK.description: This station may be good to go to Lyon, but not in summer. Every car was full with families going on vacation, waited for 2 hours.
traffic lanes splits early and the inner lane goes southwards.
traffic goes southwards, less but easy for cars to pull out.
traffic gets onto A1 and goes southwards, eastwards or westwards.

comments.comment: there's a gas station (BP) further down the street (towards the city), where you can go and ask people.

en_UK.description: traffic gets on to A1 and goes eastwards.

it took me 5 minutes to catch an opportunity to go to GENEVA from here, waiting directly in front of the mouth of the tunnel. cars go very slow here as they are only let in the tunnel in a 150 meter distance to each other. there is cameras and the organisation that is observing the flow of traffic as well as the safety might not be too positive about you stopping cars here - but in the end - autostop works out very-very well at this place. there is a restaurant and a snack bar in the large administrational and police + customs building less than 30 steps from here. it is of course also possible to hitch to AOSTA, TORINO or GENOVA (on autostrada "A5"/"E25") from here in the opposite direction.

on 'via parigi' (eng.: "paris road") there are a few traffic lights (wait until the light changes to red) from where you can reach COURMAYEUR, the autostrada A5 (E25) exchange 5 kilometers west of AOSTA or the 'TUNEL du MONTBLANC' behind courmayour. there is a lot of commuter traffic in the area so you should build a cardboard sign with you destination on it.

an AUTOGRILL restaurant as well as a large petrolstation on A5 (E25) near IVREA in the direction of AOSTA and FRANCE. a perfect place to hitchhike! clean, safe, friendly, on my personal rating from 1 to 10 (1 = poor, 10 = excellent) a direct "10", EXCELLENT! you can reach AOSTA, the 'TUNNEL du MONTBLANC' as well as GENEVA from here.

comments.comment: Waited half an hour for a lift to Milano

en_UK.description: i have not hitchhiked from here but it should be possible to reach MILANO or NOVARA from here. this petrolstation has recently moved 500 meters eastward to here (the satellite image shown is older than that). to reach this station from the TORINO city center please read my comment for another station 500 meter northwest of here. it should not take more than 40 minutes to reach this place from the city.

comments.comment: Came here from Direction Milano on my way to SAVONA. I hoped someone would take me to the gas station on the southbound highway A6, but with only 1,5h of patience on a Thursday afternoon I didn't get lucky. Somebody said there's a toll station one km from here, so I started walking behind the guardrail along the highway direction Savona. Not such a good idea - dangerous! Best idea if you end up here is probably to hitch into the city and try to get close to the beginning of A6 direction Savona.

en_UK.description: i have not hitchhiked from this spot but you should be able to reach the "TUNNEL de FREJUS" from here (meaning: FRANCE). the petrolstation in the opposite eastbound direction (MILANO and NOVARA) has moved 500 meters eastward (this satellite image shows an older picture). on how to reach this station from TORINO please see my comment for a TAMOIL station 300 meters northwest of here. there is a lot of traffic (going westbound) at this spot.

comments.comment:
IMPORTANT
This station is definitively closed, no possibility to hitch hike from here
02/2013

09/2012: We made our way to get there which took us more than one hour...and yeah it's been completely abandoned. So what we did was going to the exit of the gas station and tried to stop someone directly on the highway. By modifying the construction marks a bit we facilitated drivers to pull over :)
It worked out after 45 minutes so it is not impossible! But still not to recommend

Yeah, it's completely closed...you can still hitchhike at the former entrance to the gas station - cars are pretty slow and can easily stop. question is though, it all the travel to that place is worth it. NOTE: the bus stop where you have to get off is OLYMPIC VILLAGE!!!! there's indeed pitarello supermarket but you really need to watch out carefully. Also the bus number isnt 51, but something like SE01...it goes from the side of the street where you will arrive with the tram that is opposite of AUCHAN.

en_UK.description: a TAMOIL petrolstation near 'hotel GIGLIO', in my eyes the only place to reach AOSTA and FRANCE from TORINO. positive: the station is very well kept, clean and with a lot of flowers and a nice garden. the staff is friendly. drivers that stop here can ONLY travel in the direction of AOSTA on autostrada A5 (E 612). very negative: there is almost no traffic (4-5 cars every half hour). the station is partly abandoned (the shop and the bar are closed). to reach this station from the center of TORINO it takes not more than 40 minutes. take tram number -4- from the center of TORINO to the AUCHAN supermarket (corso vercelli/ corso romania corner to corso giulio cesare), walk across the supermarket and take bus number -51- indicating "CIMITIERO SETTIMO TORINESE"  get of after three or four stops at the "PITTARELLO" shoe shop (you can ask the driver for help). walk in the direction the bus leaves underneath a motorway bridge, walk left over the TAV-railway-line on "via cebrosa" in northward direction. follow the signs to "hotel GIGLIO". walk over autostrada "A4". from the bridge you can also see two other petrol stations. one on your right side (direction: MILANO), one on your left side (direction: "TANGENZIALE NORD" and the "TUNNEL de FREJUS") also the "hotel GIGLIO"on your left side. use the switchback at the bottom of the dam of the bridge and walk back towards the ESSO station. behind it you find the hotel. walk further until the TAMOIL station. again: you need to be patient at this place but there are cars that can take you northward to AOSTA as well as FRANCE.

comments.comment: Waited for 45 mins before I was kicked off this place by Italian police. I made the journey in the description, only in the other direction: took the tram into the city and used the train to get to Milan.

en_UK.description: an ESSO petrolstation on the "tangenziale nord" (A55) in the AOSTA and MILANO direction. i had bad luck here, did not found a driver in three hours (!) that could take me to AOSTA. i had two or three offers to travel to MILAN though. positive: there is a lot of traffic (but also many torino area commuters). the station is very clean and safe, the staff is friendly and speaks english. if your destination should be AOSTA or CHAMONIX (meaning: FRANCE), you should choose definitely another petrolstation (TAMOIL) circa 2,5 kilometer east of here near 'hotel GIGLIO' (see my other marker). this ESSO petrolstation here is difficult to reach as most of the italian stations are not to reach from the landside. there is always high fences (or locked gates) you need to climb over. take tram number -4- from the center of TORINO to the AUCHAN supermarket (corso vercelli/ corso romania corner to corso giulio cesare), walk along 'corso vercelli' westward around the two big block of flats. walk over the railway line on "strada provinciale di cuorgne" northward until the instersection to "strada communale di villaretto", walk on this road westward (underneath the airport motorway access road) and until the bridge over autostrada A4. you can see the station from here. you need to climb down the dam and get over the fence. this was the most stupid way of reaching a hitchhiking spot ever, congratulations if you have made it (!).

comments.comment: Fuck the sign, I have hitchhiked there a lot of times (Genève, France), police has seen me and did nothing - after the sign one cannot hitchhike and not in front of it!

en_UK.description: This spot is useless since there are cones and a huge 'hitchhiking forbidden' sign in four languages is hanging here.

comments.comment: Used this to go to Bern. The road north of here had little stopping traffic. had about 4rides and didnt make it to Bern. Had to catch train from somerandom place around sunset. 5hours from here to almost Bern. Recommend a different way. Im going here to Bern tomorow but will try different route

en_UK.description:
Easy to access by metro M2 (Fourmi or Vennes)

Directions Bern, Fribourg, Vevey, Montreux...
No place to stop easily, but people who are nice will find a way to pick you up without danger. Make sure you are waiting at the place where the 2 lanes become 3 lanes, and not directly at the motorway entrance.

Direction Neuchatel, Geneva, A1
better spot but make sure you are waiting on the north side of the highway, just before the traffic lights at the entrance. There's a parking lot there also.

a petrolstation on autostrada A4 (E64), a good relay on a MILANO - TORINO trip. there is also a smaller snack bar and cafe inside. it can take a while until drivers take you to TORINO, in my case around one hour, though, the driver brought me right to the city-center of my destination. this place lies in the middle of nowhere; please do not expect too much comfort, the station is of an older type and not very clean. beware of pickpockets, there seemed to be a lot of gypsies  stopping at this place.

Direction : Limoges/Bordeaux

Not the better spot if there is no gas at the petrol station (I was there during strikes). However, this gas station is the last before leaving Clermont, so it can be possible to ask here.

fr_FR.description: Pas trop mal. Les voitures vont doucement et peuvent s'arreter facilement.

en_UK.description:
Direction Limoges:

Don't get dropped in this little Aire as the cars are going too fast to think about you. You will wait long.
Prefer to be droped at the village before (Aubusson)

Direction : Bordeaux (A89)/Limoges (D941) (be careful, Bordeaux and Limoges are 2 different directions)

Here is a good spot, especially on friday, and week-ends.

Stay with a sign.

For Bordeaux, it could be smart to have a sign "Brive/Bordeaux": if the driver goes only to Brive, he can drop you at a big gas station before Brive called "Aire de la Corrèze" and you won't experience much difficulty there.

Don't stay at the traffic lights 100m before as they are almost never on the red, and there is no place to stop.

Direction Limoges

Amazingly here in this little village (La Pouge), in front of the "Mairie", I didn't wait long on a friday afternoon.

Most cars are slowing down as limit is 50km/h and they have time and space to stop

Best spot direction Limoges from Bourganeuf

You won't wait long.

Dir south toward Lyon...

That is definitly not a good spot :
Cars go too fast, it's polluted, very noisy, it is dangerous, you are not seen cause people are more focus on accelerating on this ramp to the highway...

I was droped here. After one hour, a kind man offered me a ride to the Péage and told me that it was really not a good spot to reach the A6...

This is the last petrol station before the motorway splits. Most of the cars are going straight to Lyon. You'll find a few cars to the East, or to the South (Valence). There is not a lot of cars stopping here. Try to avoid it.
Going to "Les Contamines" or "Saint Gervais", this is a good spot. Just after the roundabout, cars go slowly and they can stop easily to pick you up.
Leaving "Les Contamines" back down to the Valley? This is a good spot, all cars will be going your way (so no need for a sign).
very good spot to go onto the motorway here because of traffic lights and friendly people. just have a sign!
Petrol station "Les sablons", very good spot to get further on the A41 direction Chambéry, Annecy, Geneva, etc
No Problem.

comments.comment: I waited 1h30 to get a ride to austria.

Great place! I waited around 30 for the final ride, but during this time 5 more cars stopped, but they were not going to the direction i was going to, or simply to close. THIS PLACE IS REALLY GOOD ONE, you want find such good place until Austria.

en_UK.description: a perfect relais between ZURICH (or WINTERTHUR) and ST. GALLEN, KONSTANZ (germany) or SCHAFFHAUSEN. you will find a BP petrol station, a restaurant and a small COOP supermarket. you reach this spot conveniently with suburban train (s-bahn) number 7 from zurich or winterthur. get off at 'kempthal station' and wander up the hill (4 minutes) behind the factory buildings. there is many cars stopping at this raststaette. on my personal rating from 1 (poor) to 10 (a very good place) 'rastanlage kempthal' will get a '10'.

'rastanlage DEITINGEN sued' is a good relais northward to BASEL, ZURICH, other cities in germany or western france. there is plenty of (intrenational) traffic stopping at this place. from 'solothurn main train station' you reach 'deitingen suburban train station' within two stops. wander up lutherbach-, schachen- and hofurhenstrasse (7 minutes) and there you are..!

Good place to leave Poitiers and reach the A10 tollgate. Look for the place where drivers can stop easily.
Direction : A10 tollgate, Tours, Paris.

Tollgate to the A10 highway. A few minutes waiting to the norths.
Not a really good place to the south.

Direction : Nantes, Cholet.
You can wait 10 minutes as you can wait 1h.
Lot of traffic and bus stop.

Good place to reach the A10 tollgate.
Wait : 20 minutes.

Good spot to the North and the South (during the day).
Wait : 10 minutes.

comments.comment: cars don't have room to pull over without holding up the traffic

en_UK.description:
Difficult spot to hitchhike.
Lot of traffic but lot of different direction.
I usually get a lift from here to Poitiers, and it's not a good place.

comments.comment: I was dropped here from Angers. I didn't even have the time to eat my sandwich that a guy took me to Bordeaux.
I got a lift to toulouse in 10 min from there
Southwards at the beginning of the summer holidays it's pretty hard, because all the cars are full with kids, tents, surfboards, bicycles and a lot of other stuff.

en_UK.description:
Good place to go the South : Niort, La rochelle, Poitiers...
Average to go to Brittany.
Difficult to reach.

comments.comment: got a ride to service station in the 5th car after showing up. tried for 20min one light down the road.

en_UK.description: better spot than the ones down the road (at least during non-traffic hours)

comments.comment: I found it unwell. yes, there is a huge traffic but there is at least no room for drivers.

best place is right at the corner of schimmel- and manessestrasse. drivers from to different rows at the traffic lights will see you. because of the fire station there is plenty of space for them to stop too.

At the busstop people can stop easily however they are already pretty fast, difficult to stop for hitchhikers, difficult to read sign.
Went to Glarus from here, took us 40 mins to find a hitch.
Great spot for hitch-hiking to Luzern. Lot of space for cars to stop in front of fire station. Many cars going, not much fast yet, perfect. Got ride in 15 minutes to Luzern.

2 guys, 10 AM

Bad place, no space for cars to stop (it's not allowed there), we wanted to go to A3 but someone took us to different road (A4).

There is probably not better place in Zürich to hitchhike in this direction.

en_UK.description: Great spot for hitch-hiking to Luzern. Lot of space for cars to stop in front of fire station. Many cars going, not much fast yet, perfect. Got ride in 15 minutes to Luzern.

There is a toll gate (péage). Warning: the road which goes from the toll gate to motorway is only for direction Tours! Don\'t spend two hours waiting for a lift on wrong direction like me :-). There is a parallel road which is next to the toll gate (but does\'t go through it) for direction Poitiers.

comments.comment: Bad place, locals go through the city.
Waited for two hours and nobody stopped. Went back to the border (highway).

A lot of space for cars to stop, mostly going in a direction of Geneva. I would recommend sign with number of highway you want to go (A42 or A46) and image of gas station just to get you out of the city...
Car stoppped as soon as I put up a sign saying Pont-d'Ain. My final destination was Geneva.

I had a sign saying "Suisse" but no one stopped for me first. I really would recommend you to ask for a ride to the next gasstation (and god damn, never go to the next duty station!!) or to not use a sign. That worked better.

en_UK.description: Good spot for going to Switzerland but there isn't a straigh road going to there so if you have a sign, it's better if you have a destination half way or at least on the same motorway; A42 for example.

a good place to reach BASEL. take the SBB suburban train (s-bahn) to KILLWANGEN-SPREITENBACH, walk underneath the autobahn-bridge that crosses the river, along the autobahn on "schiffenenweg" westward. build a cardboard sign, it should not take longer than 10 minute to find a driver. over the bridge you can also reach the A1/A3 eastbound side. the station is safe and clean.

Total petrol station. Not very crowded but one in four driver is going to the highway. Ask for a ride to "La Crèche", this is the entrance of the highway. Average waiting time of 15 minutes. The staff is nice to hitchhikers, don't forget to say hi when you arrive. :)
Good place to get a ride to Niort. A sign seems to be required.

comments.comment: Really good spot!

en_UK.description:
Spot for the A43, to Grenoble-Chambery...
This might sounds like a weird idea to hitch there, under the bridge where there is only an emergency line for the cars to stop. But it worked very well for me !

fr_FR.description: Se rendre à Mermoz Pinel (il y a un arrêt de métro). Puis faire du stop sur l'avenue Jean Mermoz qui rejoint l'autoroute. Les voitures qui vous prennent peuvent facilement s'arrêter sur la bande réservé aux bus.

en_UK.description: A spot to go South to Marseille. There are not so many cars but a lot of them are willing to take hitch hikers, it's actually possible to get a direct ride directly to Marseille from here.

comments.comment: You can allow yourself beeing choosy if it's early enough!

30 minutes but 3 or 4 people ask me for helping. an asshole came juste befor me to do hitchiking but a guy picked me up to a gaz station 5km far away where i had to wait 5 minutes before someone picked up to.
Good. I waited 15 minutes in a week day before getting a lift to another station.
I stood closer to the roundabout. Great place to go to Vannes/Lorient/Quimper.

en_UK.description:
To go in direction: Vannes / Auray / Quimper. 
Very nice spot! People don't drive too speed and there is a place to park! 
From Nantes, take tram 1 (1euro50!), stop at Schoekher (when you get out of the tram, take straight) and pass throught the commercial park to rejoin the atantis roundabout.

comments.comment: Traveling from Zurich to the south is really hard. I tried this spot and it was not a good decission. There was to much traffic so the peole couldn´t pull over. So I walked to the next service area. a long walk...

en_UK.description: Direction to Naters

comments.comment: Should be ok during the day, but when I arrived there at 10pm, I had to give up. Only cars to Fribourg when my destination was Bern.

For the first sight this seemed like a place where you stay for ages because it isn't a busy station even though it serves both of the directions. But I got a ride to Lausanne quite fast (maybe it was good luck)

A lot of trucks on this petrol station. Good for the direction of Paris/ Le Mans. Ask people to leave you on the toll 13 km further. You can also ask people going to Saumur/ Tours by the A85 to leave you on the toll because it is very closed to the toll for the A11. I asked to a truck driver and left the station in 10 min
I found a lift that took me through Paris in the direction of Lille. Very good spot
Wait 30 minutes at the station and i went to Clermont in 3 hours !!
Great spot to go to Paris !
Perfect place!
good place to drop off from a car going to Le Mans in case you want to go tours-bourges-orléans, we got a ride to tours in 20 min.

I found the spot easily by car, then I waited only for 5 minutes before that a young couple drove me to Paris centre. It was around 2 pm during the holidays so there was a lot of people stopping there to have lunch
Nice place for Paris or Lemans

en_UK.description: You can access this petrol station from the round-about "Parc des Expositions"(a bus can drop you there). The only petrol station on the highway accessible with the city public transport

comments.comment:
I stand at the exit of the shopping center (cars are slower there) and it worked in 5 min.
I used this spot at the beginning of a long week-end.

i waited here for something like an hour or two, it was raining and i had to go to London before nightfall... i went to the parking of the centre commercial, asked a guy to drive me to the next service station, that got me another ride instantly to ROuen

en_UK.description: There is an access to the A11 here, but the cars have no room to stop and the traffic is actually not intense. I waited here over an hour before to decide to change  spot.

comments.comment: Peage outside of Dijon. Waited for 10 min. for a ride straight to Lyon.

en_UK.description: The toll on the way to Lyon.

comments.comment: I spent 3 hours trying to figure out where to find a spot to reach Bern in this area : the gas station just on the national road is only used by people from Lausanne, the spot after the gas station didn t work because they just arrive too quickly and go in small villages, as the other entrance on the motorway contains a panel written Hitchhiking Forbidden in 4 different languages, where cars can t stop, I guess the one I added is a good one

en_UK.description:
BERN
- close to a metro station,
- space for cars
- arriving with low speed thanks to the turn

comments.comment: Used that spot, waited for 1 hour because of people, else it was a safe place, enough space, slow motion... Use a panel it´s better and more clear for them...

waited for 30 min with a sign for basel, enough space to pull over with the car. 

just walk and stand before the highway sign and the drivers will se you easy.

en_UK.description:
Zurich
Stay before the motorway panel (policemen told me that else I would have to pay)
The configuration is alright, it can be just people behaviours that could change your waiting time

comments.comment:
two details about how to reach the petrol station: exact name of bus stop is "Torino 315" (or few no. up or down) --- I stopped at "Torino" AND had to walk for 3 km to reach via Vermea :-

than, correct direction: get via Vermea, 100m on the left of the bus stop, go thru for 1 km approx, check on the left for Via Napoli, do not take the overpass but the small country road on the left --- you already see the petrol station from the beginning of via Napoli :-)
DO NOT TAKE VIA GOZZANO!!! they must have changed the street name disposition recently, it would take you on the wrong path --- from the beginning of via Gozzano I could see the petrol station on the opposite direction :-

en_UK.description: Gas station "Nichelino Sud"

comments.comment: We got out here after 650 km (from the Netherlands) in one ride and decided it would be good to stretch our legs and have a short picknick before continuing. Shortly before we would have tried to catch a lift we were offered one to Lyon. Very nice!
The first day of summer holidays all the people come to the South. There were two cars stopping in the two hours time but both were only locals. Direction Geneva seemed hopeless.
Waited for almost 8 or 9 hours trying to go East to Geneva. Hopeless! Ended up going to Lyon in one ride. Many people going South.

en_UK.description: we waited for an an hour and half, destination just freiburg, no chance, went on over the bridge to the next spot, see what i write there

comments.comment: Got a lift in 15 mins to Luzern.

en_UK.description: same here waited for another 1 and a half hours, next to the police station, no one, even nobody who would bring us to the next reststopp, as we wrote germany instead of freiburg.
20 min
There is much place to stop, but in italy it is mostly average.

comments.comment: It´s a good place for tramping too Saas Fee or Zermatt.
Le meilleur spot que j'ai jamais trouvé. Direction Nantes/Paris au moins de 10 minutes chaque fois. Incroyable ce lieu.

Really good spot, take public transport bus to Plombiéres-les-Dijon, i think bet is to get out at about 4 stops before terminus. Walk to the start of highway and you will see great spot just after trafic lights
excellent !

en_UK.description:
Spot to Paris. Take the bus 30 from dijon center and stop at vaux bruns and you will be at this spot ! 

It is perfect, due to some road planning, the old spot just at the entry of the motorway is now less attractive. Cars still can stop but hitchin' on the road from dijon just before the crossroad is a better option. Close to the traffic light, it's perfect ! waiting minutes before a lift to paris : 3 min !

comments.comment: not too bad

en_UK.description: This is the A38/A6 toll station. not too much traffic here, but still a good place. From there you can reach the service station "les lochères" (km 255) if going to Paris. If you go to Dijon, beware, there is no more service station !

comments.comment: un bon spot pour descendre vers le sud

en_UK.description: To go on the motorway direction Toulouse, with a sign "A 20" or "Toulouse". There is no toll station in Limoges, as the motorway is free there.

fr_FR.description: Pour rejoindre l'autoroute direction Toulouse, avec un panneau "A 20" ou "Toulouse". Pas de péage à Limoges, car l'autoroute est gratuite.

comments.comment: once me and my friend spend about hour there on the gas station parking. It was late evening and no one wanted to take us. Fortunatelly one english guy survived us and get back to the germany.

en_UK.description: Grosse aire d'autoroute, facile d'aller en direction du sud

comments.comment:
Is very easy to get to this gas station and to the highway by walk.. 
There is a viaduct between to two sides of highway.
There is not a lot traffic, you need to ask drivers. There is a parking for big trucks, so you can get a lift with them. 
good luck

en_UK.description: Nice little spot, much better than the border up the road - heavy traffic and a good spot for people to stop (though not possible for trucks)

comments.comment: To go to Angers/Paris, this place could be good but with me it didn't work very well...
Each time we used this spot, we wait less than 10 minutes no matter at what hour. Perfect to Bordeaux, La roche sur Yon ...
You can go to this place taking the busway 4 from the city center, stop "Bourdonnières"

en_UK.description: Perfect point in Bordeaux direction

fr_FR.description: Excellent point de départ en direction de Bordeaux.

comments.comment: You can take the bus "C3" from city center. No parking for the car...

en_UK.description: Good point to go in Angers/Paris direction

comments.comment: Avec un panneau Limoges, j'ai eu à deux occasions un trajet direct pour Toulouse.
A cheap bus ride from the centre (direction Mignaloux). Space for vehicles to stop safely.
Spot idéal, j'ai attendu 2 minutes avec un panneau Lyon.

en_UK.description: From Poitiers direction Limoges.

fr_FR.description: De Poitiers vers Limoges.

comments.comment: took me less than 10 min to get a ride to freiburg, although it was sunday and almost no car passing by here

en_UK.description: direction: germany, freiburg. hitched before the entrance to the motorway. enough space to stopp, protected from sun and rain (:

comments.comment: good spot direction east, just after roundabout, lot of space to stop, a lot of lamps so hitchiking in night is also possible (we waited there in night for about 5minutes and then we catched a ride almost to Nevers!
waited about 30min to get to roches-sur-yon

en_UK.description:
Direction : Angers in the north or La Rochelle/Niort/ La Roche s/ Yon in the south.

The spot is a toll. I got a ride to Angers in 15 min even if the traffic was quite slow (in the beginning of the afternoon in week).
If it does not work for Angers, you can try on the national road just next to the toll.

comments.comment:
There is a secure spot to hitchhike but the last time I had to wait 30 minutes although it was rush hour.
There is no better hitchhiking spot nearby though.

en_UK.description: Took 20 minutes to get a lift into Nantes, waited just before bus stop where cars have to slow down. It was rush hour which helped.

Good place to try to get a ride. There are traffic lights ans lots of car.
If you just came across the city, there is a tramway station 200m away.

You should just stand before the Roundabout with a "PAYERNE" sign. from there you can go to Bern, Lausanne, Genf, Vevey or even France.

I usually wait there max. 10 minutes. (female)

comments.comment: I stood for 1 hour, many cars, but not much place for cars to stop :( Finnaly a driver from opposite direction took me (he shouted on me from window thas he´s going back in few minutes and that it´s a bad place to get to Bern, so I don´t know, maybe I was just lucky..)

en_UK.description:
With my "PAYERNE" sign I stood here for 5 minutes. Take the metro 2 until Croisettes and there it is.
Don't forget your sign!

comments.comment: Just a bout 50 meters away from there there is a mauch safer traffic light. This one is quite dangerous imo

en_UK.description: Dropped off here under bridge by car en route from Bordeaux to Nantes. There were lots of cars at rush hour, going quite slowly. 30mins
There isn't a lot of space to stop on the motorway entrance, but we were lucky and got a ride to Toulouse in 10mins on a Thursday morning.

comments.comment: Saturday morning at 6.30, we were taken (one boy, one girl) in Aboutaleb 20 minutes. Can t complain!
very good to stop for cars. most of them are regional but they can take you to next petrol station in about 5km
You can ask drivers at the traffic-light easily! Most are local but the next service station is not far!

en_UK.description: Take the Bus 15 from bellecour to irigny. Bus stop Kellerman. Walk 100m in the same direction than the bus. You'll see the spot on your left between the trafic light. You can reach easily the gas station solaize.

fr_FR.description: prendre le bus 15 de bellecour direction irigny. Arret kellerman. Continuer sur 100m dans le sens du bus. Entree d'autoroute sur la gauche a cote du feu rouge.

comments.comment: Used the onramp 1 km WNW from this spot.

en_UK.description: I took the train until modane and then i walk 20-30 minutes until this traffic light. It is situated just after a roundabout and every car who go on the highway pass her. People see you from far, you can talk to people, they can stop easily. Just 10 minutes to get a car to Lyon.
pretty near to the station you get the national road till french border, you should be lucky but it s not hard

comments.comment: Sorry this place isn correct and i don't know how to remove.

en_UK.description:
Here is standing a toll plaza (péage).
So just behind this station is a parking place for both direction.
Its perfect to get a lift because every car must be slowly :).
When i have standing there most people drives in the direction of Lyon but also many people goes to Clermont Fd. I think a shield is very usefull.

Here is standing a toll plaza (péage). So just behind this station is a parking place for both direction. Its perfect to get a lift because every car must be slowly :). When i have standing there most people drives in the direction of Lyon but also many people goes to Clermont Fd. I think a shield is very usefull.

To leave Autun to the south. after the traffic circle on D681 at the petrol station, a lot of place for the car to stop. Good traffic. Worked well in summer, 20 minutes wait in the early morning to be taken by a cool guy
Good spot just opposite the train station of Mörel. Mostly local traffic, but might get you a bit further at least.

fr_FR.description: Pour Rennes, par Segré

Pour Rennes, par Candé
Accessible par le bus 35, arrèt Robinière. Rond-point

comments.comment: its a really good place to hitchhike towards aix and marseille

en_UK.description: I've had fantastic success right outside this military base as there are often soldiers going on leave and heading either North or South along the National. There is a prison right next to it but people seem to disregard it, interestingly enough.
From Limoges, to Tulle.

fr_FR.description: Depuis Limoges, en direction de Tulle.

comments.comment: Used a sign with "Villefranche" - clearer than "Péage" - and I got a ride to the Péage anyway. Not to much place to stop but really a lot of people passing
There is not a place to curb, but drivers are all stopped when the light is red so I held my sign to the stopped drivers.  One slowed and brought me to the peage at Villefranche.

In May 2013 Insa and Jan hitched from this spot to direction Bordeaux. We weren’t taken to the Péage because the person wasn’t going there, but dropped off at a roundabout on the way which was also good.
i tried before and after the traffic lights, asked the drivers, smiled, during 2 hours... a girl passing by told me it usually works pretty easily for her.

en_UK.description:
Great place for traveling towards the north of France (Macon, Dijon, Paris) or the East, Germany, etc.

What you need to do is get your ass on the Kitchener-Marchand bridge. (métro Perrache, +5-10 minutes walk towards the saone) Make eye contact with drivers stopping at the traffic lights, and ask for a ride to VILLEFRANCHE. You really need a sign indicating this destination too. You must ask the driver to drop you at the péage of VILLEFRANCHE (entry of the motorway) where it's EASY to find another car heading towards your real destination. (paris, etc).

I always go there when i want to get out of Lyon, and never had to wait more than 15 minutes. There's heaps of traffic in the morning.

comments.comment:
I stood there for about 45 minutes at about noon in direction Marseille.
Its a good spot, there is a corner short befor it and the cars are slow. Right behind the spot is a little parking lot where cars can stop.

Found no one here as peolple are going too fast. Continue to the next gas station 10-15 min by walk and ask people there. Most are going to St. Etienne by they can drop you off at the first gas station.

en_UK.description:
Ce spot est meilleur que celui quai du Docteur Gailleton. Il faut venir aux heures d'affluence (entre 16h et 19h).La voie d'insertion réduit fortement le traffic à une seule voie ce qui crée un fort ralentissement.  Vous n'avez plus qu'a attendre devant le cul a cul des voitures. . 

I wait here for 20 min at 17 pm . All the cars from the quai du Docteur Gailleton have to decelerate because there is one single road to access to the on ramp. 
Come from 16 pm until19 pm to take advantage of the jam traffic.

fr_FR.description:
Ce spot est meilleur que celui quai du Docteur Gailleton. Il faut venir aux heures d'affluence (entre 16h et 19h).La voie d'insertion réduit fortement le traffic à une seule voie ce qui crée un fort ralentissement.  Vous n'avez plus qu'a attendre devant le cul a cul des voitures. . 

I wait here for 20 min at 17 pm . All the cars from the quai du Docteur Gailleton have to decelerate because there is one single road to access to the on ramp. 
Come from 16 pm until19 pm to take advantage of the jam traffic.

comments.comment: Gas station towards route 1. Bern, Lausanne, Zurich. There's a lot of local traffic, but I think it's a better spot than the other one where cars can't pull off.
Just had to ask drivers. I have waited 5min
I was so lucky. Man 30 years, no french speaker, sunday early morning, the first stopped car I asked, he rode me after Lausanne

Hitchhiked : on my own (girl)
Waiting time: 5min (asked driver)

It was quite a walk from the tram station (Butini), maybe 30min. On the way, there are loads of traffic lights and the road is going straight to the highway. I think there are very good possibilities to get a ride if you have a sign and try from one of the traffic lights. However, the gas station worked very well, I asked a first driver and he drove me past Lausanne. (Was going to Luzern).

en_UK.description:
A way to Lausanne/Bern/Montreux etc. Currently here's Agip's gas station. The only possibility here is to stop the car which entered on the station.
Not a good spot, I think.
This place is not so bad when trying to go to Paris. We had to wait about 30 minutes, cars can stop on parking places on the right... But it's maybe because it was at empty hours

comments.comment: We were dropped there, had to wait for 20min before being taken up north at antoher exit !
Use this spot to got norther on the highway, mostly only local people here.

en_UK.description: This spot is not a very good one, but cars can stop. Too many local cars... If your lucky, you can surely reach another spot up north
Direction Paris : If someone can drop you there, cars are going quite fast but there is enough space to stop. Not the safest and easiest spot in Tours, but it worked !

comments.comment:
I arrived at the station around 1am.
Not much traffic, I didn't find any lift that night but in the station there is a small empty room (with light and running radio though) where I could sleep. The employee were really friendly and relaxed.
The next day I found within 10minutes a ride to Limoges. Good one!

en_UK.description: Good service station when going south. quite a lot of cars...

comments.comment: Waited 5 minutes before going to paris ! twice in different days

en_UK.description: Direction South : Excellent service station, name "aire du poitou-charentes". Crowded place, lots of cars ! If someone can drop you from Niort, surely the best spot

comments.comment:
great to Paris but not the best to Brittany indeed.  
Super pour Paris mais pour la Bretagne il vaut mieux essayer de rejoindre un péage sur l'A83 : moins de monde mais toutes les voitures vont vers Nantes.

en_UK.description:
Direction North : Very Good spot to go up north (Paris). direction Paris : 5-15min to wait.

If you're going to Brittany/Breizh; then It can be longer. I had to wait for around 1h30 !

comments.comment: Found a ride to Paris after 1 minute !

en_UK.description:
Direction Paris/ Le Mans. This is a toll ("Péage"). For going there, go firstly to the petrol station at the exit of Angers.

There is a parking just after the toll. Cars can see you very well and pass close to you.
I have been picked up in 10 min for Paris, with a sign in the middle, of the day.

comments.comment: 15 minutes waiting, and find a car to Issoire which let me at a gaz station just before!

en_UK.description: There is space for cars to stop. Hitchhiked there once with a sign to Issoire and got a lift in few minutes. In 9 kilometers there's a gas station where you can be dropped off.
Great spot with lots of space for cars to stop. Got a ride in seconds to Spain. 4 kilometers from the center of  Saint Fleur

comments.comment: Roadside space, and low average speed. Warning though : traffic can be low

en_UK.description:
This service station is the last one if going to Dijon. When getting south, it's an excellent one, plenty of cars. 

For the A38 and dijon, we had to wait about 40 minutes, but It could had been faster if asking the drivers !
Good to go to Rennes, Laval...

comments.comment: a great guys, two rastafarians have picked me up till bulle and gruyeres.

en_UK.description: Seems to be a suitable possibility to find something to Lausanne / Geneva etc.

comments.comment: If you walk on 20m around the corner, you can stand at the beginning of the slip road where there is a wide hard shoulder where cars can stop safely. Another advantage is that you also get the traffic turning onto the slip road from the other direction of route de crissier. I waited 20mins and got a lift to the first service station at bavois. The only fly in the ointment is that by walking that extra 20m, you will be technically hitching illegally as it is past the motorway sign which stands 'just under the bridge'.

en_UK.description:
I was dropped here while traveling from Geneva to Fribourg. So I don't know how to reach here from the center of Lausanne. The place is not very comfortable for drivers - there's only single lane and if someone stops, following cars must stop too. However, it's a quite slow-speed place and it's not too difficult to catch something.
I was standing just "Under the bridge" ; )
Usually, cars go to Bern / Fribourg via this place. Well enough to find something.

comments.comment: Northbound: Quite a nice spot. The 'Autoroute' sign is a few hundred metres from the junction, so you can legally hitch here. There is space for a car to pull over whilst leaving room for passing traffic. Café by junction (opening times unconfirmed). I have hitched many times from here. Best lift took me to a Metro station in Paris. All traffic is at least going North. N145 is a busy-ish East West road.
Southbound is probably equally good. Please note that the slip road for the Southbound A20 is actually on the North side of the N145, but it curves round quickly and goes South.
Got a list directly to Paris from here :D

en_UK.description: To go North (Chateauroux, Paris, etc.)
I think it's a good place to go to Fribourg, Lausanne etc. There is enough place for drivers to stop, traffic light, relatively slow motion...

comments.comment: Tried to hitch direction bordeaux for 2 hours. Not many cars. In the end I hitched the departementale to Niort to get the motorway from there.

en_UK.description: Take care, I once hitch on the toll station with a friend (during summerà and was forced to leave the toll and stop at the little park station on the left. We left one hour later because of it.

comments.comment: Good place if you go to Bordeaux or south (Spain/Pays Basque) but almost 0 cars to Toulouse or Agen.

i waited for hours with a sign trying to go south towards spain (A63) - tons of people but no-one would take me. it was a saturday afternoon, tons of people going for vacation so full cars. i guess it was just bad luck.
Was going to Toulouse. No cars... I had to get to Bordeaux and got a lift from the big market place.
Aire de service de l'Estalot ... good spot for going south to Biarritz or Spain

en_UK.description:
To the south : Spain-Espana / Basque Country - Euskadi.

local cars but it works. We waited something like 30 min on a weekday.
Direction La Côte St André, there is a traffic light right here and enough space to stop thanks to the impassse.
To the West : Hitchhiked with a sign saying Aire de St-Romain to then reach bordeaux. Worked in less than 10-15 minutes.

To the West : sign Clermont, it worked in 10 minutes on a weekday morning. A car took me to the toll station of St-Etienne. Not too much traffic, but you can easily manage to find a car to the toll station
Sign clermont : worked in 5 min

comments.comment: In May 2013, Insa and Jan used this spot on the way from Lyon to Bordeaux to take a break. It was very easy to go westward again from here.

en_UK.description: Toll station before clermont. On a weekday, plenty of cars, some going down south, up north and others going to the west. A very good option

comments.comment: rivoli sud is the name of this gas station

Waited 2 hours early evening for a lift to Milan (returning skier from the alps). In that time 4 different police cars stopped, one informed us that we shouldn't be hitching from there but left us alone, the rest just ignored us. Whilst the police were there most drivers ignored us. Very friendly petrol staff though who asked friendly truck drivers if they could take us.

en_UK.description: A spot on the way to Vizille, etc. Not so good because there isn't so many people (most people from Grenoble uses the free "highway"), and drivers don't stop so much... At least you can ask when they wait for the traffic light to change !

fr_FR.description: Une étape sur la route pour aller à Vizille, puis dans l'Oisans ou autre. L'endroit n'est pas si bon, car il n'y a pas beaucoup de passage (les gens de Grenoble passent plutôt par la voie rapide) et les automibilistes s'arrêtent peu. Au moins, on peut aller demander directement aux gens au feu rouge !

en_UK.description: Good spot towards either La Mure or Oisans. People slow down at the roundabout (but still go fast !) and there's a huge place to stop.

fr_FR.description: Bon endroit pour faire du stop en allant vers La Mure ou vers les stations de l'oisans et Briançon. Les gens rallentissent au rond-point (mais vont quand même vite !) et il y a beaucoup de place pour s'arrêter.

en_UK.description: To go toward Oisans (La Bérarde, Les 2 Alpes, La Grave, Briançon...). Not a very safe spot because there's no much place to stop, and you must stay behind the safety barrier. Maybe is it better to hitchike on the other round-about, at the North of Bourg d'Oisans ? At least, here you get all the trafic from Grenoble and Bourg d'Oisans.

To go toward Oisans (La Bérarde, Les 2 Alpes, La Grave, Briançon...). Not a very safe spot because there's no much place to stop, and you must stay behind the safety barrier. Maybe is it better to hitchike on the other round-about, at the North of Bourg d'Oisans ? At least, here you get all the trafic from Grenoble and Bourg d'Oisans.

fr_FR.description: Pour aller en direction de Briançon ou des stations, il faut stopper juste avant le rond point près de l'entrée de "Point-P" car le contournement du Bourg d'Oisan est interdite aux piétons...

comments.comment:
For some reason locals never stop, and don't give reactions. Just keep walking and stick up your thumb and sign if a car comes along! 
There is always somebody who will also go to Taizé, and takes you.
No bus either. Maybe better to travel to Macon and hitchhike or take the bus from there.
Got a ride after 30 min walking along the road.
I hhked 2 times here towards Taize and got a lift in 30 minutes both times. Once it was almost dark. Try to get to Cormatin and from there it is a 30-40 minutes walk.

en_UK.description:
Direction: Taizé
Place: side of the road.
Locals are BS.

A good spot to go out from Grenoble by the Uriage road (you can reach this spot by bus/tram/train and 5-10 minutes walking). There is quite a lot of cars going towards Uriage, Vaulnaveys and VIzille, they still don't go fast, and it's safe.

fr_FR.description: Un bon spot pour sortir de Grenoble par la route d'Uriage (on peut y venir par tram/bus/train + 5-10 minutes de marche). Il y a pas mal de voitures allant à Uriage, Vaulnaveys et Vizille, qui ne vont pas encore trop vite, et il y a de la place pour s'arrêter.

comments.comment: Used as an escape route from the motorway. A guy from the motorway petrol station picked us up and brought to Macon A40 exit.

en_UK.description: Small road to Macon.

comments.comment: Within 1h 30min waiting 6-7 cars stopped, all of them only local. It was Saturday evening though which might be the problem.

en_UK.description: Parking lot beyond péage. Mostly local traffic going across the bridge (there is no toll for them).

comments.comment: We got a lift on Sunday morning after half an hour. It was a girl from northern France though, going for a summer camp (pure randomness).

en_UK.description: Parking lot in front of péage. Direction Bourg-en-Bresse.

comments.comment: Wanted to go to Chamonix but got a lift only to Annemasse.
I wanted to go to Annemasse or Cluses, and i found easily a car at the carpark on the right to Thonon. And it was not a day with a lot of cars (tuesday at 11am).

en_UK.description: Parking lot after péage. Lots of traffic going to Geneva.
Motorway entrance. No place to stop but in the road.
Small parking lot direction Chamonix.
Roundabout. Cars going to motorway direction Chamonix do not have to pay but the normal road goes through Sallanches. There is also cars entering the motorway from Sallanches.

comments.comment: We got a lift only to Aosta. It may be wise to wait for a car going far since here you get mostly long-distance traffic.

en_UK.description: Place to pull over at the crossroads with a small unused road. You get all the tunnel traffic here. To get here go through the village up the hill.

comments.comment: We made two big signs from pizza boxes, first dir. Milano, then also (CH) but no one stopped for a long time even though there was enough space and I guess everybody could clearly see us.

en_UK.description: Bus stop direction East.

Parking lot near the bridge. Most traffic goes through the tunnel so here you get only tourists going to the pass. An alternative is to climb the Napoleon route to the pass from the nortern side of the bridge (1,5-2 h).
Not many people go around and most of them are full.
Petrol station direction North. You will be seen from a large distance and there is a plenty of space to stop.
Small parking lot beyond the roundabout on the way to Martigny.

comments.comment: Seems not to be a good place. We moved after 30 minutes waiting.

en_UK.description: Roundabout in the direction to the motorway.

comments.comment: We were a bit lucky because we got a lift almost to Brig. Otherwise it seems mostly locals go around here.

en_UK.description: Direction Sion beyond the roundabout.
Brilliant place. Cars are slow, can see you from distance and there is a plenty of space.

comments.comment: The first car stopped but only local, then 30 minutes nothing. It is good to get out of the town this way and then try one more time.

en_UK.description: Cars going to Goms need to stop right in the road when they leave the roundabout.

comments.comment: Good for direction Luzern, Furka

en_UK.description: Small parking lot at the roundabout exit direction Furkapass.
Direction Furkapass.
Motorway direction Chur. It is wise to wait for someone going a longer distance since this is a big crossroads.

Best place to get a lift out of Felletin. Ask to be dropped at carrefour de la Seiglière if your drivers stops in Aubusson. But you can also try to get lifts while walking before getting to this point.

Not recommended!!! the worst place every even though it's a big petrol station etc. We stayed there about 5 hours trying to get to Lyon, it's better to take another road-pararel. Most of people in order to avoid paying peage they don't take this way to get to Lyon. Really waste of time!!!

comments.comment:
Not too many cars but steady. Last service station before the border. Just talk to people, got a ride within 5min to Italy in the evening.
Service station is open 24/7, very friendly staff, let you stay in the small shop at night

en_UK.description: Service Station Agip

Spanish truck driver which we came from Bordeaux left us here at mid-night and he said tomorrow sunday he went to sleeping and we hitchhike a guy to the highway enterance in Poitiers (weird guy he looking us like crayz and explaining he doesn't trust people at night and stairing at them). he drop us at the enterance of the highway but for 45 mins low traffic and no body stpped, so we went inside highway to service area nearby ~4 km.

comments.comment: If you are southbound cross the street before the paypoint. trucks come her from the A10 and take the national route to bordeaux. I think that's the best way. When i figured out the trick it took me only like 15mins... I met a guy once at the roundabout before the paypoint who had waited alrteady over a day...

en_UK.description: No space and nobody even the small cars are intended to take you.

Never, ever again! There are only 15 vehicles entering this place for the whole 12 hours at night and early morning, but we manage to stop one old couple with caravan after a horrible night (cold, without food) they took us 5 km further to the exit of highway.

comments.comment:
Very good spot to go to Paris or Tours. These cities are pretty much the only destination people are going to from here.
Don't go on the other side of the toll gate, it's forbidden.

en_UK.description:
We didn't even try to hitchhike one guy stopped and said Paris? and he was speaking English very well for a French guy :)
This place is under works until 2014 apparently.
Many people are taking the highway to Geneva from here, got a ride in 15min.

On the corner of the D704 and D19 (Arfeuille on google maps). I was stood with enough space for cars heading north from Saint-Yrieix-la-Perche to pull into the Netto entrance behind me.
Although the guy that stopped actually pulled onto the pavement in the junction (luckily, cars aren't going too fast here).

Took me all the way to Limoges.

fr_FR.description: Au coin de le D704 et le D19, avec Netto deriere de moi, donc il ya bcp d'espace pour les voitures a stopper dans l'entrance de parking (mais en fait le mec a stoppé just a cote de moi, mais hereusement tout le monde vont lentement ici).

comments.comment: J'ai attendu longtemps... Ce n'est en tout cas pas une place pour aller vers le Sud, tout le monde va à Paris. J'ai finis par accepter que quelqu'un me dépose sur l'air de Baume les mines (direction Paris) ou j'ai pu changer de côté de l'autoroute...

en_UK.description:
I had no luck finding a spot closer to the Autoroute so I tried this little layby (you can't see it on this map but look on google earth / satellite map

The traffic moves too fast, the layby is too small, you have to climb through bushes to get here, it's just a bad spot.

fr_FR.description:
J'avais pas bonchance trouver un endroit pres de l'autoroute, donc j'ai essayé ce ptit parking ici (c'est pas sur cet carte mais c'est visible sur google earth).

Tout le monde vont trop vite, il n'y a pas d'espace a arreter, c'est nul ici.

en_UK.description:
There is a layby here, outside Club Nautique de Limoges. Traffic has a long time to see you and is heading towards the A20. This spot looks better than it actually is, but it's still ok.

A local recommended that I move further towards the A20 and wait near the traffic lights but I ignored this advice. Don't know if it would have worked out better.

fr_FR.description: Il y a un ptit aire de stationnement en face de Club Nautique de Limoges, mais pas bcp des voitures arretent.

comments.comment: On peut rejoindre l'autre côté en empruntant le pont un peu plus au nord

en_UK.description:
There is a big rock to sit on here, just next to the parking area. There isn't a huge volume of traffic, but everyone is going very slowly, and there are cars and trucks parked nearby, you could ask there too.

I got a lift in less than 5 minutes.

There is also a forest if you need a hidden place to spend the night.

fr_FR.description:
J'ai attendu a coté d'un pierre grand pres de le station d'essence, et apres 5 minutes quelquan m'a pris un stop.

Il y a des camions ici aussi, et un foret si vous voulez dormir

comments.comment: I got quite a good ride here going to Blois, but I won't recommend it to anybody trying to reach the highway.

en_UK.description:
I thought there would be a lot of traffic from Chateauroux to the A20 down this road.

I was very wrong.

Eventually someone picked me up who wasn't leaving town but "knew a better spot".
See the red dot further north for more information...

I still don't like talking about Chateauroux.

fr_FR.description:
J'attendais ici pour un assez longtemps ici. Apres ca, un mec m'a pris un stop pour me mettre dans un endroit "meilleur".

Il m'est emmené au nord, dans un zone industriel ou j'etais piégé pour 8 heures, mdr.

en_UK.description:
Waited here for hours for a lift north on the A20. Quite a lot of slow traffic (maybe 1-5 cars per minute maybe), mainly leaving McDonald's, but noone stopped.

Slept in the field to the north near the autoroute, then the same problem the next morning.

In the end I hitched back to Chateauroux and got a train.

fr_FR.description:
J'attendais pour un loooooongtemps ici.
Apres 4 hours j'ai trouvé un endroit a dormir entre le zone industriel et l'autoroute, mais j'avais la meme probleme dans le prochaine matin.

en_UK.description:
Started walking back to Chateauroux with my sign held out after a disastrous attempt at hitching from the industrial estate, and got a lift half way. Bonus.
Traffic is quite fast here though.

fr_FR.description:
Apres mon échec dans le zone industriel au nord, je marchais au Chateauroux pour prendre le train, et j'ai trouvé un stop sur cet route.

Mes le circulation est assez vite.

comments.comment: we wanted to go direction karlsruhe but there were so little cars that after some time we decided to try another spot.
After 2 hours during a night in summer (full cars) I got a ride all the way to Wiesbaden, near Frankfurt. I'm still grateful for the couple that took me with them.

I started two times from this place, first time it was very very difficult to find someone, we waited about 3 hours, second time was a little bit easier, but it took us also about 1 hour to get away from there. But it was both times on weekdays, so many people are on the way to work and don´t drive longer distances. Maybe on weekend its better...

en_UK.description: don't know if I was just lucky, but I got a ride after 2 minutes directly to Berlin from here. I think it's the best spot for everybody who wants to hitchhike large distances from Switzerland to the north of Germany

comments.comment: Quite a bit of a wait here as few cars will stop - best to stand just before the bus stop, or next to the traffic lights
Small service station but I didn't have to wait long.

en_UK.description: Service station on the way to Bern, Zurich and Basel.
Only about 10% of the traffic is actually going on the A10 highway, but cars can stop here, can see you, and we did hitch a ride to Paris.
Perfect spot to hitch back to Tour after the Chateau of Chenonceau.

Tool bar direction Clermont/Bourges.
Lots of traffic and car can stop.

comments.comment: This place is not a good choice for heading north to Paris, because more drivers are following the D323. I waited 1h30min and no car stopped. After that I walked to the nearby Aire with the Station BP and found a lift in 15min in the direction of Paris/ Lille.

en_UK.description:
Good to go to Le Mans- Paris (by the A 11).
In front of a restaurant -on the other side of the road-, lot of space for the cars to stop, they go quite slowly because they're just quitting a roundabout.
If you wait too much, you can cross the road and go through the open fence (some meters before the separation between the D 323 and the entrance of A11) to reach the petrol station service.

this is just in front of the train station, you can easily reach it from the city center (10 min walk) if you're going east to aurillac you can easily take a ride from here there's a parking space where cars can stop and we wait 15 minutes to get a ride

fr_FR.description: Gare, c'est un très bon endroit pour aller vers Aurillac, on a attendu 15 et tu peut facilement marcher du centre ville jusqu'ici

comments.comment: Only hitched from there once. There is this little parking spot in front the bank where cars can go in to pick you up. So it's actually quite easy for them to stop. Most of the cars go to the highway to Winterthur. The first big gas station is just a few kilometers away and almost everyone goes at least there. A sign definitely helps. Ist a great spot. You can walk there from the city centre and it takes out really fast.
Great spot. We were two guys and got a lift to St. Gallen after 15min. We used a sign.

Hitchhiked : on my own (girl)
Waiting time: 15min (had a sign saying : NACH WINT-SH)

There is a traffic light before entering the tunnel that goes straight to the highway. Still pretty close to the centre, walkable distance. There is a bank on the right with a little parking spot where cars can pull over. Car in queue at the traffic light can easily see you with a sign. Waited about 15min and got a ride to the next gas station on the highway, where I got a ride to the border with Austria (was going to Innsbruck).

Nearest tram station HALDENEGG (tram 6). Walk only 5 minutes to the spot.

en_UK.description: Generaly, it's hard to get from Zurich, but if you are lucky it's quite good spot. There is a big traffic, many cars are going direction St. Gallen, Wintherthur (the biggest trafiic is about 3 p.m. when people are going back home from work) but there is no place for them to stop safely. But it's the only place, becouse here starts the tunnel going directly on a highway. You should have a sing with the name of your direction and go with it along the road and wait for a car to stop.

comments.comment:
I arrived around 19h in august, there were already 2 hitchhikers. The first has waited the whole afternoon, the 2nd for 2 hours, both heading toward Dijon or Paris.

A car every 5 or 10 min, mainly locals or people heading south.

I found a car with another hitchiker at 20h30
je me suis posé avant l'arret de bus, une personne m'a emmené seulement a champagne au mont  d'or. avec ma pluie et le manque de temps j'ai fini en car jusqu’à belleville, ça ne coûte que 2 euros

en_UK.description: Good spot if you wanna go to the south (direction La rochelle). Don't stay here if you plan to go to north!
Going to the north it's not difficult from here, but it will take long time: it's the national road and from here you're gonna change a lot of cars (they drive for 20/30 km in average)
We got a lift to Vannes after a couple of minutes from here

comments.comment: 10 minutes à deux vers 17hr.

fr_FR.description: Bon spot en direction de saint léonard de Noblat / bourganeuf / Clermont Ferrand par la nationale. Les voitures ont le temps de se garer et de nous voir.
Spot juste en face de la gendarmerie. Peu de visibilité et les voitures commencent à rouler vite. Elles peuvent facilement se garer juste après.

en_UK.description: Guret => Bourganeuf : Average
Gueret => Genouillac

comments.comment: Northbound: The worst place from which I have EVER tried to hitch. Got dropped here twice. Once I was picked up and taken to another junction a few kms up. Other time I waited 3 hours, then gave up and hitched back South (I live near Limoges). It's soul-destroying.

Forgot to add that there is a service station on the northbound route, either just before or just after Chateauroux. I got a lift after ten minutes. Not guaranteed, but definitely a far better option that the aforementioned junction.

fr_FR.description: Pour prendre l'A20 en direction de Limoges ou Paris. Un panneau est préférable. Il est également possible d'aller vers LeBlanc/poitiers. Pas une super place.
Direction Guéret. Un super spot pour le stop ! De la place pour se garer. Les voitures vont doucement.
Aire de repos de Boismandé. Beaucoup de monde passe par ici. Il suffit de demander aux pompes !!

comments.comment: A perfect place to go in direction of Paris. Hitchhike just after shops.

I was there on a Sunday afternoon and I wanted to go in the direction of Dijon/ Paris.
There was a lot of traffic but after about one hour I found somebody. 
This place is perfect for going to Lyon or the sorroundings!

fr_FR.description: Beaucoup de directions possible : gueret, aubusson, felletin, clermont ferrand. Panneau obligatoire !

en_UK.description: Good spot ! De la place pour les voitures, elles vont doucement.

comments.comment: Best place to head to the south of France from the center of Lyon ( highway A7).

Waiting here 1h without result. 2 guys told me to go to the South, in the spot of "La Mulatière"; The thing is that many people here are staying in the center of the city and do not take the highway (A7) to the south.

I waited around 20min to catch a ride onto the highway to Orange.

Not a perfect spot but enough space to  stop.
Very good spot in my opinion, people don't drive very fast and have space to stop. I was hitchhiking with a sign for "St Etienne"

en_UK.description: September 2012, Aiton 24. Very little traffic. I waited two hours to got a ride direction Chambery/Grenoble. At least, there is clean toilet just near the spot.
The gas station in the direction of Toulouse.

comments.comment: Two backpacker got a ride to Lugano without even asking, just sat with our begs and "looked clean and nice" as the lady said.

Waited for a while here, I think its a bit too big and people feel anonymous... Also people are going in all directions so that doesnt help. A sign saved me in the end, otherwise if youre ballsy you should probably ask around and thats how youll get results
Got a ride to the Swiss border near Lugano from here! Although just as a warning, Do not get dropped at the Swiss border!

en_UK.description: Gas station before the 17KM tunnel towards Italy

comments.comment:
This petrol station is located on the " wrong " side of the city : it's on the east side, on the motorway towards the west, so it is before the city and not after it : so you don't get the traffic that departs from the city, only the vehicles coming from Le Mans, Paris and further east.
So it's not ideal, but it's the only spot that's on the motorway and that's reachable from the city with urban public transport (bus).
With a sign "Toulouse" or "Bordeaux" I waited nearly 1 h. I decided to change it to "Nantes" as most cars go there and was taken in 10 min. So even if you go south, go to Nantes before.
Pretty good spot, not very busy, but in the direction of Nantes it gets the job done.
Good spot. i started hitchiking at 8 am. Even if many people go to Le Mans / Paris, i got a car in ten minutes, direction Niort. Be patient, have a smile, it's easier then

en_UK.description: Petrol station located East of Angers, it is in the direction Angers ==> Nantes (towards the west and the Atlantic). Accessible with public transport from the city centre (cross the motorway on the nearby bridge).
In front of the library there is a place which allows car to stop and lead you to Grenoble.

fr_FR.description: En face de la médiathèque il y a suffisement de place pour que les voitures s'arrêtent et vous mênnent à Grenoble par la nationale.

comments.comment:
Waiting here lonely 45 min, the spot looks pretty good with a huge place behind us to park but no trafic ...
A man takes me to the first stop (gaz station) in the south on the highway (A7) where I've founded directly somebody going to Sète.
The place looks good, but it took me 1hour of waiting after i resigned. A road signs says there is a way to get on A7 to south, but it's far away.

en_UK.description: W

de_DE.description: In eins der Kiosks am Ausgang arbeitet eine die ein nach Mulhouse-Roxheim fährt :-)

en_UK.description: Heading south ? Easy.
A bus stop by the road to Chateauroux. Good place, we walked there about 30 minutes from the highway to Paris.

comments.comment: They can indeed be long... took me two hours but it is indeed a good spot, at least did not find any better ones in direction of Bern

en_UK.description: Best place to hitch out of Fribourg, esp. towards german-speaking Switzerland. Take the bus to Portes-de-Fribourg and stand just before the bridge that crosses the highway and leads to the traffic circle where people get on the highway. (theres no place to stop in the traffic circle itself.) A sign is indispensable. Even with this though, waiting times can be long depending on your luck... fribourg is just damn small

de_DE.description: Bester Ort von Fribourg rauszukommen, ueberhaupt in richtung Deutschschweiz. Bus nach Portes-de'-Fribourg, dann stellt man sich vor der Brucke, die die Autostrasse kreuzt. An der andere Seite steht die Fahrkreuz der Autostrasse, aber da hoert niemand auf. Schild braucht man unbedingt und eben kann man damit ziemlich lang warten, jenach Glueck und Tageszeit und so...

fr_FR.description: Meilleur endroit pour quitter Fribourg, surtout en direction de la suisse allemanique. prends le bus a Portes-de-Fribourg et mets toi devant le pont qui traverse la route, a lautre cote il ya le rond-point de lautoroute, mais personne ne sy arrete. Il faut une signe

comments.comment: People don't stop easily but I guess that's just the kind of city it is... Never waited more than an hour though.

en_UK.description: Buses line 15 and 16 stop there, stop "Les Cedres".

fr_FR.description: Arret de bus "Les Cedres" sur la ligne 15 et 16.

comments.comment: just ask to people if they can help you, there are some coward who don't look at you but other people gonna help you, i juste wait here 5 minutes

a great place to stop, if you get stuck here you can walk to the zad and find a place to stay for the night, plus to get out of the zad to go towards Vannes it's really practical, i got a ride from a trucker at 6 AM who dropped me off all the way to Lorient

en_UK.description: It's not difficult to to stop cars to go in the direction of Lyon there. But it's not legal to be there because the police consider it's on the highway. There's a place where the cars can to stop quickly and secure.

Good spot for direction "Louhans - Chalon/s Saône".
Put you front of the garage "Mercedes", and make a sign. 
It depends if there's many cars or not. 
But you can find someone...

Very Good Spot to the direction "Bourg En Bresse - Lyon". 
If it's early in the morning, or the end of the afternoon, when peoples get in or out from their job, you will find easily someone who'll pick you up at the next village on the road. But, don't panic! You won't wait more than 5 mn, each time you will stop at a village on the road, and can be at Bourg en Bress in 1 hour.

Direction "Villars - Les Dombes - Lyon". 
You won't wait more than 20 mn, i'll say.
Very Good Spot for the Direction "Grenoble".

comments.comment: Right now, it's a big construction site with little to no space for cars to stop.
constructions going on! few/no space to stop, but there's enough time to ask people at the traffic light and jump in
Constructions are over, but didn't try hitching. Seems busy but loads of traffic lights, big parking area, bus stops etc where it could work.

en_UK.description:
I could not believe that it will be so easy to get taken from this spot, but it's works and really faster. 
Direction Valence - Lyon, or the Péage, Fuel Station "Voreppe".
The best spot for Direction "Varces - Vif".

fr_FR.description: Direction Tours. Circulation : 10 voitures/minute. Vitesse : 80 km/h

en_UK.description: This spot seems better than the previous one for me. Lot of space to park, and not only local people pass here. There is not so many cars, but the goal is only to get out to south. Jump, do hello by your hand, keep the biggest smile and hold a sign SUD SVP ("south, please"). Good luck. Worked for me in 2 hours (man alone).

comments.comment: Les voitures peuvent s'arrêter facilement sur le bas côté. Avec un panneau Poitiers, j'ai été prise en 5 minutes.

en_UK.description: Bes Place to leave La Rochelle if you want to go East or North
Many cars. Just wait before the hard shouldren begins.
A lot of cars going east so just wait by the pedestrian crossing, where hard shouldder starts. Cars are going slow enough to nitice you and stop on the hard shoulder.
A lot of cars and plenty of space to stop if you wait by the pedestrian crossing, where hard shoulder starts. Direction east.

Wait at the junction of the minor road (Chemin de l'Ecluse); this is the last bit of pavement before moutain roads begin. Plenty of cars and a lot of locals hitch hike to and fro the mountains. My wainting time was about 2 minutes!

comments.comment: 2 people for Aigle, after waiting for a while down the road with drivers reacting very badly, we tried here for almost two hours until we finally got a ride.

en_UK.description:
There is a little car park and all the cars that pass there go to Leysin. Got a ride as soon as I got out of a previous one!

This spot is okay for going (directly) towards Aigle as well, little traffic but much easier to stop than down the road.

comments.comment: 45 min waiting around 5 p.m on a sunny sunday afternoon in winter

en_UK.description: In direction of towns up north and Paris. Ok let's be honest, you're in the center of france, which means not many traffic. We (my gf and I) tried hitchhiking in this region for a weekend during the winter season. There were few cars on a sunday afternoon, few of them only going enough far away from this town. Indeed, be patient, it can only works. You've got enough space, people can see you well, there are lights if you have to hitch in the dark. Remember this road is a free motorway, so you may ask for the toll station 40-50km up north which is a better option to find a car going to Paris. No service station between...

Just arriving in town, we directly found a car to the Morvan moutains from here in only 5 minutes. Anyway, if you don't find cars near the train station (train station is always a good spot if you want to hitchhike from the city centers), you gotta walk around 30min until the exit of the town.

Here is the ski station of the Morvan mountains. It's a 900m summit. When there is enough snow (20-30cm), a local association opens the station which belonged to the club alpin français some decades ago. 

There are about 40km of cross-country ski trails. If you want to go there by thumb for a weekend from nevers or Paris, it's possible. A car left us 4 km from the ski station on the D500 (at the hameau "les fosses" after Arleuf). 

When arriving at the cottage of the station, tell the person in charge of the rental skiing cottage that you want to hitchhike to go back down in the valley after your ski session. He will try to find you a car, asking the people. 

Such a good spirit in this station and good people too.
