The man found us a car going to our gite in the valley at the end of the first day. The second day, he found us a car to Nevers ! 

Otherwise, if there is no snow, this place is completely empty, you're here in one of the most inhabited place in France !!!! Good luck :)

fr_FR.description: Direction  Manthelan. Il est possible pour les voitures de se garer facilement. Cet endroit permet de pouvoir être pris en stop par les personnes venant de la D943 qui constinuent la majorité du flux pour aller en direction de Manthelan. Le cheminement pieton depuis le centre de Loches n'est pas adapté.

en_UK.description: That's where I usually start hitchhiking when I want to go towards Bern or Lausanne. Big double-roundabout with lots of traffic. There's not really a suitable place for cars to stop but I've been using this spot regularly since two years with success. Waiting time between 1min-40min

comments.comment: After more tests I suggest you to put a panel "Angers" because a lot of people go there. You'll find an oil station betwen Nantes and Angers where more people goes to Paris.

en_UK.description: Very good to go to Paris. Enough space, people go slow. I waited 1 minute (end of afternoon).
No space at all! if the trafic is not full, people go fast and the spot become dangerous. But it's easy to find someone going to St Etienne.
Waited hours and hours to go to the North from there. Very difficult. However the spot is good: enough space, trafic slow.
Best spot ever to go to Nantes, but difficult to go there!
Perfect to go to Nantes
Best place ever to go to Rennes. Not a lot of space but you'll be happy to have waited less than 5 minutes :)
Perfect to go to Treillières or Grandchamp. Each time I wait less than 10 minutes
bad onramp, much traffic, little space to stop... the coop gas station is a good spot to go bern, however. going north is very hard.
got frustrated with the service station nearby & walked up. nice layby, chased away by the cops, caught a lift at the entrance where there is 0 space to stop...

comments.comment: The perfect spot. Been doing it few times times and never takes more than 10 minutes.

en_UK.description: A small gas station (close to the citadelle and the tunnel) where I got a lift directly to Lausanne after 3 minuts (saturday, 11am). Maybe I was a bit lucky, but despite of the few cars refueling there, most of them are heading at least to Pontarlier. The whole route until the motorway in Switzerland, it is pretty good to hitchhike. Crowded of cars going in both direction (Besancon - Lausanne) where you always find several round abouts. (BUT MAYBE NOT SO GOOD ON SUNDAYS). You should always get a lift at least to the round about close Etalans/Valdahon.
Petrol station Gevrey Chambertin, good to find a lift direction north to pass dijon or to go more down southward direction lyon

comments.comment: Good place in a Sunday at lunch time not much traffic but the third or forth car stopped and give me a lift to Lausanne!

en_UK.description: Quite good spot, space to pull over, a lot of traffic in daytime, I waited 20min to get ride to next parking right before Nyon...

de_DE.description: Guter Platz, ich wartete 20min bis jemand hielt, und mich bis nächsten Parkplatz kurz vor Nyon brachte...

en_UK.description: Petrol station short before soon after highway starts, very good for asking drivers, I waited there in the morning 5 minutes and got lift to Milano.

While it is not a bad spot per se there are very few cars passing here and you'll have a hard time getting away.

However while stuck here enjoy the comments other frustrated hitchhikers left on the back of the street sign ...

It is difficult to 'catch' drivers entering from both sides as the entry is bad for stopping.

However in the evening you can go a bit away from the entrance and stand under a light-post.

the spot directly behind the cash station is pretty good. you can go in both directions form there and its easy for cars to stop and everybody will see you. only thing is, that there is not really a lot of traffic.

fr_FR.description:
Péage de Tain l'Hermitage.
ll y a la place pour les voitures pour s'arreter et faire demi tour, un bon spot malgrès le faible traffic

comments.comment: Might b useful to use a (small) sign when approaching drivers, they appeared to look friendlier and more understanding. I got a pasteboard inside the store.

2 guys, 4PM

Excellent spot, a lot of cars passing by in direction to Zürich. Just stand before exit, we found a ride in 10 minutes.

en_UK.description: best spot for hitchhiking in direction south, east or west! only if you're hitching to somewhere in Germany, you maybe better go to the rest area in Weil am Rhein!
best place for hitchhiking to Basel or Bern!

comments.comment: Wrong place on the map, sorry, how to delete it ?

en_UK.description: Going to Niort. Pretty good place, secure, small area to parc cars. Very secure. I waited less then 10 min with my pannel.

comments.comment: We (2 ppl) got a car here to Luzern in 10 minutes on a saturday morning.

en_UK.description:
Not really a good spot. Only decent for traffic coming from the east. There is some space to stop just before the roundabout. Enough traffic on a workday morning, otherwise little. Okay for going the 24 south towards Sursee and Luzern, but many cars are going up on the motorway (A1).

There is a nice hiking trail going here from Aarau (1h).

comments.comment: 2 ppl, sunny saturday. Waited 1 hour to go towards Interlaken.

25 april 2015 the Swiss Hitchhikers championship was held. At leas 4 teams got stuck here, it was a cloudy day and we were going in direction of the Gotthard tunnel. We the first to leave got out of there in 2 h 30 min. We decided to take a ride to Kriens. The last team to leave waited for 5 h and 30 min. I hear this can be a pretty good spot but that day it was a trap.

en_UK.description:
Quite busy rest area (going southeast) with petrol station, shop and restaurant. (Also parking and shop on the other side, northwest-wards.) You can eiher walk around the parking talking to people directly or stand/sit here at the exit with a sign. There is nice space to stop and cars are slow. 

If your driver only goes to Luzern, but you are in a hurry to continue along the A2 or A8, this might be the spot to change at. 

Also, there are many nice spots for a tent in the forest below.

comments.comment: 2 ppl, sunday, midday, rainy. Waited 10 minutes to go to Interlaken.

en_UK.description: Good spot just outside of Brienz for going to Interlaken. Good visibility and lots of space to stop, plus you look more "in need" than when hitching from the city where there are buses, boats and trains.

comments.comment: Waited here (2 ppl) for one hour with a sign to Wimmis / 11 west without succes. Walked to Wimmis instead (1h).

en_UK.description: Around here is probably the best spot for getting out of Spiez - either up on the A8 or towards Wimmis (less traffic).

comments.comment: Waited here for half an hour an evening at 8 without success and with almost no traffic.

en_UK.description:
Okay spot (best in Wimmis) for going further into the Simmental up to Zweisimmen. You can stand in the middle of the roundabout to catch all the traffic, or before it. However there is not a lot of traffic and drivers might not like the space there is to stop.

If you loose hope you can easily take the train at the nearby train station.

comments.comment: 2 ppl waited here for one hour on a cloudy May morning with a sign for Gstaad. There was quite a lot of traffic.
Many local traffic so getting to Bern was a challenge even in a nice summer afternoon, waited almost 1 hour. Safe spot though.

en_UK.description: Roundabout. Best spot in Zweisimmen. Drivers can stop easily.

comments.comment: 2 people, sunny day. Waited for 90 min before taking the nearby bus. Not so many people seem to go south over the mountain pass from here, at least not in the end of May...

en_UK.description: Nice spot for going south and up to the pass Col du Pillon (1546m). After a roundabout, with a bench and place to stop. However, we are talking about a small mountain road with not so much traffic.

comments.comment: 2 ppl, late May, rain. First car coming picked us up and took us to the next village.

en_UK.description:
Mountain pass Col du Pillon (1546m) with cable lift up to a nearby peak at ~ 3000m.

This place is very exposed and pretty isolated with coldness and lots of wind most of the time, so the little cars passing by are likely to pick you up if you smile nicely.
Recycling area next to the road (on the northern side). Cars can easily stop here and they see you from far away. Best spot in / around Les Diablerets.
Not a good spot, cars are too fast and space is too small.

This is better than the spots further to the east along the 11 in Le Sepey, but it's still a bad spot. (For going towards Aigle that is, cars going east will find it impossible to stop here.) Cars can't stop legally and there is really not a lot of space to stop at all. It is better to use the spot up north at the parking even if you miss most of the traffic.

comments.comment: 2 ppl, weekday morning, May. Got picked up fast all the way to Chamonix.

en_UK.description:
Good spot for going to France / Chamonix / Mont Blanc. It's a very nice scenic one hour hike up to here from the city center passing by the castle ruin and lots of vineyards.

There is a restaurant and parking.

comments.comment: when hitching in between the small towns, distances within two hours, it is not so hard.

en_UK.description: Not good for going west, no place to stop.
Not good for going west. No space to stop.

comments.comment: The place is good and there were many cars, plus this was the best space we could find around Chamonix for going west - so we waited and waited, until someone finally picked us (2 ppl) after half a day... (it was rainy)

en_UK.description: This bus stop is a good place for going west. (The barrier pins seen on google street view are not there anymore.)

comments.comment: Rainy day, 2 ppl with sign Geneve/Lyon. Got picked after one hour.

en_UK.description:
First (?) péage (for the whole motorway) when going west. It might be a good idea to try to hitchhike here if you're stuck in the (south)east laying valley / villages and want to go far - just write "Péage de Cluses". 

This péage is just as good as any péage: Lots of traffic and low speed. 

If you don't want to stand directly at the péage you have the option of standing right in front of the parking area that comes just after, here cars are still slow and you can catch more of the traffic.

comments.comment: LOTS of traffic, so we tried with a sign to Nimes directly. That was a bit over the top, but we got picked up to Chambéry after changing the sign. Total waiting time: 1h.
Kicked out by the highway workers while waiting on the edge of the booth...
Cars accelerate after péage and it might be difficult for them to cross all the lanes to stop at the side. But it took us only 10 min to get a ride to Grenoble.

I was going from Marseille to Geneva. I was dropped further on the D2 (to Chamonix), 5-10min after this toll, so impossible to get a ride to Geneva after that. Make sure to tell your driver to drop you at this toll if he/she is going on the D2, otherwise stay in the car if going on the A41. A LOT of cars. Havent tried myself but that is the spot I should have been..

en_UK.description: Giant péage. Going south the rest area is too far away from the péage (cars going very fast), so the best option is to stand right in it.

comments.comment: we tried on the other side of the road in front of the traffic lights, with a sign and without a sign. it was on a sunday morning around 9 am, and there were very few cars. we waited one hour or so before someone going to strasbourg stopped (our goal was lyon so we get off at the aire des portes d'angers in angers).

en_UK.description:
Towards Angers/Paris

near the traffic light.

Very good spot, you can stand with a sign or better walk along the lane looking at drivers waiting for the light to go green.

To reach it, take the bus 85 (2 or 3 per hour), stop at "Carrière", then take "rue des carrières" which meets the "rue de paris" near a footway, cross the lane to go safe between the two barriers and walk to the lights. 71 -> CIFAM works also but runs also on working hours.

safer than on the lane

fr_FR.description:
Vers Angers/Paris

Attendre à-côté du feu au bout de la voie de parking avec un panneau ou mieux, remonter la voie de stockage (les conducteurs attendent au feu) avec un panneau.

Pour l'atteindre, prendre le bus 85 (2 ou 3 par heure) jusqu'à "Carrière", 
au petit rond-point, marcher dans la rue des carrières jusqu'au bout, elle arrive sur la rue de Paris que vous devez rejoindre, passer les buissons, aller entre les glissières au milieu de la route et marcher jusqu'au feu. 

Voir aussi le bus 71 -> CIFAM mais ne roule qu'aux horaires de travail.

comments.comment: Déposé ici pour continuer vers Clermont-Ferrand par quelqu'un s'arrêtant à Saint-Étienne. Beaucoup de trafic, mais attente un peu longue au rond-point. Ça vaut sûrement le coup d'aborder les conducteurs à la station service.

en_UK.description: Gas station

fr_FR.description: Station service

en_UK.description: Direction Clermont-Ferrand. Trolley station, terminus "Route de Lyon" line 1. No need to stop in Panazol.

fr_FR.description: Direction Clermont-Ferrand. Terminus du trolley ligne 1 "Route de Lyon". Inutile de reprendre un bus pour stopper à Panazol, on a de bonnes chances d'être pris ici.

en_UK.description: Direction Angoulême / Poitiers.
Direction Poitiers.

Trafic light, to go north on the free motorway with a sign (at least on the station "Beaune-les-Mines"), when you come from the east. A lot of inapropriate traffic. It's better to reach Beaune-les-Mines by bus (except if you're leaving the motorway before to go to Poitiers).

fr_FR.description: Feu rouge, pour prendre l'autoroute gratuite vers le nord, avec un panneau. Beaucoup de trafic inapproprié. Il vaut mieux atteindre la grosse station "Beaune-les-Mines" en bus, sauf si on bifurque avant pour Poitiers.

en_UK.description: If you want to go in town. the bus station is not far anyway, near the next roundabout.

fr_FR.description: Pour aller en ville. Sinon l'arrêt de bus est au prochain rond-point.
Direction Limoges. On peut stopper avant, inutile de marcher jusqu'ici !

en_UK.description: Direction Limoges. There is place for cars to stop.

fr_FR.description: Direction Limoges. Les voitures ont de la place pour s'arrêter.

en_UK.description:
Heading to SAVONA. After waiting 1,5h at the Reststop of the A4 before this turnoff I got bored and I wanted to try this toll station, somebody had told me about. I walked behind the guardrail along the highway - don't do this, dangerous! I had to cross a bridge that had a low traffic 3 lane highway beneath me. I couldn't walk on the inside, no emercency lane/shoulder. So I held onto the fence from the outside and walked on a 30cm wide path. In the middle of the bridge on of the flagstones was loose and tilted, a few crumbs fell down, no cars underneath - yet very scary. I made it safely to the toll station and had a sign SAVONA - a bit too small. After 10 min a car stopped but since they didn't go south and couldn't take me to the next southbound gas station I let them go. After a total of 25 min the police showed up and was super friendly with trying to speak english :) They said it was too dangerous for me to stand there so they took me to a bus stop to go to the city and take the train to Savona.
So because a car HAD stopped, if you can get there and have a sign the place is probably not too bad. Just don't walk along the highway.

Direction TOULOUSE (south) :

Access via bus 2 from downtown (direction Centre Commercial Ouest - Bus stop : Foirail)

You should stand right before the access lane, before the red light.

Going towards TOULOUSE you should either find :

--a ride that will leave you at the next rest area (Aire de Pech Montat - 16 kms south), which has a gas station and a store.

--or a ride that will get you at or pass the tollbooth (Péage in French), which is 20 kms south from the hitchhiking point ( at exit 54).

CAREFUL : The autoroute is free starting a bit south of Brive and going North almost to Orléans. As a consequence, lots of local people take the freeway to go to small places south of the town, in the countryside, and they often get off before the next tollbooth, in the middle of nowhere (exits 52 and 53) where there aren't a lot of cars, so you don't want that :) Make sure you understand how far your ride is going and where they can drop you off.

NOTE: The McDonald's parking lot across the road is the main meeting point for carpoolers. In case you don't manage to get a ride, you might want to try to go there and see if you can find someone. A ride from brive to toulouse usually costs 10€.

fr_FR.description:
Direction TOULOUSE (sud) : 

Accès par le bus n° 2 depuis le centre (direct. C.C. Ouest, arrêt : Foirail)
Mettez-vous juste avant la route d'accès à l'autoroute, avant le feu tricolore.

En direction de TOULOUSE, essayez de :

--trouver une voiture qui vous arrêtera à l'Aire de Pech Montat (16 kms au sud), qui a une station essence, un magasin, et généralement du monde.

--trouver une voiture qui vous fera passer le péage (20 kms au sud - sortie 54), ou qui vous posera au péage.

ATTENTION : L'autoroute A20 est gratuite du sud de Brive jusqu'à un peu avant Orléans. Il y a donc plein de gens qui prennent l'autoroute ici pour se rendre dans les petits villages dans la campagne au sud de Brive, et qui ne passeront pas le péage, ou n'iront pas bien loin. On peut donc facilement se retrouver coincé en pleine campagne (sorties 52 et 53) si on a pas bien établi ou le chauffeur pouvait vous déposer. Il m'est arrivé de devoir remonter sur Brive pour pouvoir repartir à nouveau vers le sud… Demandez bien au conducteur jusqu'où il va et où il peut vous poser. La plus part connaisse bien le coin et connaitront l'Aire de Pech Montat au sud.

NOTE : Le parking du McDonald's de l'autre côté de la route est une grande zone de rendez-vous pour le covoiturage local. Vous pouvez toujours essayer d'y aller faire un tour, vous trouverez peut être quelqu'un pour vous amener. Un Brive-Toulouse coute généralement 10€.

comments.comment: i was a bit further up for an hourish where  people don't see all the space they have to stop didn't work at all, went here waited about an hour and got a ride to a rest station on the route to Bordeaux

fr_FR.description:
Juste en face du restaurant "la Pataterie" il y a un endroit où les voitures peuvent très facilement s'arrêter. 
Très bon emplacement pour rejoindre l'A71. Certains conducteurs vous déposeront au péage situé 9kms plus haut, d'autres vous amènerons directement sur l'autoroute.

en_UK.description: Very got spot to go to the south (Issoire, Montpellier). There is a place for cars to stop.

comments.comment: ische ische sehr gut
I was here several times. And every time it toocks less then an hour to get picked up!!

en_UK.description:
No traffic after 7:30 pm. I had to wait there until the next morning to head South. 
I slept in my tent in the woods between the highway and the railway. The place is nice but noisy. 
At the other side of the highway there is a shop, a restaurant, showers and a free wifi connexion. 

The next morning I was taken after 1 hour waiting and dropped at the Montauban péage. 

I had a big back pack with me.

comments.comment: I prefer this place to the junction to the west which is more dangerous as cars come from 2 directions and speed up.

en_UK.description: A small parking spot on the right side of the road right before the bridge. Cars can see you from a distance and can easily stop.
Bonne place (partout entre la ville et le col des Roches) pour aller direction Besançon, Dijon
Juste après la douane, si personne ne nous a pris avant... Pour aller direction Besançon/Dijon.

fr_FR.description: Juste après la douane, si personne ne nous a pris avant (à la place entre Le Locle et Le Col-des-Roches)... Pour aller direction Besançon/Dijon.

en_UK.description: A good spot to get a ride to Brioude, if you wan't to go to the Le Puy en Velay. Cars go slow because of the circular road. I just wait 10 minutes. Write "Brioude" if you wan't to go that way, because a lot of cars also ride to Clermont Ferrand.

Very good spot if you wan't to go to saint Etienne or in the direction to Valence. Cars go quite fast but there is a lot of place if they wan't to stop.
I took a ride in 15 minutes to go in the direction of Valence.
You can go there by foot from the city center, very easy and nice (there is a small track near the small river from the city center until there).
I Hitched two times here, after the traffic light. You're visible, cars can pull over in the entrance of the gas station, and the traffic light slow down the circulation.

comments.comment: Got a ride for the Beaune fork (north -> Paris/East) pretty easily as a lot of people are passing there. Couldn't get a direct trip heading for Besançon though.

en_UK.description: Less dangerous than on the Péage(?) and more place for the car to stop.

comments.comment: Wide-extended parking areas, with vehicles coming from both sides, so better than asking at the gaz st., I'd rather advice to wait with a sign around the acess road to the highway.

en_UK.description: Aire des Monts de Guéret.

Very good spot to go to Nantes, Brittany or Paris, waitingtime varies (from 30 seconds to 30 minutes). Even at 10pm in winter it's possible to get a car !
If you have to go to or through Nantes, take a car that gets directly to it, you should have no problem finding one.
As we got out of the car, we waited like 30 seconds to get a car to Saint Nazaire ! There was a bit of traffic that evening.
This spot is a few meters before the toll. There is place to stop along the road.
This spot works only towards East, and towards Bordeaux since you cannot take A10 towards North from A837.

comments.comment: Found a car to Miliau in only five minutes. Many cars stop there !

en_UK.description:
gas station 
direction south

http://routes.wikia.com/wiki/Autoroute_fran%C3%A7aise_A75_%28Aires%29

gas station
hotel

http://routes.wikia.com/wiki/Autoroute_fran%C3%A7aise_A75_%28Aires%29

comments.comment: we were dropped here, tried some time but there was just a few cars and we decided to walk to porte de rennes (our aim was rennes).

en_UK.description: already a bit on the highway, some space to stop, not much traffic. don't recommend this place.

To go in the direction of Paris. I was waiting for more than 30 minutes. There is no toll on this part of the A20 and it makes difficult to hichhike. The cars are not to fast and have time to read your sign.

To go there, take the bus number 1 (blue lign) in the direction of C.C. Ouest, and go down one station before the last one, called Sarreti. Then walk in the same direction for few meters.

There is a trafic light but most of people don't go to the highway. When the car arrive, only two or three stop and then it's green when all the rest of the car arrive. I couldn't get a ride and i went to the other trafic light in the front of me.

I was going to Paris, but remember there are no toll gate until Vierson and it's pretty hard to get a ride cause people take the highway for a short distance...

I couldn't get a ride from the other trafic light. I decided to cross the road to move to this trafic light and when I was croosing the road, someone called me to come. But maybe I was lucky for this time... Goog luck!

I had to stop there cause the car who took me was going out at the next road.

This very very small place has no gaz station, no shop, nothing exept 2 or 3 tables and toiletts. Because I am a young girl, 2 man (who couldn't take me) were very protectionalist with me and helped me stopping everybody to ask them if they could take me up. This small place makes everybody knowing your situation (bad situation to be in a such bad place to hichhike) and they talk with you, and are willing to help you.

comments.comment: Nice spot to head to Paris Toulouse. To head south (Clermont-Ferrand), take the first ride to Bourges and ask to be left in the service area which is a few kilometers before Bourges.

en_UK.description: To go to Paris, very good place cause it's a toll. Someone took me after 3 cars. I was already hichhiking and a car droped me there. I don't know how to reach this place from the city center.
Been dropped there, good spot, got a ride to go to St Etienne in 20 min ^^
Good spot, got a ride to Nice in 30 min i guess.
Pretty good spot to get picked-up, There's a set of traffic lights so all traffic from 2 ways are coming through slow, not the biggest spot for them to pull-up but enough

Ok, it's quite tricky to get there, but it works. At least two lyonnais I met while hitch-hiking that was THE spot. You have to get at the entrance of the tunnel. Cars that arrive from Pont Kitchener-Marchand have to slow down at that point before getting on A6
If you're looking to get to the ZAD this is a good spot from Orvault. There's a bus stop and locals know where you want to go, no need for a sign.

This is a solid place to hitch to the ZAD from. Expect to wait only 5-15 minutes as the local support is the public transport here. No need for a sign, they all know where you want to go. Beware though, after Orvault Go Val supermarket closes there is much less traffic, expect to wait 30 minutes.
Good to have your thumb out walking here, enough room for cars to pull over. Twice got a lift on route to the hitching spot up from here.

Direction Winthertur/Schaffhausen. It is a crossroad with a kind of ramp going onto the bigger road which then further on gets into the highway. Cars are slow (right after streetlight), they can see you and there is space to pull over. I got a lift to Schaffhausen after waiting 10 minutes holding up a sign 'Wint. - SH'

comments.comment: Nice place to hitchhike direction Nord!

en_UK.description: Good spot to reach Clermont if you're drop here
Not to much traffic but ok to reach the mountains (Mont dore)
Last spot to hitch from Mont Dore. After this crossroads, no more place to stop ! Good spot to leave Mont dore anyway
In the direction of the A75, good spot, enough space to stop ! good roundabout
If you're here, try to ask the drivers to drop you to the gas station which is only 5km from here down south ! Enough space to stop but not to much contact

Direction Strasbourg and going East :) 
A very good spot I've waited like 10 mins but when I arrived a car have already stopped :D

Direction Strasbourg and going East :) 
A very good spot I've waited like 10 mins but when I arrived a car have already stopped :D
There's lots of traggic going through here but it's almost impossible to stop so I would reccommend hitchhiking before the bridge or before the big road which goes on to the highway :)

I've got dropped off here on the way to Lyon because My driver was going to Paris so I'd reccommend to get out before the highway splits or on a petrol station on the ring 
I've got lucky and someone picked Me up but this place is better towards Paris or the South :D

comments.comment: I stood at the roundabout and not at the tollbooth; got a lift to lyon whilst still writing my sign!

Circumstances: We were 3 people heading to Paris, but we were OK with splitting up. Strategy: Asking directly at the tollbooth, standing in front of the parking space with a sign, standing at the roundabout with a sign.

Findings: A lot of traffic on a Sunday, but nearly everybody (>80%) was going south. Impossible to get a ride. Waited 5 hours and then gave up. Also discovered a warning written on the concrete saying "hitchhiking spot of death"...

Probably good if you want to get to Lyon. If going to Paris, take the bus (nr. 7) from Mâcon main train station to Chalon-sur-Saône (1.50 EUR) and try highway entry Chalon-Nord. We had a good experience there. Mâcon-Nord or -Centre might also work better.

en_UK.description: toll to lyon or paris. it's not easy to stand directly at the tollbooth, but just before the parking is ok. quite a lot of traffic, at least in the morning.
Bon spot pour partir vers Chambéry depuis l'aéroport

comments.comment: Got a lift from a Suisse girl to Kempthal rest area (comes after Zürich, towards Germany) after 30min on October 1.

Hitch-hiked to Bern, nobody took me during 5 hours...! (maybe I could find a better place but I had no idea where :) after 5 hours waiting I got ride to a gas station near Luzern but not much cars were going there so I went on an expensive train to Bern...

en_UK.description: Perfect spot for heading North (e.g. Zürich). Stand BEFORE the bus stop, so people can actually drive in. Use a sign!

Direction Bern/Zurich:
Beginning of the entrance to the motorway. Drivers have plenty of time and a very good view to see you and your sign but unfortunately, there is no place for them to pull over except on the road going straight. However, the cars have to slow down at the point where you will be hitching to take the bend and so may stop on the road itself. There are two lanes so following traffic can always take the other lane. I got lucky and only waited 30 minutes on a slow sunday morning. Most of the traffic coming this way is taking the motorway, so it is worth to hitch from here.

comments.comment:
We were 2 people going to Paris. Waited 20 min. with a sign "A6 DIR. PARIS) on the middle island until we got a ride to a nearby gas station.

Maybe because of the toll system, if you are going south, it could be better to try Chalon-Sud.

en_UK.description: Stood before the booths on a Wednesday afternoon. Used a sign for Lyon, but most people that responded to me were going the other direction. I stood in the middle island, but there's room to pull over on both sides. Staff didn't seem to care I was there. Got a direct ride with a truck in 40 mins.
i got a ride to saint-etienne in 5 minutes standing near a crossroads with one of the minor roads.

i was standing on the bridge near the entrance to the highway going north. there is also a better spot for going south, with a parking space just after the bridge. here, getting a ride to clermont-ferrand proved to be really difficult.
this is one of the entrance to the highway. it has little space for cars to stop and i was unable to get a ride to clermont-ferrand after 50 minutes of waiting.
if you want to go north, it's better to try on the other round-a-bound. the big store and a gas station might fool you into thinking it's a good spot, but it's chiefly filled with local people.
this is a spot near the entrance to the highway, there is a little space to stop. it took me 40 minutes to get a ride to a nice gas station on the highway.
this is a gas station in the direction of clermont.

little service station but perfect to go to rennes  !

ma manière (english follow):
si tu arrives du sud, arrête-toi au péage de l'autoroute du sud, et attend d'avoir une voiture qui peut passer à cette station (souvent ça leur fait peu de détour s'il vont dans le centre-nord). Puis attendez-ici en demandant aux gens qui s'y arrête: sois sûr qu'en 10minutes maxi tu trouveras ton bonheur à direction de rennes !

my tip: if you come from south, stop at the south hichway's "péage", and wate for a car who go to this station. Then stop here: be sure you'll find someone for rennes in 10min maximum.
Have a nice trip !
Robin

comments.comment: Each time it works very well!

en_UK.description:
Very good place for going to Nantes. There is a parking just after the toll. Cars can see you very well.
I have been picked up in 5 min for Nantes, on a friday, 5 p.m. The first car passing by picked me up.
On a Sunday, 5 p.m. I waited 2 hours for a ride to Paris. I tried the different spots of the roundabout.

comments.comment: we used that place to get to mazé, direction saumur - there is no space for the cars to stop next to the road and they speed up quite quickly after the roundabout. nevertheless we got a ride standing right at the pedestrian crossing of the roundabout.

me + Nicol

from Malaga,ES to Prague,CZ

21:30-5:00 11.8.2015

We got up from a truck and begun to ask another truckers. After 10 we met our last driver talking with another Polish driver. He said he s going to St. Avold (between Metz and Saarbrucken), but at 5 in the morning. We were asking another drivers (30) for one hour, but no offer was better than this one, so we accepted it and went to sleep. (Luckily, cause Mariusz was great!)

A lot of traffic, a lot of truckers. If I was alone, I could go as far as Luxembourg, Berlin, Poland, Budapest.

en_UK.description:
Aire de Service Mâcon- La Salle
Excellent station when travelling alone and up north. There are a lot of truckdrivers here doing long distances from South to North Europe. Recommended in the morning as truckdrivers drive only 8 hours a day.

Shower, electric plugs, wifi.


xx
I had a hitchhike here one way straight to Belgium.

Spot to Lyon and the south (a lot of cars at working hours) and maybe to the north (Oyonnax).
Parking, slow and numerous vehicles.

Two possible directions :
-"Villefranche", towards A6 and Paris.
-"L'arbresle", towards A89 and Clermont (ask to be dropped a the entrance of A89).
Since there is many people passing by, I suggest to put close places on a sign.

fr_FR.description: Entrée de l'A6 vers le nord et Paris. Trafic assez important, on est assez mal vu par les gens qui viennent de l'est mais très bien par ceux qui viennent de l'ouest.

comments.comment: Lundi matin 8h pour aller sur Annemasse, 15 à 30 minutes d'attente

en_UK.description: Good visibility. Enough space to stop the car. Any protected if is rain. I was less 30 min. to Geneve.

comments.comment: People on this road ar not going to France at all, but to the next village...

en_UK.description: No much space to stop, but one guy stopped, although he went other direction. You have to do it near to the traffic lights, otherwise the Police warm you. After 3 hours, I decided to take a bus.

comments.comment: Very very good place for both directions Paris or Poitiers. Visibiliy and place for cars to catch hitchhikers

en_UK.description: Right behind the toll, there is a parking lot with toilet facilities. The parking lot is very visible for the cars leaving the toll. I talked to people waiting for the toilet and they picked me ! No waiting time.

comments.comment: Not a very big gas station. We were super lucky, the driver going to Pau changed his route and brought us straight to our destination between Perigueux and Bergerac.

en_UK.description:
Aire de la Longue Vue
It's a service station that seems to be quite big, with a petrol station and restaurants, a big parking lot... I was there on a saturday, I waited from 16:20 to 17:10 : very few cars. No one picked me up, but the one who brought me there.

comments.comment: we tried to get a ride at the toll station but there is not much traffic, it is better to use the national road
really good spot for direction lycon
locals use this road to get to la rochelle - there is not much traffic except during rush hours
Easy to get to, take tram T2 from Perrache to the final stop at Saint-Priest - Bel Air. Then it's a 30minute walk to the service station.
I arrived at this point on monday 08:40 and found a ride at 10:20. Luckily they took me all the way to Bergamo (Italia)
Easy to get to, but quite quiet on a Monday morning. Only traffic from Lyon proper would go past here. Ended up getting a lift to the next gas station to catch traffic by passing lyon

comment in spanish and eng.

llegué de noche en ruta hacia italia.
tuve que dormir en el suelo. el personal de la gasolinera indiferente a mí. salí pronto por la mañana con un camión que hacía noche aquí (hicieron noche unos 30 camiones)
I arrived at night en route to Italy.
I had to sleep on the floor. staff of the gas station did not help. I left early in the morning with a truck that made night here (made night here about 30 trucks)

en_UK.description: Service station (Aire de Service Saint-Priest) on A43, direction Chambery, Geneve

comments.comment: It was easy to look for Swiss-registered cars in the parking area and just ask the drivers if they were heading in that direction.

March 2015, tried getting a lift through to Italy (Torino). Most traffic was heading north to Geneva for ski-ing. Eventually got a lift in a (empty) school coach. Road through frejus tunnel tunnel to Italy was very quite with most other traffic being trucks.

en_UK.description: Motorway Service Station (Aire de Service de Romagnieu), direction Chambery, Geneve

comments.comment: A good place to hitch north along the A1, direction Lausanne. Cars are not going too fast, there is a hard shoulder to pull over onto.

en_UK.description: Motorway entrance slip-road, direction Lausanne

comments.comment: Big service station on A1 motorway. It's possible to get a ride to all the main cities in Switzerland from here.

en_UK.description: Motorway Service Station, direction Lausanne/Bern/Zurich

comments.comment: 1 year ago, i organized with friends a hitchhiking race here!
don't like this spot : a lot of local traffic, no space for cars to park.

en_UK.description:
Very good place to go to Rennes, Nantes, Laval, Lion d'Angers (North West of angers.) 

Stand at the traffic-light on the bridge : cars going to the ring turn on the right.

Or stand at the traffic-light next to the castle : cars are going on the ring at the left! I prefer this place.

I have done it like 20 times - all days of the week ! The best is friday at 5pm! I've been waiting like 5 min!

Perfect place to go to Chemillé, Cholet!

Put you before the roundabout! You can come by walk!

comments.comment: 30 secondes d'attente la première fois et 1 minute à peine la deuxième fois

en_UK.description: se poser avant le peage pour aller a lyon. le plus près possible du rond point et de l'autre voie d'accès. beaucoup de place pour s'arrêter et bonne visibilité. très bon spot aux heures de pointe

comments.comment: Waited there (by the traffic light) and had several more hh coming by that time. got a ride to the nearest gas station on the road to A6 which is an excellent hh spot. 27.8.14

en_UK.description: Lucky shot and got a ride to Paris from there. People have to stop on the traffic light and if the driver doesn´t bother he´ll let you in during waiting time. Its of course not the best spot but an opportunity to try, for curtain. Also, if the driver is nice enough he could turn right at the intersection and you could hop on as well. So, its not too bad

comments.comment: We were asking for Bordeaux, but got till the exit for La rochelle. It definitely is a short haul spot. Waited for around 1 hour.

en_UK.description: Make sure you go exactly on the edge of the roundabout heading out of town here. We stood a little way down on the slip road and waited for over 2 hours, then another dude came and stood on the roundabout and got a lift in a few minutes! If you're going long haul always try and get on the motorway to the next Autostop; many of the lifts we were offered here were short haul.
Great place for heading to Fribourg. Hitched from there already a couple of times

comments.comment: we stopped here thinking it would be a good place just to find someone who would go further than lyon. got numerous proposals to vienne or st étienne before finding after more than 1 hour someone going to... rouen, which was our goal.
Got stuck here for almost three hours waiting for someone going east of Lyon. Most people got to Paris here. Maybe better to come closer to Lyon to ask for a ride east.

me + Nicol

from Malaga,ES to Prague,CZ

17:30-19:30 11.8.2015

Lots of truckers were done with driving for today after 17o clock. Than a sad Polish trucker agreed to take us 2hours north, behind Lyon, which was good.

en_UK.description:
a quite big service area, with a restaurant and a gas station.
it is possible to get rides west to st étienne and further clermont-ferrand, or north to vienne, lyon or paris and sometimes east of lyon.

comments.comment: not many cars but lots of them stop. but there are three possible directions, many go to chambéry. got twice a ride to grenoble quite easily.

en_UK.description:
toll to the highway, direction albertville, grenoble or chambéry.
not so many cars but nice people passing by and view...

comments.comment: I tried this spot and this was very good. There is place so that people stop easily. i waited like 15 minutes to catch a car for the A89 direction Clermont
This one of the best spot I know. If you're going to Clermont Ferrand, you shouldn't take short lift at this point, waiting 15 minutes longer will assure you to get a lift to Clermont.

en_UK.description: Good place to join the A89 (direction Clermont-Ferrand). You can go there by the bus 86, bus-stop "La tour Salvagny", walk then 800 meters (10 minutes) towards the north-est (avenue des Monts d'or). You can be dropped at the toolbooth that is next to Poncharra sur Turdine (20 km futher).

fr_FR.description: Bon spot pour rejoindre la A 89 (direction Clermont-Ferrand). Accessible par le réseau de transport en commun (TCL), BUS 86, arrêt "La tour Salvagny", marchez ensuite 800 m au nord-est (avenue des Monts d'or). Vous pouvez vous faire déposer au péage situé à Poncharra sur Turdine (20 km plus loin).

en_UK.description: Good spot to join the A 43 (Chambery and Grenoble. Lights just next to the metro Mermoz-Pinel (line D).

fr_FR.description: Spot très pratique pour rejoindre la A 43 direction Chambery et Grenoble. Feu tricolores à la sortie du métro Mermoz-Pinel (ligne D).

comments.comment: arriving from nantes, we get off here from a car going to orléans because our aim was lyon and chambéry. it was lunch time and there were quite many people going in all possible directions (nantes, orléans, poitiers, bourges). we got a ride direct to chambéry (wouhou) after about 1h, but other people had offered us a ride in other directions before.

en_UK.description: a not so big rest area, with a restaurant and a gas station. it is accessible from both sides of the highway. quite many people at least at lunch time.

comments.comment: Insa and Jan successfully used this spot in the morning of a nice day in May 2013.
Good spot, there is a bus station so cars can pull out. If the drivers you are with are going North, they can leave the highway to drop you there and then will have no trouble to go back in.

en_UK.description: This spot is good to get westwards, Clermont-Ferrand or Bordeaux. People might drop you off on the way out of Lyon if they are not going further west.

comments.comment: Got a lift to Chambéry, most of the cars going northward but there are still some which are heading south
Good spot for going to Lyon, Geneve or Chamonix, but you definitively have to write a sign. There is some space for cars to pull out. Many traffic going, but you may have to wait a bit.

en_UK.description: Annecy Nord Tollbooth, many drivers going to Geneva or Chamonix
Very good for direction Murten. Waited less than 5 min with my bicycle

comments.comment: Good also to go to Rennes or Laval. Better friday evening!

en_UK.description: I did hitchhike friday at 6PM. In 5mn i found a car to Nantes!

comments.comment: Not a very good place.

en_UK.description: I did hitchhike friday at 6PM, lot of cars but difficult to find to Rennes or Laval!
There is no good place to park a car
In direction to Cholet
in direction to Mortagne sur Sevre

comments.comment: Not a lot of traffic
As a couple we waited for about hour and went straight to Geneva. Nice spot to catch a car. Our friends went also directly to Geneva, just few minutes later than us.

en_UK.description: good place,  All traffic through the Chamonix
There is a place to stop cars
There is a place to stop car in direction to Annemasse.

comments.comment: Not a lot of traffic
I got a ride to Geneva very quickly. You have to look for the right registration plates and ask, there were many cars.
Not as easy to go east as right after Lyon.

en_UK.description: Big petrol station with many parking places and rest areas results in many cars and trucks.

Never waited more than half an hour there :) ! 
The easiest place to stand is next to the restaurant

fr_FR.description:
Spot utilisé régulièrement, je n'ai jamais attendu plus d'une demi-heure :)
Placez vous le long des barrières de sécurité ou devant le restaurant pour que les personnes aient la place de s'arrêter ;)

comments.comment: i got a track directly to milano in 2 just after i came

got stuck here around 17.00 with heavy rain aswell. In the evening nobody is going to Switzerland from here. Fortunately after 2 hours some locals let my stay at their place and next morning I got a ride in direction of Lausanne within 30 min. This place is good in the morning and bad in the evening!

en_UK.description: We wanted to reach Switzerland but ended up in this gas station by night (there's a gas station in both direction) so we slept there and start hitchiking again in the early morning with some heavy rain, one of the first car that stoped here for gas took us until Lausanne.
Stayed here around 5min to get a lift to a countryside village, no much traffic but quite easy.
just behind the rondel in direction to Saumur. There were just few cars, but waiting was not long.
nice view on river and the very first car stopped here for me
no chance to hitchhike here
close to the end of village, good place
just behind rondel, direction to momntreuil
end of the village. Waiting was not long but mayby its better to go directly from downtown to main road.
I can imagine better place, but there is now such a place around
in front of oil station
near oil station, I stand here with sign Perigeaux, about after half of hour someone took me to "better place"

it was quite late, but still there was car for me
(direction to Perigeaux)
This is good place (just behind rondel), but it is probably better to go to south fromc ity centre
On rondel it is written that this is the direction to Bordeaux but no one topped here in about hour
the second try to leave Perigeaux and to go to Bordeaux. After half of hour a van took me to "better" place
The final try to go to Bordeaux. When I drop out the sign "Bordeaux" a car stopped for me and took me to next village.
Direction to Bordeax, almost no cars, but I was lucky

comments.comment: Perfect to go to Italy. Many cars cross this autobahn border station slowly day & night. Accept lifts to Italy only, when going to Italy.

en_UK.description:
chestnut avenue between curves, just little spot to stop a car
(direction Super Lorient)

The very first car stop for me, but it was just matter of luck, it seems that this very minor road
(direction Murat)

abandoned oil station with nice view on surrouding hills. But the waiting was suprisingly long
(direction massiac)

comments.comment: FYI: I wasted an hour asking at the restaurant which isn't very busy, then nearly another hour at the petrol station the otherside. Everyone will also tell you are the wrong side, and you have to explain that it's not! It's very annoying, so don't make the mistake I did, just go to where I marked.

June 2015: The gas station is open!
Good place to go towards Geneve.

en_UK.description: As far as I understand as of May 2014 the petrol station on this side is closed, so this seems to be the best place to hitch from. People drive very slow due to the construction as well. Either this or I'm very stupid.

comments.comment: We waited an hour, then decided to go hitchhike at the other spot a bit farther down...

en_UK.description: Entrance going south towards Toulouse. All traffic going onto the freeway passes through here. There is a little bit of a hill there so trucks can't really stop. Bad spot overall.

fr_FR.description: Entrée d'autoroute en direction du sud (Toulouse). L'entrée est un peu en côte, donc les camions ne peuvent pas s'arrêter. C'est un mauvais coin, et je vous conseille de faire du stop un peu plus bas, sur l'autre point indiqué.

comments.comment: I started a few trips from here, it never took longer than 15 minutes to be picked-up. The road is 2 lines and not very busy, a car can easily stop. The police station is just the opposite side of the road so beware (never had any problem though).

en_UK.description: Highway entrance towards Lausanne/Geneva/Italy or Neuchatel/Biel

fr_FR.description: Entrée d'autoroute vers Lausanne/Genève/Italie ou Neuchatel/Bienne.

comments.comment: I started a few trips from here, I've been waiting between 15 and 30 minutes. The cars need to stop on the shoulder which is not ideal. Many will do short trips but can bring you to the big petrol station in Estavayer.

en_UK.description: Highway entrance towards Bern/Basel/Zurich.

fr_FR.description: Entrée d'autoroute vers Berne/Bâle/Zürich

comments.comment: It looks like a good spot, but my experience is a long waiting time here. The best is to take the very first who stop and ask them politely to drop you at Yverdon-Sud (Highway entrance). They need to do a digression of about 1km if they go towards the south.

en_UK.description: Highway entrance towards Lausanne/Geneva/Italy and Vallorbe/France.

comments.comment: The Petrol Station is a good spot to ask people for a ride, or the entrance of the shopping center/McDonalds. Good to speak some german as almost all those who go towards Bern/Zurich/Basel speak swiss-german.
Got a lift to Geneva before I even reached the spot. Two guys saw my sign and called me over.

en_UK.description: Big and Busy Petrol Station on the highway. Cars who stop here go both sides: towards Lausanne/Geneva/Italy/France or Bern/Basel/Zurich
i

comments.comment: Hitch hiked from Rue de Lausanne 50m further, next to the quickly changing traffic lights. It took me just under 10 minutes to go to Nyon.

en_UK.description:
That is a good place if you want to reach Lausanne or more fare away (Montreux, Vevey, etc.)
Good alternative if you don't have the money to pay for the train!
Good palce to go south. I waited there 45 min, and get a cor to Poitiers.

comments.comment: In fact you were in the direction of Savona ;)

en_UK.description: I want to go to Piacenza, but nobody take me there (3 hours). The traffic is very low an who stopp there goes to Savona.
Nobody goes Piacenza

comments.comment: In fact you were in the direction of Savona. To go to Piacenza, it's the A21 one !

en_UK.description: I tried to go to Piacenza but nobody took me. I car stopped but he went to Savona.
Easy to get a car to the center of Torino. 2 min.

comments.comment: we tried to hitchhike right in front of the toll but as we were approaching a voice told us to go backwards... the woman working there. so we went back to the entrance of the parking, where not many people stop but we were trying to make big signs so people could see us from the toll. but we were just in front of a camera, and this was not satisfying for the workers, one came to us and explained us that the police was coming, and he put his car before us with a "be careful" sign to inform people about us standing dangerously there. someone we asked to on the parking explaining the situation finally took us until périgueux.

en_UK.description: this is an average toll in the middle of the highway. direction clermont
waited 1 minute for a lift to Grenoble. busy gas station to ask drivers. 2014

comments.comment: I use this spot regularly, never waited more than 30 minutes.

en_UK.description:
The one and only place to be when you want to go to Rochefort or La Rochelle.
The road goes straight there, just after the roundabout there is big stopping place for cars, you're a bit downhill so cars can so you from far away.
To get there you might have to walk a bit, but there's probably a bus going near there.

fr_FR.description: La seul et unique endroit a connaitre pour aller vers Rochefort ou La Rochelle. Apres le rond-point il y a directement un grand espace pour les que les voitures puissent s'arreter.

en_UK.description: Good Spot to get on the highway towards north/northeast/northwest (Zurich, Basel, Bern). It's a parking-lot situated on the left side of the road. The lane alongside is the one for the highway. Drivers will see you long in advance, can pull over easily (parking-lot) and it is legal to stand there to hitch (a lot of policemen around that area). Got some rides from there already, recommend.

comments.comment: When we arrived here on a tuesday arround 11 to 11:30 am we were glad that there are so many people coming by only to figure out most of them are going north insted of south. The motorway service area is for both directions :|

en_UK.description:
Marché service station

Marché Kemptthal A1
CH-8310 Kemptthal
Tel. +41 52 355 08 55
(Fax: +41 52 355 08 50)
E-Mail: kemptthal@marche-restaurants.com
http://www.marche-restaurants.com/de/marche-kemptthal

comments.comment:
Since the service area didn't worked out we decided to just stay on this small strip close to a small gas station going that direction and also the exit of the service area and big gas station, direction south.
Time went by no one from the small gas station could take us or had no space. After a bit a truck driver from Romania took us on to another service are in Affoltern.

en_UK.description:
BP gas station

BP Autobahncenter Kemptthal Nord
Kemptthal Nord
Kemptthal
8310
052 345 10 08
http://maps2.bp.com/location_report?context=de_CH_CH&format=html&language=de_CH&service_id=25&id=527690168

MY STOP service station

Autobahn-Raststätte A4 AG
Moosbachstrasse 1
CH–8910 Affoltern a.A.
T +41 (0) 43 322 60 90
F +41 (0) 43 322 60 99
info@mystop-zh.ch 
www.mystop-zh.ch

Got here on a tuesday at about 12:30 pm. The gas station is off the high way close to an intersection. There are no other service areas in this area. Last one is in Affoltern.
When you get of the highway the gas station on the left seems better than the one on the right (More traffic). But none the less it's a quite bad spot. Waited there for over an hour. No one was going our direction. After a while some young fella agreed to take us a bit further on our way :)

Got here with a young fella. Arrived on a tuesday arround 1 pm. We thought it'll get easy because a lot traffice is going through there. While looking for a good spot we saw a car on the side with number plate of Ticion. So we asked the guy and he took us all the way to Bellinzona :D
Good place to leave Ancenis. In front of the Vinci office, just before the toll. Not many cars in the afternoon. Legal and safe place.
Good spot during the summer, several successful hitchiking experience there, going to Paris. Stand on the middle place because on the right, cars go to a shopping center.
Not much traffic here. Going west it's best to make a short leap to a better gas station.
2 gas stations with a bridge between them. Can go in every direction from here.

comments.comment: Not too many people here at this gas sation but got a ride to mulhouse in 15 min.

en_UK.description: Direction Germany.

comments.comment:
stood here for over an hour in direction Lyon/west
older man gave me ride to Dole

en_UK.description: Good spot in the direction of Colmar/Strasbourg. Lot of traffic and many trucks too.

Great spot to go to Angers/Tours.
At the Total service station, we've just waited 5 minutes to find a car which have driven us near Moulins !

Great spot to go to Mâcon and Haute-Savoie (Annecy...) from Moulins. Lot of people and trucks.

A very nice truck driver has driven us near Annecy !
Excellent spot if you want to go to Grenoble. Plenty of traffic and a nice and obvious place for the cars to stop. There is a bus that stops nor far away at "les couleures"
good for hitchhiking in the direction of rennes and the highway in general. took us less then 5 mins in heavy rain to get a ride. there is a round about with plenty of space to pull over behind it.
Direction Switzerland, enough traffic and space to stop

fr_FR.description: En sortie de village en direction de la Suisse, beaucoup de traffic selon le moment de la journée, les voitures roulent doucement et il y a suffisament de place pour s'arreter.

en_UK.description: Direction Lausanne, not much traffic and space to stop but still ok

Direction France via the new road 144.
The spot is directly on the roundabout so not very practical, specially the space issue, but there's lots of traffic so it works

fr_FR.description: En direction de la France via la route 144. Le meilleur spot se trouve directement à l'interieur du rond-point car il n'a pas de place plus loin, donc pas très pratique mais tout de même faisable

en_UK.description:
Direction Geneve/Annemasse
The road inside the roundabout is large enough to hitch directly in there.
Huge trafic very early in the morning when people go to work between 7 and 8am.

fr_FR.description:
En direction de Geneve/Annemasse.
La route dans le rond-point est assez large pour se placer directement là,c'est d'ailleurs la seule solution vu qu'il y a des glissière le long de la route plus loin.
Enormement de traffic tôt le matin lorsque les gens partent travailler entre 7h et 8h.

en_UK.description:
Good spot if you head south and wanna reach the highway direction Annecy or Chamonix.
Good space to stop and lots of traffic.

fr_FR.description:
Bon spot en direction du sud, vers l'autoroute direction Annecy ou Chamonix.
Pas mal de place pour s'arreter et beaucoup de traffic.

en_UK.description:
Very bad spot because no space at all for the cars to stop, but lots of traffic.
Still, I don't recommend it.

fr_FR.description: Tres mauvais spot en terme de place pour s'arreter, mais beaucoup de traffic, mais je ne conseil pas.

en_UK.description:
Alternative solution to get out of Chambery without taking the highway.
We did it with a sigh "Belley" (the biggest city in that direction)

fr_FR.description:
Solution alternative pour sortir de Chambery sans prendre l'autoroute.
Nous avions utilisé un panneau "Belley"

en_UK.description:
Direction Bourgoin-Jallieu/Lyon
Not much traffic but the place is perfect+ awesome landscapes

fr_FR.description:
Direction Bourgoin-Jallieu.
Peu de traffic mais l'endroit est parfait, et en plus les paysages sont superbes

en_UK.description: Good locations towards Vienne, plenty of space to stop and enough traffic

fr_FR.description: Bon emplacement en direction de Vienne, beaucoup de place pour s'arreter et assez de traffic

en_UK.description: Direction Orange and south of France in general, there's a small restaurant called "Le relais des Gorges" near by, plenty of space and traffic

fr_FR.description: Direction Orange et le sud de la France en general, il y a un petit restaurant du nom du "relais des gorges" où il y a plein de places pour s'arreter

comments.comment:
Big petrol station with many people.
Good if you want to reach France or Turin.
There if a brige to get the other side.

en_UK.description:
We were not taking anywhere in Novara, even here just before the entrance.
Must the police ask us to leave the place...
If you hitchhike in Italy don't stop  in Novara!!
We were two, waiting to go to Val d'Ossola. And taking by foreigner... Because italian usually don't take hitchhikker.

To Chamonix, Italy.
Standing on the triangle to catch the car coming from the left of the entrance (there are more).
No place to stop, but on the road...
To Angers direction...
Strange place... I hitchhiked here 2 times on the way to barcelona. One time got stuck for 24hours and next time I waited for 1 hour and got a direct drive to barcelona.
Towards South (Clermont-Ferrand, Lyon) is quite a bad location, more people are heading to the North. Waited more than 5 hours here once to hitch a ride for 2 to Lyon.

It was about 5 PM, 10 minutes we waited - a guy with a pick-up took us. People there drive big cars - it's perfect when you're with two big backpacks. 
The place is a parking and also a bus stop - very good spot for the whole valley up to Breuil-Cervinia.

comments.comment:
nice place to go in south.
Somebody put me there and i wait 5 min, perfect
Finally i gave up and somebody who go in the wrong direction take me :(

en_UK.description: Good spot at busstop after roundabout to get towards e.g. Waldshut (Germany). Was there on a Saturday, lots of people go shopping to Germany so lots of traffic.

Realy fast and simple for all on this Iles!

Sur cette ile, il est très facile de faire du stop, même perdu entre 2 champs.
Il existe même une association pour le stop de Belle-Île (impossible de retrouver le nom)
Peage. Better for moving north than south. In reach by foot from the last stop "Chanas" of the local bus line.
No really place to stop.
To many people stay in the city.
The best spot for the direction "Châlon/s Saône". You will probably find a ride to the first big village called "Louhans" just before Châlon.

It's very easy to find some cars going to Lons-Le Saunier from this spot. If you find somebody who's going at a village before Lons, you have to refuse and wait a little bit longer. It's better because there is only a 4x2 ways over it, and the cars rulling over 90 km/h and cannot stop anywhere.

comments.comment: got ride to lausanne

en_UK.description:
This is the only spot I've found where drivers go in the direction of Tavannes. It's not the perfect spot, but it should suffice in case there is not much people at McDonald's.

Make sure you stand just before the sign with the highway logo on it. Here is should be legal. Might be a bit tricky for people to pull over but they have the side track and some space. Also they should be driving slowly when they're approaching to take the turn.

The McDonald's parking lot is a good place to catch a ride towards Delémont or Tavannes. You can feel free to ask people when they go towards their vehicle.

There might not be much people going there, but it took us around 30 minutes of asking around to get a ride.

Stand just before the gas station, in front of the bike repair shop. This is a pretty good spot.

You will be visible to the oncoming rides that will be driving slowly because they just took a turn.

There is also a very handy option of asking people at the gas station when you see them pull over to fill in.

Stand just before the gas station, in front of the bike repair shop. This is a pretty good spot.

You will be visible to the oncoming rides that will be driving slowly because they just took a turn.

There is also a very handy option of asking people at the gas station when you see them pull over to fill in.

The bus stop here is a perfect place to hitchhike. There is room for drivers to stop and they are driving fairly slow because it's an urban area. And the most important factor is that this is in the French part of Switzerland which is know for it's warm people.

In the half an hour's time that we stood there around a dozen cars stopped and offered us a ride.

The bus stop here is a perfect place to hitchhike. There is room for drivers to stop and they are driving fairly slow because it's an urban area. And the most important factor is that this is in the French part of Switzerland which is know for it's warm people.

In the half an hour's time that we stood there around a dozen cars stopped and offered us a ride.
A spot to catch cars crossing France from the west to the east. Enough room for cars to stop

Bon spot de départ en direction de bordeaux / clermont ferrand / saint etienne 
barre de péage.
Munissez-vous d'un grand sourire et d'un peu de patiente et c'est partis ! 
Si vous chercher a allez dans l'ouest attendez une voiture qui vous menera a clermont ferrand ! 

Nice spot in direction of bordeaux / clermont ferrand / saint etienne. 
Do a big smile, be patient and you'll leave this place faster !! Enjoy

I waited on the roundabout before the border for 3 hours on a Monday morning in October, until a woman gave me a lift to Moutier. The border (and the road back) can only be crossed by car. The advice is to accept any lift (I refused one to Porrentruy after 1h30 and regretted it shortly after), even short distances.

Excellent place to go to Lausanne, Nyon, Geneva, or even France. Stand on the separator area next to the traffic lights, and approach the cars with your thumb up asking where they're going to, whilst they're waiting at the light.

Getting from here to the center of Geneva is quite easy, possibly faster (and cheaper) than the 13 minute train ride. Stand on the separator/sidewalk between the parking and the road, lots of people drive slowly here because of the flow of the traffic. Some drivers will go through the center of Geneva, however all of them will at least leave you at a tram stop (only a few stops to the train station with hardly ever any controls). Great for people who drive through Geneva and don't have the time to go to the center - however this isn't a good spot to go anywhere further than inside Geneva.

Good spot for going east after the Lausanne/Vennes exit. Stand on the sidewalk next to the traffic light and approach cars as they wait for the light. This works better than if you stand next to the Fourmi metro stop, as the traffic light is much slower here.

comments.comment:
11 juillet 2014. Seul, direction LE-DONJON, sans pancarte, deux heures d'attente après avoir perdu une heure à savoir si je devais suivre les indications des panneaux ou bien suivre ma carte. J'ai pensé que les autochtones suivraient la logique des cartes.

Malgré les quelques voitures qui passaient, j'ai mis deux heures à partir de cet endroit. J'ai été déposé au DONJON, 20 kilomètres plus loin.

fr_FR.description:
Direction LE-DONJON.

Très peu de trafic et un trafic surtout local.

Manque de place pour s'arrêtre sans gêner une peu probalbe circulation sur la route.

Automobilistes peu disposés à s'arrêter.

Quitter Lapalisse en direction de Le-Donjon est un vrai bordel. En lisant une carte vous trouverez logique de passer par la D990a (là où se trouve ce spot) mais en vous fiant aux paneaux indiquant LE-DONJON, vous devrez d'abord prendre la D707 pour ensuite bifurquer sur la D990. Ce qui, sur une carte, parâit abérant. A vous de choisir ce que vous préférez...

comments.comment: 11 juillet 2014, seul, avec un carton MONTCEAU-LES-MINES, j'ai attendu une heure pour que quelqu'un me prenne et me dépose dans une zonne commerciale de PARAY-LE-MONIAL.

fr_FR.description:
Direction PARAY-LE-MONIAL - MACON / MONTCEAU-LES-MINES.
ou
Direction MOULIN - MONTLUCON / CLERMONT-FERRAND.

Sortie de rond-point sur bretelle d'accès à N79 (2X2 voies).

Place pour s'arrêter.

Trafic lent du fait de la sortie du rond-point.

Peu de prédisposition à prendre les gens en stop.

comments.comment:
11 juillet 2014. 

J'ai fais du stop ici car j'y avait été déposé. Très mauvais endroit. La personne qui m'a prit l'a fait pour me sortir de là et m'ammener dans un lieu meilleur.

fr_FR.description:
Direction MONTCEAU-LES-MINES ou MÂCON.

Sortie de rond-point pour accès à N79 (2X2 voies) en zone commerciale.

Trafic dense mais local (personnes venu faire leurs courses).
Pas de place pour s'arrêter sans gêner la circulation.

comments.comment:
11 juillet 2014, seul sans pancarte. J'ai eu une chance innouï qu'un couple, qui plus est, avec deux enfants en bas âge, prennent le risque de s'arrêter pour me prendre.

Ô ! Combien je m'en suis voulu d'avoir fait du stop ici, incitant ainsi les automobilistes à prendre le risque de s'arrêter. Je l'ai fais car, à par le faire, je pouvais aussi marcher jusqu'à trouver un endroit meilleur. Ce qui, d'parès ma carte n'était pas trouvable avant 30Km.

fr_FR.description:
Direction MONTCEAU-LES-MINES - CHALON-SUR-SAONE.

NE JAMAIS FAIRE DE STOP A CET ENDROIT !

Trafic dense mais trop rapide pour anticiper un arrêt.

Route à double sens entre deux rails de sécurité (qui la rendent d'autant plus dangereuse). Pas de place pour s'arrêter à la vitesse où roulent les automobilistes ici.

comments.comment: 11 juillet 2014, seul, sans pancarte, j'ai attendu une quinzaine de minutes. J'ai été embarqué jusqu'aux environs de CHAMPAGNOLE (39).

fr_FR.description:
Direction LONS-LE-SAUNIER.

Sortie de rond-point.
Trafic dense.
Petite place pour s'arrêter mais place tout de même.

en_UK.description: It is totaly RED. We ware taken by zhandarms from there. If you stay there you can get a big fine (bill)!

Since it's almost impossible to get from Tours to Bordeaux by A 10, this national road N D910 is very good alternative. You can stand where you want, you can walk. Speed limit is 70-100 so drivers have time to see you. A lot of cars there! Because A 10 is expensive. 
Very good place!
good spot to get to schopfheim. my shortcut for not taking the train via basel...

Traffic from central Périgueux passes here. No point in walking past the roundabout to the entrance, it doesn´t have enough space for the cars, while on the roundabout it´s just fine. We got a ride to Bordeaux in 5 minutes. (12.2014)

comments.comment: I gave up after 2+ hours and walked south to the petrol station near the airport. I don't recommend, only for the very brave!

en_UK.description: Really bad place and very low traffic. There is a nice free toilet and a sink.

Terminus of bus C4. Right after the roundabout on the D5.
Very good spot for directions like Vizille, La Mure, Gap...

fr_FR.description:
Terminus du C4, juste après le rond-point de la D5. Plein de place pour s'arrêter.
Super spot pour aller vers Vizille, La Mure, Gap...

en_UK.description: Little spot where cars can stop, with red lights. Ask here to be lifted to the tollbooth (péage) of the A41.

fr_FR.description:
Petit spot pour les voitures sur le côté droit de la route, juste à coté d'un feu.
Demandez à être posés au péage de l'A41 et pas avant! Vous finirez forcément par trouver quelqu'un qui vous emmenera direct au péage, et de là il vous sera facile d'aller sur Chambéry.

en_UK.description: If you want to get the highway close to Annemasse you can stand here with your thumb up. Sign are not necessary, go step by step. Early in the morning between 6am and 8am a lot of people go to Geneva to work.

comments.comment: Good spot to go to Lyon. You can wait just behind the redlight, there is some space for cars to stop.
Very good spot for Lyon, got a ride in 15 minutes to the highway

en_UK.description: A good place to go to La roche sur yon!
Good place to go to Nantes and Britain!
This place is horrible to continue to south, direction Avignon/Montpellier/Marseille. Every car goes into Lyon.

de_DE.description: Ziemlich schlecht um weiter Richtung Süden zu trampen, weil alle Autos nach Lyon reinfahren. Lieber die Raststätte vorher nehmen.

fr_FR.description: Horrible pour continuer en direction sud. Tout les voitures allez a Lyon.

comments.comment: We were a group of four equal gender ratio, and got a ride to Nantes on a sunday in 5 minutes

en_UK.description: A good place to hitchhike to get to Mont-Soleil from Saint-Imier.

comments.comment: Not a lot of cars stop here as far as I've experienced, but is still a good option for going North from Basel. If you were planning on catching a ride with a truck, don't hope too much if you are trying this on Sunday or Saturday, they are all unavailable

en_UK.description: This is a small gas station on the A5 highway that is the main road to north from Basel. Everyone that wants to get north fast and needs gas starting from Basel will stop here.

Direction => Les Echelles, Lyon 
Excellent spot pour sortir de Chambéry,
Attente maximum : 10 min !! 
Le bus n°4 de la stac vous pose dans le centre de cognin, à 200 m du spot. 

Avec le rond point, les voitures passent devant vous au ralentit et il y'a largement la place pour s’arrêter.

Direction => St Laurent du pont, Voiron, Grenoble, Voreppe

Avec le rond point, les voitures sont ralenties et il y 'a suffisamment de place pour l'arrêt

Direction => Chambéry 

Place excellente pour rejoindre Chambéry. 
Avec le rond point les voitures sont ralenties et il y'a la place pour arrêter  trois poids lourds sur le bord de la route. 

Beaucoup de circulation 
Attente max : 5 min

Direction  north:LYON
               south: MARSEILLE
                          MONTPELLIER

Here is it a huge peage/toll and a rest place/aire service called : VIENNE OR Aire de Service de Reventin(Google Maps) -7,5 km from the Vienne city center.
i was drop there and thinking .in the final i choose to ask the truck driver from the aire de service.

i ve found one truck driver in 3 minutes with german plate who goes to Marseille.
he left me on the emergency lane in Bedarrides.
it was in the middle of August 2012.
worked surprisingly well, there is a bit of a place to stop(right after the beginning of speed way sign)

comments.comment: We hh'ed at the entrance to the highway heading to le Lac d'Aiguebelette. The problem was there was literally no place for a car to stop.
Quelqu'un m'a déposé là, il était à peine parti qu'une voiture allant à Niort s'est arrêtée. J'allais à Rennes et j'avais un panneau.

en_UK.description: St André de Cubzac toll. Good spot to Paris and Nantes/Rennes by Niort. I don't know how to reach it from Bordeaux. Better have a sign :)

fr_FR.description: Péage de St André de Cubzac. Bon spot pour Paris et pour Rennes/Nantes en passant par Niort. Un panneau est recommandé pour les destinations autres que Paris. Par contre impossible de le rejoindre en transports en commun depuis Bordeaux.

en_UK.description: Toll, direction Brittany/Breizh. Not a lot of cars but they all go there. If you arrive from Bordeaux with someone who stop in Niort, better ask to be dropped here than at the "aire du Poitou-Charentes". A sign is helpful.
Excellent place to get ride to Rennes or Laval. Enough place for car stopping!
Good.

Good spot to hitch towards Billom / Ambert.
You can take the bus C to Joseph Gardet then walk down (better with a sign) Avenue de la Liberté, avenue du pont...

fr_FR.description:
Un bon spot pour aller vers Billom / Ambert.
Prendre le bus C jusqu'à Joseph Gardet puis descendre en poucant  l'Avenue de la Liberté, avenue du pont...
(ca fonctionne mieux avec une pancarte)

en_UK.description:
A good spot to hitch towards Montbrison / Saint Etienne.
Drivers see you and have the place to stop. It does't realle make sense to walk out further since there is no place to stop and it can be quite dangerous

fr_FR.description:
Un bon spot vers Montbrison / Saint Etienne.
Les voitures et les poids lourds vous voient de loin et ont la place de s'arrêter. 
Ce n'est pas la peine de marcher plus loin puisqu'il n'y a ensuite pas la place de s'arrêter et ca peut même être dangereux

en_UK.description: A good place to hitch towards Saint Etienne. There is a bus stop so people have the place to pick you up.

fr_FR.description: Un bon spot pour aller à/vers Saint Etienne. Il y a un arrêt de bus et donc les gens ont la place de s'arrêter

en_UK.description: Towards Lyon

There is a toll station where cars go either in the direction of Milan or Torino. 
I tried for two hours to catch a car in the direction of Torino but without success. 
End the end I walked to the near motorway service area, but it was quite dangerous and I can't recommend it.

comments.comment: Very difficult to find someone catching the A20 to Paris, people go either west or east

en_UK.description: Big petrol station
Not a ton of trafiic, but still a main exit from Cholet towards Nantes. I got a ride in 2 minutes literally.
Technically possible, there's enough space and it's just after a roundabout. If you're stuck here do not despair.
I don't like the roundabout spot, so here is an alternative. Right after the green sign, visibility is good, sideroad is big, people are helpful. 3 cars going to Rennes stopped in 30 minutes.
Lot of traffic, cars are pretty slow, and the sideroad is big. Keep in mind that the sideroad is high so choose where you thumb carefully. Good spot to Rennes.

The best hitchhiking spot if you want to go direction Neuveglise, Chaudes-Aigues, Laguiole, Rodez.
Wait just after the "Rond-point" in front of  "Vulco"

de_DE.description:
Der beste Ort um von Saint-Flour aus, nach Rodez zu kommen. 
Oder nach Neuvéglise, Chaudes-Aigues, Laguiole.
Am besten ist es wenn man gleich nach dem Kreisverkehr vor "Vulco" wartet. Dort können autos gut halten.

fr_FR.description:
C'est le meilleur endroit pour partir de Saint-Flour dirrection Neuvéglise, Chaudes-Aigues, Laguiole, Rodez.
Postez vouz juste après le rond point devant "Vulco". Il y a de la place pour s'arrèter. Les temps d'attente sont variables mais je n'ai jamais attendu plus d'une heure.

en_UK.description: To Clermont Ferrand, there place for cars to stop, nearby the church.

A lot of trucks staying or leaving direction South. There we were taken by one at 21.00 o'clock and lift us in Donostia(Basque Country) at 3h of night!!! was cool!!! And long!

THERE IS RISK OF STAY THERE AAALL THE NIGHT!
Waited for an hour before being hitched to Nantes. Got enough place for traffic to pull over, with restrooms and a parking space.
Goodplace for cars to pull over. Got a ride to Bordeaux within 10 minutes.
A decent spot for hitching a ride towards Rochefort or Bordeaux. Not much place, but cars can pull over in time. Mind a bus stand though!

comments.comment: We tried the place for the first time, it worked very good. About 10-15 min waiting time. You need to have a sign, so that the drivers from the different directions can see you while they are waiting at the traffic lights. There is a good place to stop for the cars. Only direction Switzerland, not Germany/France.

en_UK.description:
Eastbound. Walk to petrol station (one minute) as it's the only area with space to stop. You're still a bit close to passing lorries, but it's the best option I have found. 10-15min wait. Westbound, there is a lay-by after the roundabout.

Vers l'est, marcher jusqu'au station service. Vers l'ouest, il y a la place au bord de la route après le rond-point.
The exit of the petrol station. There is a nice lay-by to pull over. Got a ride quickly.

comments.comment: The first car that went by drove me for 30-40 kms

en_UK.description: An okay place

fr_FR.description: Il y a de la place pour s'arrêter, ça prend pas mal.

en_UK.description: This is the next gas station after Solothurn and is  a pretty bad spot to be dropped if you are going towards Biel because there is very little traffic here. If you are coming from Biel there is no reason to end up here in the first place.
hard to stop - with sign PEAGE it works
Very few cars - around 6 stopped and wanted to take me to Albertville...towards Frejus tunnel almost noone. (4 hours)

comments.comment: just tried this spot. in my opinion the best to get to chur...there's a bigger service station after about 30/40 km.

en_UK.description: here under the bridge there's a spot to stand ...right in front of the motorway sign...technically enough place to stop.

Before the roundabout, a perfect place to be seen by the cars. There is enought space for the cars to stop. 
Not so easy to go there by feet but you can hitchhike from the intersection of Boulevard de la Prairie de Mauves and Boulevard de Seattle.
Perfect place to go to Poitiers. There is a "Covoiturage" parking place for the car. Sécurity
Not so bad place to go to Poitiers. Only cars from highway.
Many cars going up and down both directions. easy to get at least to Distentis or Sedrun.
