Just after roundabout there is a place for cars to stop. not so much traffic but Oberalppass ist easy to get..I think and there is also posibility to reach Luzern easily I think..
Direction to Brig. Quite a good spot at the parking lot.
Good spot for direction Luzern, Furkapass.
Very good spot for Luzern/Furkapass/Andermatt

comments.comment: Stand behind the péage, not before. People were really friendly (maybe ue to the good weather) and found a car n 5 minuts

en_UK.description: Good spot to Lausanne (I rode from Bern, somebody picked me off here), waited 10 minutes and got straight ride to Lausanne, many many cars going.

comments.comment:
2 guys, 12AM weekday

No success in finding ride to Vaduz, we switched to sign "Next gas station" in German and managed to find a ride in 15 minutes.

en_UK.description: Average spot in terms of amount of cars, good to move to next, bigger gas stations on A3.
Big service area. We stayed at the exit first, but it is difficult for cars to stop there. We then asked in front of the gas station and had luck after 5 minutes.

de_DE.description: Wir stellten uns erst an der Auffahrt hin, aber Autos und LKWs können dort schlecht halten. Wir fragten dann an der Tankstelle und hatten nach 5 Minuten einen Fahrer gefunden.

en_UK.description: Great place to hitchhike in the direction of Rennes. You might stop in Blain first
If you settle here and you want to go to the North, just be patient. I have been lucky and got a ride directly to Rennes in 30min. But this place seems to have low potential
I have been dropped off here. Quite a lot of traffic. I holded a sign (Paris/Tours) Since you can stop in a gas station before the cross if people go to the wrong direction

A gas station on the local road number 18 which goes south through Delemont and almost to La-Chaux-De-Fonds. A great road to be taking if you are going to Geneva as it gives you some time to relax from the cities and highways and enjoy the nature and meet great people.

From here you can ask people to drop you as much down the road as they can. You should be trying to get out of the city so it's easier to catch a ride. Ask on the station or thumb on the road, the choice is yours.

You can reach this spot with a D bus from Geneva. There doesn't seem to be any control and the bus driver opens the back doors.

This spot is technically good but we waited for more then an hour and finally someone stopped. You should try it out and let us know.

From here it's good to hitch for the entrance of the highway ("autoroute entrence" in French) towards South.

A nice spot where it's easy to go to Angers and where cars can stop peacefully. Maybe a stopover at St-Georges-sur-Loire's second roundabout (in the direction of the road D723 to Angers). There are even free toilets and pic-nic tables if you want to travell lighter or heavier ! ;)

/

Un bon endroit où il est facile de partir pour Angers et où les voitures peuvent s'arrêter tranquillement. Peut-être une étape au second rond-point de St-Georges-sur-Loire (celui en direction de la route D723 vers Angers). Il y a même des toilettes gratuites et des tables de pique-nique si vous voulez voyager plus légers ou plus lourds ! ;)
Rather good place to go to south. There is place for the car to slow down and take you.

fr_FR.description: Endroit plutôt pas mal pour descendre au sud (Angoulême par exemple). Il y a la place pour que la voiture puisse ralentir. Les gens doivent réagir rapidement car c'est dans leur phase d'accélération.

en_UK.description:
Not a good place for going south, a lot of people are just going to Poitiers. A lot of trucks however.
Prefer to walk 5 minutes to the next roundabout (need to cross the road)

fr_FR.description: Pas un bon endoir pour aller dans le sud. Beaucoup de gens vont juste à Poitiers et le reste sont des poids lourds. Preferer le prochain rond point qui est à 5 minutes de marche en coupant la route.

en_UK.description: This is the best spot to go to Vesoul. Plenty of room for cars to stop at the bus stop and they are not going fast. You can as well go to Valentin (to continue on the highway). Use a sign and it works well.

To go to Gray or Dole. People who are going to Dijon takes this road as well. It might be a little bit long as cars are going 70km/h here but there is enough room to stop. You can reach this spot by taking the Tramway to CHRU Minjoz and walk few minutes. I tried this spot few times and it worked all the time. Average is about 30 minutes ...
To go to Lyon, there is a little space for cars to pull out, a sign helps.

I think this spot is the best to go to A6 north, you can wait just near the traffic lights, and drivers can pull off on the bus line so there are not bothering other cars. Buses come every 5 minutes, so there is some time for real hitchhiking. A sign with A6/Peage definitively helps. If you can get a ride to Villefranche peage or the gas station on the A6 near Limonest, then you can find a car going further!
To go there, go to Perrache train station (tramway and subway also going), then it is 2 minutes walk from there.

To go to Annecy or Chamonix, no need for a sign as the direction is fairly obvious and people can give you a ride to at least Ugine. I was waiting before the exit of the roundabout, but it is fairly wide so people can stop without bothering other cars.

I have tried this place numerous times, and it works perfectly. People have space to pull off, and have time to see you. I usually get a ride to Annecy, but you have to ask to be left at the toll station (Peage), or you will have some difficulties to find your way back to the highway! People are mainly going to Annecy with the high speed road (free contrary to the highway), but the end point of this one is just near the north toll to the highway so drivers are usually okay to drop there.

fr_FR.description: Super spot pour aller vers le Sud, la plupart des conducteurs vont à Annecy par la départementale donc il faut absolument demander au début qu'ils vous laissent au péage d'Annecy si vous voulez continuer vers Lyon ou vers le Sud. La route nationale arrive pas très loin du péage nord donc généralement les conducteurs sont ok.

comments.comment: Spent a half day here wanting to go south.

en_UK.description: Aire des Herbiers - autoroute service station on the side of the autoroute going north (you can also access south direction from here). It is also an exit to road D755.

comments.comment: A reasonable spot to get you out to the sortie #6 of autoroute A83 which goes south towards Niort and onto the E5 towards Bordeaux or Poitiers.

en_UK.description: Slip road onto D948, a bit of a curve and cars going at a medium speed but good enough with many cars passing.

comments.comment: Lots of cars that were going north stopped for me. I got a great lift south after 45 minutes. Pleasant place.

en_UK.description: Entrance to autoroute A83 (north and south), good visibility, safe, space for cars to pull in, toilet and drinking water nearby.

comments.comment: Spent a total of 4 hours (2hrs at night, 2hrs the next morning) here trying to hitch south with no success. Hitched back to exit 6 (further north) and got a lift south from there no problem.

en_UK.description: Entrance #7 onto autoroute A83 north and south. Good visibility and space.
A shit place to hitch hike, roughly one car every 2 minutes. However if you had no luck in Bern then you may want to come here because you can ask drivers to take you to the next service station
